loans.name: Sunariyah

texts.id: Usaha warung kelontong atau sembako yang dijalani oleh Sunariyah (41) cukup berkembang. Setelah melunasi semua pinjamannya yang pertama, kali ini dia bermaksud untuk meminjam modal lagi . Modal nanti akan dipakai untuk belanja kebutuhan warung sehingga jenis jualannya bisa bertambah banyak, dan berdampak pada penghasilannya yang bertambah. Pinjaman sebelumnya selain untuk mengembangkan usaha, juga dipakai untuk memperbaiki warungnya. Saat ini begitu banyak pembeli yang datang ke warungnya dengan pendapatan per minggu mencapai Rp.800.000. Usaha warung yang dijalaninya juga membuat dia bisa menyisihkan sedikit untuk tabungan.
texts.en:
The kiosk that sells small items of basic necessities run by Sunariyah (41) is blooming. After completing all of her first loan, she now plans to borrow additional capital. The capital will be used to buy kiosk needs, so that she could offer more selections, and could increase her income. Previous loan besides being used to expand her business, was also used to repair her kiosk. That time many customers came to her kiosk, and her income could reach Rp800,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). This kiosk business allows her to save a little.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Kristina Eka

texts.id: Pinjaman senilai Rp.1.000.000 sebelumnya telah dipergunakan oleh Kristina sebagai modal dalam mendukung usaha jual kacang hijau. Saat ini Kristina memasuki pinjaman periode kedua, dan dia berharap dia bisa mendapatkan bantuan modal lebih banyak dari sebelumnya. Dari pinjaman sebelumnya Kristina berhasil meningkatkan pendapatannya dari Rp.50.000 menjadi Rp.70.000 per hari. Hal ini sangat positif dan berpengaruh pada proses pengembalian pinjaman. Rencananya pinjaman kedua ini akan dipakai untuk membeli bahan pembuat es kacang hijau dan juga untuk membuka warung sendiri. Saat ini suaminyalah yang menjajakan kacang hijau buatannya dengan cara berkeliling dengan sepeda motor.
texts.en:
Earlier loan of Rp 1,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00) was used by Kristina as capital to support her green beans business. This time Kristina is entering her second period loan, and she hopes that she could receive higher capital help than earlier. From previous loan, Kristina was able to increase her income from Rp50,000 to Rp70,000/day. This was very positive, and has affected her timely loan payments. The plan for this second loan is to buy materials to make green beans ice drinks , and to open her own food stall. At this time her husband sells her gree beans by offering around the area by motor cycle.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil (his brother is pictured above) lives in Khachmaz town, where he is married with two children. He was born in 1952. Five years ago he started farming. He is currently requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his farming business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve his farming business

loans.name: Inon

texts.id: Pinjaman senilai Rp.1.000.000 yang sebelumnya Inon terima telah dipakai untuk menambah isi warung minumannya. Saat ini, selain menjual minuman kemasan seperti Fanta dan Cocacola, dia juga sudah bisa menjual aneka jus buah di warungnya. Pinjaman periode pertama dipakai untuk membeli buah dan alat untuk membuat jus (blender). Setiap hari dia belanja buah-buahan di Pasar Anyar Sari dengan diantar oleh suaminya Jhony. Selain menjadi minuman kesukaan masyarakat sekitar, Inon juga merasa beruntung karena tempat dia berjualan minuman dan jus buah tepat bersebelahan dengan warung makan. Setiap minggunya, dia bisa mendapat keuntungan bersih Rp.200.000, tergantung banyaknya pelanggan. Inon berharap, setelah dia melunasi pinjamannya yang pertama dengan baik, kali ini dia bisa diberi modal lagi untuk mendukung usaha jual minumannya.
texts.en:
Initial loan of Rp 1,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00) that Inon received earlier has been used to increase inventory of her Drink stall. This time besides selling sodas like Fanta & Coca Cola, she has also been able to sell Fruit juice in her stall. First period loan was used to buy fruits and a blender. Every day she shops for fruits at Anyar Sari market, driven by her husband Jhony. Besides being the favorite drink of surrounding area, Inon feels lucky since the place she sells drinks and juice is next to a food stall. Every sunday, she could have a nett profit of approximately Rp 200,000, depending on the number of customers. Inon hopes that after finishing her first loan well, she would be given additional capital to support her drinks business.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Khalad

texts.en:
Khalad is 23 years old. He is engaged but still not married. He lives with his own nuclear family. He is a carpenter, a business that he has been involved in for more than 8 years now. He is a good worker, and he employs 3 other workers, although his shop is small. He needs a bigger one but he hasn't been able to make his shop larger; for that he needs a loan.

So he has requested to take out an individual loan of US$ 1075 to complete his stock materials and change his shop to make it larger so as to make a good income and get ready for his wedding. He is sure that he can do it with this loan.

Khalad would like to thank AFSG and Kiva for making this opportunity possible for people of his country, especially for hard workers. He would like to grow his business day by day. Finally, he wants to thank all lenders around the world who help people.

loans.use: To complete his stock and enlarge his workshop

loans.name: Suharni

texts.id: Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Suharni (33). Pinjaman sebelumnya dipakai untuk membeli rombong yang dipakai untuk menjalankan usaha jual bakso miliknya. Sebelumnya dia hanya memiliki satu rombong yang dipakai oleh suaminya Muhammad Ansori, tetapi dengan bantuan pinjaman dari KIVA melalui DINARI sekarang dia sudah memiliki dua rombang. Oleh karena rombongnya bertambah, pastinya modal untuk berjualan bakso untuk dua rombong juga bertambah. Karena itu, dia sangat berharap mendapat bantuan pinjaman modal untuk yang kedua, sehingga nantinya bisa menjalankan usahanya ini dengan baik. Suharni sangat berharap dari pinjaman kali ini, pengahsilannya semakin bertambah dan bisa dipakai sebagai tabungan bagi pendidikan anaknya Fika (4) nantinya.
texts.en:
This loan represents a second loan for Suharni (age 33). The earlier loan was used to purchase pushcart used for her meatball soup business. Initially, she owns only 1 pushcart used by her husband, Muhammad Ansori, but with the aid provided by the first loan from KIVA through DINARI she now own 2 pushcarts. Because of the additional pushcart, funding needed for selling meatball soup for 2 pushcarts increased. Due to that, she hopes to receive a second funding loan, in order to operate her business more effectively. Suharni expects that from this loan, revenue will continue to increase and will be saved for her child’s, Fika (age 4), education in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Working Capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Safrida

texts.id: Masakan Padang yang menjadi menu utama di warung makan milik Safrida (50) merupakan makanan favorit bagi sebagian besar pelanggannya. Pinjaman periode pertama telah dilunasi dan pinjaman modal yang diberikan dipakai sebagai modal untuk mendukung usaha warungnya. Selain itu, yang paling penting adalah bahwa pinjaman dari KIVA telah sangat membantu sehingga sekarang dia bisa meningkatkan pendapatannya dari Rp.200.000 per minggu menjadi Rp.300.00. Dengan system pembayaran yang sebelumnya lancer dan tidak macet, dia berharap kali ini dia bisa diberi pinjaman modal usaha yang lebih besar, sehingga nantinya bisa mengembangkan usaha warungnya menjadi lebih besar lagi.
texts.en:
Dishes from Padang, the capital city of the Province of Western Sumatra in Indonesia, has become the primary menu items at Inon’s (age 50) restaurant, also the favorite dishes of the majority of her customers. The initial loan has been repaid and was used as funding to support her restaurant business. In addition, more importantly the loan from KIVA had assisted significantly until her revenue increased from Rp.200.000 (about USD22) per week to Rp.300.000 (about USD32). With this gradual repayment scheme, she hopes this time given this larger working capital loan, so that her restaurant business will develop and be bigger.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Working Capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chen Y. is a 26-year-old farmer, earning about US$ 1 per day, while her husband, Mr. Yon Nann, also 26 years old, is a fisherman. He has been fishing since 2003 in Tunle Sap Lake and can earn US$ 2 per day, and fishing is also the main source of income for the family. Chen and her husband live with four children in Koktlok Le Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Because of the growing fishing business of her husband, Chen is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 550 for her husband to purchase fishing implements. This loan will help to expand her husband's business, so it will improve their family's income. Chen's husband is pictured because Chen was unvailable.

loans.use: For her husband to purchase fishing implements

loans.name: Sart

texts.en: Mrs. Sart S., 35 years old, is a widower. She purchases used goods from villagers' homes which she resells. She uses a bicycle for transporting her goods around the town. She earns around US $3 per day from this activity. She has been running her business since 1998 and lives with three children in Chikreng Commune, Siem Reap Province. Her business has been growing recently, and she has therefore requested a loan of US $500 to purchase a second motorcycle to help her transport goods for her business. The loan will support her family’s living payment sufficiently.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle to help her transport goods

loans.name: Abou Niassa

texts.fr: Abou Niassa D. est un Maréyeur de profession mais il gère un poulailler depuis quelques temps. Marié  et  Père de 3 enfants il a une expérience de plus de 2ans dans le secteur de l'aviculture. IL demande ce prêt pour acheter de l'aliment pour la nourriture  du volaille
texts.en:
Abou Niassa D. is a fish trader by profession but he has managed a poultry farm for some time. Married and the father of 3 children, he has had more than two years experience in poultry raising. He is requesting this loan to buy chicken feed for his poultry business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of chicken feed

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna C., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Man Tivoe, 26, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and have one son.

Mr. Veasna has been a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh for five years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. Currently, his motorcycle is very old and broken so often; he needs to replace it with a new one to run his business. Thus, Veasna is requesting a loan of $200 to help him purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To help replace his old motor taxi

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng C., 33, and her husband, Mr. Thy Chamroeun, 46, who live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter.

Mrs. Loeng has been a silk weaver since 1993, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a boat builder for over twenty years.

Mrs. Loeng is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov V., 26, and her husband, Mr. Vandoeun Nov, 36, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have three children: two sons and one daughter.

Mrs. Sreypov has been selling longan [an Asian fruit] and jasmine flowers since 2000. She has been buying them from farmers in her village to sell at a market in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase jasmine flowers and longan from a farmer on contract. She needs to pay the farmer first, before the harvest season.

loans.use: To purchase longans and jasmine flowers from a farmer on forward contract.

loans.name: Rubaba

texts.en: Rubaba lives in Khachmaz town. Her brother is pictured. She was born in 1952. Rubaba is a mother of 2 children. She is a widow. Now she needs a loan of  $1200 to buy 2 calves for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng P., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Norng, 36, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both children study at a local school.

Mr. Heng has been a remoque (motorbike with a trailer at the back) motor taxi driver along National Road Number Two for two years, while Mrs. Sophy has been farming for five years. Now Heng’s trailer is very old and broken. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new trailer to replace the old one.

loans.use: To replace the trailer of his 'remoque' motor taxi.

loans.name: Savet

texts.en: Mrs. Savet C., 44, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Hul, 46, live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. All of their sons are in school and their daughter is a silk weaver. Mr. Buntheoun grows rice and vegetables in a farm in the village. Mrs. Savet has been a silk weaver since she was very young. She learnt the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.  Mr. Bunthoeun grows rice and vegetables in the farm in the village. Savet is requesting a loan of $250 to add to the money she has saved to buy a bull for her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a bull for farming.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C., 44, and her husband, Mr. Sokhum Chea, 54, who live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their sons is a monk and the other one works in garment factory. Their daughter works in a restaurant. Mrs. Srey has been selling firewood in the village for ten years, while her husband is a fisherman. Mrs. Srey is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase a boat and fishing nets for her husband continue his fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en: Bahruz (his brother is pictured above) lives in Khachmaz town, where he is married with two children. He was born in 1965. Bahruz has been in the farming business for ten years. He is requesting a loan of  $1200 USD to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve his farming business

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S., 61, and her husband, Mr. Oeun Kim, 61, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1973 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Two sons study in local school, and one daughter weaves silk at home.

Mrs. Saroeun has been a silk weaver for forty-seven years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Oeun raises cows.

Saroeun is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sadulla

texts.en: Sadulla lives in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1959, is married, and has 4 children. He has run this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en:
Amaka N., 35, has been selling prepared foods and beverages in her restaurant for the past four years. She learned this business on her own. She is married, has four children, and lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Amaka has used loans over the past three years to improve her business. She is requesting a new loan to purchase a larger inventory of drinks and food items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages and food items for resale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. lives in Igbelerin-Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells clothes and drinks, and she is also a hair stylist. Comfort learned how to style hair for 3 years. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. She is a LAPO client. Comfort makes lovely hairstyles with hair extensions for her customers. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more clothes and drinks for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and clothes for sale

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is 22 years old and is married with a 5 month old child. She has been a bite and porridge seller since 2006. She works everyday from 6am to 5pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Zaina has previously taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zaina now requests a new loan to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To increase her current stock.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is married with 32, 29 and 25 year old children. She has owned her own crafts shop since 2001.She works from 10am to 7pm everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Subira has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Subira now requests a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: Sevda has been in the consulting service business for 10 years. She is single. Sevda was born  in 1980. She lives in Baku city. Now she needs a loan of  US$ 800 to buy a printer to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a printer for her business

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel N. sells bags of sugar, bags of rice and gallon jugs of palm oil. She has been in this business since 2006.

Rachel lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 47-years-old and married with six children. She is requesting this current loan amount of $875 to purchase more bags of sugar and rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer Y. has been selling loaves of bread since 2003. She is 30-years-old, married and the mother of three children. The family lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. Jennifer is requesting a loan to purchase more loaves of bread for resale to keep up with the demand.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread for resale

loans.name: Saliu

texts.en: Saliu F.,38, sells electrical parts and construction materials. She has been in this business since 2005. Saliu is married with four children and lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting a new loan to purchase a larger inventory of construction and electrical products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of construction and electrical supplies for resale

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello F. has been selling firewood in her community of Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria for the past seven years. Women in Nigeria use firewood for cooking if they cannot afford kerosene and gas. She is 39-years-old and married with three children.

She is requesting a loan amount of $1200 to buy more firewood for sale so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for resale

loans.name: Aisha  Heri Ina Mungu Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 7 years old. She has been a clothes and fried fish seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

In the past, Aisha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Aisha is now requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Tatu and Salha, who have businesses dealing with selling bites and clothes.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan who has settled in Khirdalan town. He is married and has two children. Ten years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy the necessary materials to make furniture and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for making furniture

loans.name: Ireti

texts.en:
Ireti A., 37-years-old and single, lives in Odusin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and is also a fashion designer. She learned how to sew clothes three years ago, and has owned her business since 2003. Ireti makes lovely Nigerian designs which have attracted more customers to her shop. Her clients are happy with her choice of styles.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her store and expresses her gratitude.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Silifat

texts.en:
Silifat A.,53, has been selling tubers of yams since 1996 at the Sheriki Market, located off the Badagry express road. Silifat is married with two children and lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria.

Yam is an essential commodity in Nigeria because it can be prepared by frying, boiling, and roasting. Most Nigerians love yams. A loan will allow Silifat to purchase more yams for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more yams for resale

loans.name: Titilope Rebecca

texts.en:
Titilope Rebecca F., 41, has been a fashion designer since 1991 and sells clothing that she sews and clothes that she purchases from companies. She learned how to sew clothes three years ago. Titilope lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria with her husband and three children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for resale and a sewing machine, so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel has his own home (on Antofagasta Street in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz). He is a widower and receives a retirement pension on which he supports himself, covering only the most basic necessities. The loan he seeks is for refurbishing one room in his house, which he uses as his bedroom.

His previous history is favorable, and we qualify him as a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ezequiel tiene casa propia (calle Antofagasta de la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz), es viudo y percibe una renta de jubilado con al cual se mantiene y puede cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades. E El crédito que solicita es para la refacción de una habitación, la cual es su dormitorio. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y lo calificamos como un buen cliente.

loans.use: Making improvements to his home.

loans.name: Zulekha's Mola Tujalie Group

texts.en:
Zulekha is 44 years and is married with 4 children ages 26, 23, 19 and 8. She has been selling food since 2002. She works from 7am to 7pm everyday and she can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Zulekha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zulekha is now requesting a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses dealing with tailoring, clothing, firewood and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Kidawa's Tabia Njema Group

texts.en:
Kidawa is 31 years old and is divorced with an 8 year old child. She has been selling shoes and ladies and children's clothing since 2005. She works everyday from 8am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $43 from her sales.

In the past, Kidawa has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Kidawa now requests a new loan to buy more shoes and clothing for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also has a business selling shoes, clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothing inventory for her business.

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi A. sells wine and drinks in her community. She is a LAPO client. Oluwakemi is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ogun State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She loves her business and she desires to see it expand. She is requesting the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more wine and drinks. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more wine and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en:
Ajoke O. lives in Alagole, Ogun State, Nigeria. She is 56 years old and married with 6 children. Ajoke sells prayer items in her community. The demand for prayer items in her community is high, so she has lots of customers. She opens her prayer store daily. She makes even more sales on Sundays.

Ajoke has been in this business since the year 2004. Ajoke is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more prayer items for re-sale. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more prayer items for re-sale

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo T. lives in Okoko in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells drinks, groceries and food. She has been in this business for  a long time. Iyabo is 45 years old and is married with 4 children. The demand for her groceries, drinks, and food is high. 

She needs a loan of $450 to buy more groceries and a generator so that she can cool her drinks, thereby meeting the demands of her numerous customers. She says "thank you!"

loans.use: To buy a generator and more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mwanachum's Allah Karim Group

texts.en:
Mwanachum, 35 years old and married with three children aged nine, five and two, has owned a salon and sold cosmetics since 2005. She works everyday from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $33 from her business.

Mwanachum previously received two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business and now hopes to borrow $525 to buy more items for her enterprise. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zaituni, who also owns a salon and sells cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin A. sells foodstuffs and fish out of her house. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 42 years old and married with 2 children. Toyin lives at Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Toyin needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy a deep freezer so that she can add the selling of drinks to her business, so that she can cool the drinks for her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora U. is 45-years-old, married and has eight children. The family lives in Afro Media, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells fish in her neighborhood by going directly to the houses of her customers. This proactive approach of selling increases her profit compared to selling the fish from her house. She started this business in 2000.

Flora is requesting a loan to buy one deep freezer so that she can ice the fish before taking it with her on her sales route. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy one deep freezer for icing fish

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana Y. is 48 years old and has 6 children. She lives in Igbo-elerin, Lagos, Nigeria. 

Christiana is a hardworking woman. She sells provisions, such as bathing soap, detergent, and toothpaste. She also sells drinks and food. 

She needs a loan for $600 to buy drinks and food. She says "thank you!"

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina A. is 39-years-old, married and has five children. The family lives in Matogun, Ogun State, Nigeria. She sells bags of flour, semolina, and sugar to customers who use the products to bake breads. She has been in this business since 2004. The demand for flour and sugar is high and her customer base is increasing.

Justina is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of flour and sugar to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Cruz Del Sur Group

texts.en:
The Cruz del Sur group is maD. up of nine women and three men, all of whom live in a rural area outsiD. of El Alto, Bolivia. Most of the group members come from families of five or six people with limited resources and live in adobe houses.

The group is involved in various activies, but mostly in the food and clothing sales sectors. More specifically, Wilfredo, Valeria, Santuza, Eugenia and Salome make and sell clothing (sweaters, skirts and shawls). Viviana, Cristina, Feliza and Vicenta sell food, including prepared meals, chicken, fruits and chuño (dried potato). Santiago is a policeman, and Juan Carlos works as a mechanic.

For the most part, the group members plan to use their share of the loan to increase their inventory or to buy raw materials and ingredients to sew clothing and prepare food. Though there is healthy competition in all of these areas, most of the group members are able to remain competitive by offering a wiD. variety of inventory and introducing new items.

Most of the group members have had previous loans, either with this group or in other similar groups at different microfinance institutions.

loans.use: bulk purchase of food and materials to make clothing

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose O. sells beverages and a homemade pepper soup. She has been in this business since 1995. Bose is 42-years-old, married with four children and lives in Ishaga, Lagos State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan amount of $1200 to purchase more beverages and ingredients for her pepper soup. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages and pepper soup ingredients

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake A. sells cooked foods like rice, beans, boiled yam and drinks.  She has been in this business for the past 7 years. She is 32 years old and married with 2 children. Folake lives in Igbo-elerin, Lagos state, Nigeria. Folake is faced with the problem of inconsistency with her electricity supply. She is not happy with this because she is not able to cool her drinks for her customers. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy one generator for the continuous supply of electricity. This, according to her, will increase the satisfaction of her customers and thereby increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy one generator

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina E., age 28, is married with 2 children ages 14 and 12. Christina owns a small stand in Kimara where she sells fresh vegetables, chicken, fries, and eggs. She has had this business for one year; before this, she was selling only fries in an area called Mbezi. She works daily from 7am until 9pm, but will stay open until 11pm to sell fries, the late night snack of Dar es Salaam. She has done well with her business and is now earning a monthly profit of around US$ 860.

This will be Christina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two to start her vegetable business, buy utensils to cook with, and to buy feed for the chickens. She has paid the loans back successfully. With the loan she hopes to receive now, she will purchase additional food supplies to sell in the evenings during the month of Ramadan.

Christina is part of a group called Uvumilivu. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stocks of food for re-sale

loans.name: Karla Geraldina

texts.es:
Karla is a woman who is very dedicated to work. She is 33 years old, lives in the Laureles Sur area, is married and has one son who is 18 years old and starting secondary school. Her husband, a mechanic, fixes cars. Karla has been selling spare car parts for four years, having started her business with her own money. She rises at 5:00 am to take care of her household chores and fix breakfast for her family, since by 8:00 am she has to be at her stand to start selling her products. She sells her wares on Altamira Street, a road that is very busy on a daily basis. The money she is soliciting is to invest into more products for various model cars, so this way she has a better variety of goods to offer to her customers. Her plan is to establish an auto parts store since the products sell well at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Karla es una mujer dedicada al trabajo, tiene 33 años de edad, habita en los Laureles sur, es casada y tiene un hijo de dieciocho años de edad que está estudiando en la secundaria, su esposo trabaja reparando motos, ya que es mecánico. Doña Karla vende repuestos de motos y tiene cuatro años de estar vendiendo, comenzó con dinero propio, ella se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para dejar sus oficios hechos y preparar el desayuno a su familia por que a las ocho de la mañana tiene que estar en su puesto para vender sus productos, el local donde vende ella es carretera Altamira, una calle muy transitada diariamente. El dinero solicitado es para invertir más en los productos de modelos para moto y así ofrecer variados productos a sus clientes. Sus planes son establecer una tienda de repuestos de motos ya que se venden mucho en el mercado

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of spare car parts to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a woman who is a fighter and who, from a very young age, has had to work to support her children and husband so that they are not lacking in basic needs. Her husband works in an enterprise selling soft drinks. Julia is 54 years old, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She has two children, ages 12 and 20. Julia’s business is comprised of selling video games and other products such as wood and perishables. It has been two years since she started the business, and things are going well for her, despite the fact that she has some competition from her neighbor. The money she is soliciting is to invest into working capital to buy video games, so she can have a satisfied customer base given the variety and availability of her products. In the future, she would like to make improvements to her work area, diversify her product base and capture more clients. She also dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es una mujer luchadora, desde muy joven le ha tocado trabajar para apoyar a sus hijos y a su esposo para que no le falte nada a su familia, su esposo trabaja en ventas en una empresa de gaseosas. Julia tiene 54 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, sus hijos son dos, uno de 12 y otro de 20 años de edad. El negocio de Julia es videos juegos y vende otros productos como leña, productos perecederos. Son dos años de estar en este negocio y le va bien, ha encontrado algunos inconvenientes con su vecina ya que tiene la competencia. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de videos juegos, y así mantener a sus clientes satisfechos con la variedad. A futuro es ampliar el local, diversificar los productos y captar mas clientes; y también su sueño es ver convertido a sus hijos en profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of video games.

loans.name: Rukia Kulendea's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Rukia K., age 42, is widowed with three children. She has been involved in her business for 15 years. She sells vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics) door-to-door. She works from 11am to 4pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $517. She purchases her supplies in the neighboring country of Burundi, and heads there once a month to restock.

This will be Rukia’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She intends to use the loan to pay rent for a small shop in the Kimara area, where she will be able to sell the vitenge. She will share this loan with her group, Uvumilivu. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Rukia is on the far left.

loans.use: To pay rent for a small shop

loans.name: Tabia Lyanzila's Changamoto Group

texts.en:
Tabia L. is 42 years old and married with three children, ages 21, 19, and 16. She owns a small stand in Vingunguti where she sells drinks, like soda, milk, and water. She's had this business for three years and works from 7 am to 9 pm everyday. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $52-76.

This will be Tabia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and she is very excited to get started! She intends to use it to purchase more stock of drinks and to add juice to the available options.

Tabia is part of subgroup A of Changamoto, which means "challenges" in Swahili. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Tabia is on the far left.

loans.use: To buy stock juice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.en:
The Las Margaritas communal bank is made up of eleven women and one man. Most of them have families of five (two parents and three children). Most are middle class, while some are from rural areas and have scarce resources. Most of the group lives in rented homes. They are involved in various economic activities: Maribel is a gym teacher; Juana and Eugenio sell sweets and cookies; Mery and Reyna own neighborhood stores; Alicia sells laundry detergent; Angelica has a liquor store; Ariana, Patricia and Jhovana sell cosmetics; Juana Alejandra is an elementary school teacher; and Pamela sells silpanchos (breaded, thin-sliced beef, a popular lunch or evening meal in Bolivia).

There is a fair amount of competition in all of these areas, but the group members remain competitive by quickly moving from market to market, offering a variety of merchandise and introducing new items frequently. Most of the group will use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

Since this is not the group's first loan, most of the group members have credit experience already. Other members have participated in previous group loans at other microfinance institutions.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell (detergent, cosmetics, liquor, sweets) and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Aminata Paulo's Dhahabu Group

texts.en:
Aminata P., age 32, is married with two boys ages 7 and 10. Aminata sells honey and chicken door-to-door in the Kimara area. She has been engaged in this business for four years and works daily from 8am to 6pm. Twice a month, she heads to the Tabora region (in the center of Tanzania) to purchase more honey. It takes her 4 days to go to Tabora and purchase supplies. She is able to earn a profit of US$ 259 per month from honey and US$ 172 from selling chicken.

This will be Aminata's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first one to go to Tabora to buy honey and chickens and is intending to use this next loan for the same purpose.

Aminata is part of subgroup B of Dhahabu (meaning "gold" in Swahili). The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. Other members of her group sell food and charcoal and one owns a salon. In the picture, Aminata is second from the right in a blue dress.

loans.use: To travel to Tabora to purchase honey and chicken

loans.name: Estela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Estela is 32 years old and lives in the Villa San Jacinto neighborhood. She has two children, ages 8 and 15, and is married. Her children are students, one is in primary school and the other one is in secondary school. Her husband works as a fisherman at an enterprise called Hans, and he is always congnizant of providing for his family so they do not need for anything. Estela has a grocery store stand at the capital’s market, where she spends all day offering her products. The household is cared for by her children, since one attends school in the morning and the other in the afternoon so they can coordinate chores. She has spent eight years in business, and inherited the stand from her mother. She has been involved in selling at the market since she was a young girl. The loan she is seeking is for working capital, in order to better supply her store and keep her customer base. Her future plan is to purchase another stand so she can increase her sales, and she hopes to enjoy good health to be able to help her children get ahead and complete their educations.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Estela tiene 32 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa San Jacinto, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 15 años de edad, es casada. Sus hijos están estudiando, uno en la primaria y otro en la secundaria, su esposo trabaja en una empresa que se llama Hans desempeñándose como armador y siempre está al pendiente que a su familia no le falte nada. Estela tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en un tramo de un mercado capitalino y pasa en su negocio todo el día, ofreciendo sus productos. Su vivienda la cuidan sus hijos ya que uno va en la mañana a clase y el otro va por la tarde entonces se coordinan. En este trabajo doña Julia tiene ocho años de experiencia, ya que este tramo fue herencia de su mamá, desde pequeña ha estado involucrada con este negocio en el mercado. El préstamo solicitado es para capital de trabajo, para surtir mas su tramo y mantener su clientela. Sus planes futuros son comprar un tramo más y así crecer en ventas, espera gozar de buena salud para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos con los estudios.

loans.use: Purchase basic supplies to stock her grocery stand.

loans.name: Judith Mumba's Green Tomalin Group

texts.en:
Judith M. is 35 and married. She has three children, ages 17, 13, and 4. She owns a salon in Mbezi but also makes house calls for her customers. She opened her salon two years ago and works from 8 am to 9 pm daily. Her monthly profit from the salon is about $43. To supplement this income, she also sells traditional Swahili dress called kangas, which increases her monthly income to $130.

Judith has received three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania that she used to increase the stock in her salon. She has paid back all three loans successfully. Similarly to the others, she intends to use this new loan to increase her stock of kangas and buy more products for her salon.

Judith is part of subgroup D of Green Tomalin. The other members of her subgroup sell clothes, hardware, and groceries. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Judith is wearing a black and white striped shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of kangas and salon products.

loans.name: Yohana Yamilet

texts.es:
Yohana lives in the Georgino Andrade neighbhorhood, is 33 years old and married, and has three children ages 2, 12 and 14. Her husband works as a contractor and supports his family. Yohana sells cosmetics, and has four years in sales. At times, her customers fail to pay her which is difficult because she loses money and inventory. It can be a risky business, but she does have good customers and has managed to get ahead. She started with her own funds and she would like to invest the funds from her loan into more merchandise. In the future, she sees growing her sales, capturing more customers to increase her earnings, educating her children and supporting her husband in maintaining the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Yohana habita en el barrio Georgino Andrade, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 2,12 y 14 años de edad, su esposo trabaja de contratista y apoya a su familia. Doña Yohana vende cosméticos y tiene cuatro años en las ventas, a veces le salen clientes que no le pagan y es difícil por que es dinero perdido y su inventario se viene abajo es un trabajo arriesgado pero no siempre es así ya que tiene buenas clientas y ha salido adelante, inició con fondos propios y con el dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en más mercadería. A futuro es crecer en las ventas, captar más clientes y así obtener mas ganancias, educar a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo en la manutención de la familia.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation eight years ago. He is a 38-year-old father of four kids who are currently in school. He sells products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. With the loan, he wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil to increase his stock of goods.

With increased stocks of different varieties of goods, he hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of his children. He would appreciate assistance very much.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.en:
The Sagrado Corazon (Holy Heart) communal bank is maD. up of ten women and three men. Most of the group members have families of five (two parents and three children). Most are middle class, though some are from rural areas and have limited resources. Some of the group members own their own adobe homes, while others rent.

The group is involved in various economic activities: Elizabeth sells cleaning supplies; Julia and Julia Benita each work at and own a general store; Antonia and Lourdes sell bedcovers and bed pads; Juana sells sweets and drinks; Catalina sells dairy products like milk and cheese; Santa Nery sells fruit; Lidia works at a local cell-phone company store; Duglas is a mechanic; Marco Antonio is a reporter; and Edson does upholstery. The group members have different levels of experience in their businesses--some have been in business for just one year, while others, like Panfila, Santa Nery and Catalina, have been in business for 20 years.

Most of the group members will use their loans to purchase more merchandise to sell. There is a fair amount of competition in all of these areas, but the group members manage to stay competitive by offering a wiD. variety of merchandise and introducing new products. Most of them have experience with previous loans, both with the Sagrado Corazon group and with other groups at similar microfinance institutions in Bolivia.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise, such as fruit, drinks, sweets, dairy products, and bedspreads

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso is 49 years old, and lives with his wife and three children. He is a father who worries always about how to support his family, and to do so he has dedicated himself to agriculture for more than 30 years. He grows potatoes and other crops of the area, although he has cut back some on these activities since opening his small grocery store eight years ago. He offers many types of products and, in this way, Celso can advance economically. He tends to his store all day long with the help of his children, so he can still care for his crops. Celso is constantly motivated by his strong work ethic and, also, by his desire to meet the needs of his family. He seeks a loan to be able to add merchandise to his store’s inventory, and also to buy bags of fertilizer for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Celso tiene 49 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos. Es un padre de familia que se preocupa siempre por sostener a su familia, y para hacerlo se dedica a las actividades agrícolas desde hace más de 30 años, cultivando la papa y otros productos de su zona, hasta ahora se viene dedicando a ello, pero en menor proporción porque hace 8 años decide abrir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la cual ofrece todo tipo de artículos de pan llevar, de esta manera, Celso puede tener las entradas económicas, la atención que dedica, es todo el día, y sus hijos le apoyan en esto para que también no descuide sus tierras de cultivo. Celso está motivado constantemente por la costumbre que tiene de trabajar, y además, atender las necesidades de su familia. Solicita un préstamo para incrementar la mercadería de su tienda y también poder comprar sacos de abono para la próxima siembra.

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in his store, and to buy fertilizer for his land/crops.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes P. is 30 years old. She is married and has three kids who are currently in school. She sells maize in the local market of Sunyani, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She requests a loan to enable her buy maize in bulk to grow her business and scale up her sales.

Agnes hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education to give them better future career opportunities. She belongs to the community group called Benjamin Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of maize.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: For the past eight years, Yaa B. has been trading in the local market of Sunyani in Ghana. She is 30 years old and married with three kids who are in school. She is a busy trader who sells palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc. on top of a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: Yaa would like to purchase more supplies for her small grocery stand.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. started selling fish five years ago in Techiemantia, a suburb of Sunyani where she lives. Grace prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good-quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is now 45 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of assorted fish to increase her sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She belongs to the community group called Benjamin Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan.

loans.use: Grace would like to buy more stock of smoked fish for her fish stand.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Married with four kids who are currently in school, Amina O. is 46 years old. She sells food like cassava, plantain, maize, etc. in the local market of Sunyani where she lives. Selling for the past eight years, she has a lot of selling experience to win customers.

Amina is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future careers. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of cassava, plantain, maize, beans, etc. to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called Janet Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of cassava, plantain, maize, beans, etc.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is a widow with six children. Currently, two of them are in school but the others have completed high school. She lost her husband through a prolonged illness. According to Georgina, she works very hard because the total responsibility of the kids rests on her shoulders as a single parent. She is now 49 years old. She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by 'hawking', which is door to door sales. Georgina is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her kids in school. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for that support.

loans.use: Georgina would like to increase her stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: For the past eight years, Florence has been trading in the local market of Sunyani in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is 29 years old and married with three kids who are schooling. She is a busy trader who sells palm oil and other products like tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans and maize on top of a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which slows her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase more stock to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: Florence would like to increase her stock of palm oil, tin tomatoes, yams, etc. for her small food stand.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama T. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’ignames à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité plus depuis plus de 6 ans et souhaite par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des ignames dans des villages environnants pour la revente et  aussi louer un magasin pour le stockage de ses marchandises. Les gains de ses ventes lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Ama est celle habillée en corsage rose.
texts.en:
Ama T. is 52, married, and mother of 5 children. She sells yams in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been in this business for more than 6 years and is hoping with this, her second loan from FECECAV, to bolster her business by buying yams in the surrounding villages for re-sale. She also hopes to rent a place to store her merchandise. The increased sales will allow her to provide better for the needs of her children. Ama is the one who is wearing a pink bodice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy yams in the surrounding villages and rent a place to store her merchandise

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been trading in the local market of Sunyani in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 51-year-old woman, a widow and mother of three children who are currently schooling. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other foodstuffs such as beans and maize on top of a table in the market.

Beatrice does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which retards her business progress. With this loan, she wants to inject more working capital into her business to purchase increased inventory to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of palm oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Felix Bautista

texts.es:
Felix is 39 year old, and lives with his wife and four children. He is a head of household who works tirelessly to improve the standard of living of his family, always looking for opportunities to help himself and his family get ahead. For these reasons, he currently works selling wood at wholesale. It is hard work, and involves first buying the eucalyptus trees so that later he himself can cut them down into smaller pieces of wood. His primary tools are an electric saw and an axe. Once Felix has finished cutting, he selects what he is going to move and the amount that will fit into his truck for transport. Felix has been in this business for five years, and this actity has allowed him to support the education of his four children. He also plants and tends to several crops, including potatoes, on his land. Felix makes great efforts to see his family get ahead each and every day, which is why he always seeks opportunities that may help him in this endeavor. He seeks a loan to buy more trees so he can take advantage of the upcoming winter season when trees are scarce. He hopes to, in this way, stabilize his earnings and have the ability to produce a greater quantity of product to offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Félix tiene 39 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos. Es un padre de familia que trabaja arduamente para poder mejorar la economía de su hogar, siempre ha buscado las oportunidades de desarrollo de su familia, por los cual está trabajando en la actualidad en la venta de leña al por mayor, es duro el trabajo, consiste en comprar árboles enteros de eucalipto para luego, él mismo, cortarlos y darle la forma de leña, cuyos instrumentos principales de trabajo son una sierra eléctrica y su hacha, una vez que Félix a terminado de cortar, los selecciona para arrimarlos y tener la suficiente cantidad para su transporte en camión, de esa manera reparte al por mayor la leña que produce, Félix viene produciendo leña desde hace 5 años y esta actividad le permite poder sostener la educación de sus 4 hijos, también no descuida el cultivo de su terrenos en las cuales siembra papa y otros productos. Félix se esfuerza porque quiere ver a su familia superándose cada día, es por ello que seguirá en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades para los suyos. Solicita un crédito con la cual podrá comprar más árboles y de esa manera afrontar la época de invierno donde existe la escasez de árboles y así mantener estable sus ganancias, su meta es producir en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Buy more trees to continue his business selling wood.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.en:
The San Juan group is maD. up of twelve women and two men, most of whom work in different business sectors. Silvia and Felicia work as domestic help; Jose is a mechanic; Esperanza, Norah, Laida, Angelica and Marisabel sell food (chicken, prepared meals and gelatin desserts); Jesus is a carpenter; Melvi sells cosmetics; Aquilina sells veterinary supplies; and Nelda, Karen and Claudia all sell clothing. All of them have 8 years or less of experience working in their respective businesses, and they all plan to use their Kiva loans to purchase more materials or merchandise to sell.

Many of the women have worked with other microfinance institutions before. This is the second loan San Juan has taken out with AgroCapital.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell, such as cosmetics, veterinary supplies, clothing, and food

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is a 33-year-old merchant. She is married with three children. She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Sunyani for seven years. With income from her business, Esther is able to send all her kids to junior and senior high school.

Esther's major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business. She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that this loan will enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kids until they have completed school.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina is 49 years old. She currently cares for her son, as well as her 90-year-old father. She is very hard-working and, in addition to working at a local enterprise, she dedicates herself to raising chickens. She cares for them after getting home from work, feeding them, and when they are big enough she sells them based on orders she receives. At times, she butchers them herself to sell the meat at a higher price. Albina dedicates the most time to her animals on the weekends, since she doesn’t have to go to work. She must ensure she keeps them in good health because, if she didn’t protect them from disease, she would have difficulty with her sales. Albina has a great motivation to put forth all her efforts towards her work – her fourteen-year-old son. Albina’s dream is to raise not only chickens. She wants to buy some guinea pigs to expand her farm, which is why she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Albina tiene 49 años, en la actualidad cuida de su hijo y su anciano padre de 90 años de edad. Es muy trabajadora, además de trabajar para una empresa en su localidad, se dedica a la crianza de pollo, al regresar del trabajo atiende de ellos, dándoles de comer, cuando están bien crecidos y en peso los vende, de acuerdo a los pedidos que le solicitan, a veces ella misma los mata para vender su carne a mayor precio. Son los fines de semana cuando Albina se dedica más a sus animales, ya que no labora en la empresa. Debe prevenir que no tengan enfermedad alguna, porque esto perjudicaría mucho sus ventas. Albina tiene una gran motivación para todo su esfuerzo, su hijo de 14 años. El deseo de Albina no es solo criar pollos, sino también cuyes, por ello que solicita este préstamo para la compra de cuyes y así podrá implementar su granja.

loans.use: In addition to raising chickens, she would like to buy guinea pigs to generate more income.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is 44 years old and lives with her two children. She is a dynamic and hard-working person, dedicated to the sale of various types of livestock including sheep, pigs and cows. The cycle of her business entails her purchasing the animals at wholesale from the market. Those which are small, she spends time feeding and fattening, a process which takes about three months. She has carried out this activity for many years, since she was 18 years old. The obstacles that can present themselves at any time are varied and include, for example, the unanticipated death of an animal which thereby reduces her working capital. For this reason, Dolores is learning how to identify signs of sickness in her livestock. Her work keeps her occupied, and she enjoys what she’s doing particularly because she knows it’s for the well-being of her children. Dolores seeks a loan to invest into her livestock, and hopes to be able to purchase additional animals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dolores tiene 44 años y vive con sus dos hijos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y dinámica, se dedica a la venta de animales, tales como ovejas, cerdos y también vacas, su dinámica de trabajo consiste en comprar animales al por mayor en la feria, aquellos que están pequeños, para que luego de un tiempo los haga engordar y mejorar, ese proceso dura en un promedio de 3 meses.Esta actividad, la viene haciendo desde hace muchos años, desde que tenía 18 años de edad. Las dificultades se presentan son cuando por razones diversas, muere uno de sus animales disminuyendo su capital de trabajo, para lo cual, Dolores está aprendiendo a identificar los signos de enfermedad de los animales. Este trabajo lo hace para mantenerse ocupada, disfruta de lo que hace porque es para el bienestar de sus hijos. Dolores solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en su ganado, de esta manera, adquirir una mayor cantidad de ellos.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals that she raises and sells.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos is 34 years old and lives with his wife and son. He is a hard-working person, which he demonstrates each and every day as he carries out the arduous tasks of living in the countryside. He has been a farmer from the start, having inherited his lands – and the occupation – from his parents. With the passing of time, he has also implemented raising livestock into his enterprise. Each day, he takes his sheep to graze in the far reaches of his fields. He also raises pigs, which he later sells at the livestock markets (called Coto Coto) in Huancayo every 15 days. With these activities, he earns income to support the living expenses of his family. He faces difficult times, however, when livestock prices go down and he is not able to earn enough. Carlos, however, is learning every day how to run his business to the best end result. The constant motivation for his efforts is his family and, additionally, he is accustomed to these tasks since he has carried them out as he himself grew up. Carlos seeks a loan for working capital, specifically so he can buy well-balanced feed for his animals to make them healthier so he can obtain better prices at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 34 años y vive con su esposa y su hijo. Es una persona trabajadora y lo demuestra cada día en las arduas tareas del campo, es agricultor desde sus orígenes, ya que sus padres le heredaron sus tierras y la ocupación misma, con el paso de los años también se incorpora a las actividades ganaderas, donde todos los días sale al extenso campo para pastear sus ovejas, también cría cerdos y luego los vende en las ferias ganaderas en Huancayo que se llaman Coto Coto, a las cuales los lleva cada 15 días, y de esa manera obtener la ganancia que necesita para poder solventar los costos de sostener a su familia, muchas veces lo difícil para él es cuando le ofrecen precios demasiado bajos que no le permiten obtener sus ganancias, pero Carlos está cada día aprendiendo a ofertar sus ganados de manera que pueda ver los frutos. El motivo constante de sus esfuerzo es su familia, además, él está habituado a estas tareas, que las asumió como su forma de vida. Carlos solicita un préstamo con el que podrá mejorar su capital de trabajo, es decir sus animales, comprarles alimento balanceado, para que sean mejor cotizados y de esa manera obtener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: To improve the quality of his livestock, to purchase additional animals, and to buy well-balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Agrinya

texts.fr: Agrinya O. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle réside à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Ama souhaite avec ce crédit satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle en achetant des cartons de piles, de laits, de savons et autres produits. Les profits  lui assureront une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agrinya O. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Agrinya hopes to use this loan to satisfy the demand of her clientele by buying cases of batteries, milk, soap, and other products. The profits will ensure an improvement in living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cases of batteries, milk, soap, and other products for re-sale

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer dedicated to studying the land and to the cultivation of potato, corn and beans. After planting his crops he spends six anxious months awaiting the fruits of his labor. His farming generates earnings that allow him to support his family. He takes his products to the city of Huancayo to sell throughout the primary markets of that town. Marcelino is always vigilant of his farmland, making sure to keep tabs on any possible pest infestations or diseases that may harm his crops. While he waits for the planting season (six months), he dedicates himself to selling small electronics that he buys on his trips into the city to acquaintances. This activity, however, does not generate the desired income. Marcelino is motivated, day in and day out, by his desire to better provide for his family and by his wish for his children to complete their educations so that they can look forward to bright futures. He seeks a loan with which to buy products for planting his crops, such as sacks of fertilizer, to be able to improve his yield in the future. He also hopes to continue to grow his small appliance business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelino tiene 40 años y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos. Es un agricultor dedicado a las tareas de la siembra, y a la cosecha de papa, maíz y arveja que luego de sembrar espera 6 meses la ansiada cosecha, que le permite, con sus ganancias, sostener a su familia, para lo cual, lleva toda su cosecha directamente a la ciudad de Huancayo para venderla en sus principales mercados. Marcelino siempre está vigilante todos los días de sus campos de cultivo para estar pendiente si entró alguna plaga o enfermedad en sus plantaciones. Mientras espera la época de la cosecha (6 meses) se dedica a vender a las personas que conoce pequeños artefactos eléctricos que compró en su viaje a la ciudad, para él lo más difícil es cuando no valoran el precio de sus productos, eso no le permite obtener las ganancias deseadas. Marcelino está motivado cada día, porque desea darle lo mejor a su familia, que sus hijos se superen a través del estudio. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar para la siembra, sacos de abono y fertilizantes y a un futuro poder mejorar su cosecha, a la par mantener su creciente negocio de venta de artefactos.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for planting his next crop.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two of his seven children. He is a very persevering and hard-working man who has dedicated himself for many years, since his childhood, to farming. He plants a number of crops including a variety of potatoes, peas, beans and corn. He thinks that business is mediocre given the low prices that are being offered in the markets and, due to this, he doesn’t allow his vegetables to be sold by means of intermediaries. Instead, he takes them directly to the city where he can sell them himself for a better profit. He also dedicates himself to raising farm animals such as horses. Julián conducts these activities because they are a lifestyle to which he is accustomed, even though he doesn’t have the same energy he used to. Additionally, several years ago Julián opened a small store in his home. Julián continues to make great efforts in his work because he wants to continue to support his two children who remain at home. He seeks a loan to invest into his farming endeavors, specifically to buy fertilizer, as well more merchandise to better supply his small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián tiene 34 años y actualmente vive con su esposa y 2 de sus 7 hijos. Es un hombre muy perseverante y trabajador, se dedicado durante muchos años, desde su niñez, a las actividades agrícolas, siembra diversos productos, tales como la papa en sus diversas variedades, arveja, habas y maíz, él considera que le va regular porque son muy bajos los precios que se ofertan en el mercado, es por eso, que no admite vender sus productos por medio de intermediarios y directamente los lleva a la ciudad, donde puede recibir la ganancia, también se dedica a la crianza de animales, tales como el caballo, Julián realiza estas actividades porque es su estilo de vida, a las cuales está acostumbrado, a pesar que ahora sus fuerzas no son como antes. Adicionalmente hace pocos años, Julián abrió una pequeña tienda en su casa.} Julián sigue esforzándose porque quiere seguir apoyando a sus dos últimos hijos, quienes viven con a su lado. Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la agricultura, comprando sacos de abono, además, también comprar mercadería para su pequeña tienda y surtirla de productos.

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer for his crops, as well as merchandise to stock his small grocery store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Maritza E. has been living in the Adolfo Reyes neighborhood ever since she was a child, and she still lives there with her husband. She is 43 years of age and has two children, ages 1 and 13. Her husband owns and operates a taxi cab in order to help with the household needs. Maritza owns a kiosk in which she sells fast food, soft drinks, candy, and much more. She has been in business for 4 years, and has experienced highs and lows. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase more snacks in order to fill her kiosk and offer her customers a variety of products. Her dream is to be able to improve her family’s quality of life and support her daughter with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maritza habita en el barrio Adolfo Reyes, desde muy pequeña ahí ha crecido con su familia y todavía ahí sigue habitando con su esposo, ella tiene 43 años de edad, y tiene dos hijos de 1 y 13 años de edad, su esposo es dueño de un taxi y lo trabaja para ayudar en todas las necesidades del hogar. Maritza tiene un kiosco en donde vende comida, refrescos, gaseosa, golosinas, y mucho más, tiene cuatro años de estar en las ventas, algunas bajas y otras se superan. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para comprar mas golosinas y llenar el kiosco para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. Su sueño es poder mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y apoyar a su hija en los estudios.

loans.use: Purchase snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Estelvina Irene

texts.es:
Ms. Estelvina M. lives in the Anexo Villa Libertad neighborhood. She is a 48-year-old woman whose husband works as a foreman. She has two children who are currently attending middle school. Ms. M. works as a seamstress and sells cosmetics. She has 5 years of experience in these disciplines, and she got started thanks to her husband’s help and her own efforts. Her cosmetics sales have been increasing since those products sell well, and she is dedicating more of her time to sell them. With this loan that she is requesting, she plans to buy new clothing, cosmetics, and gold-plated jewelry in order to offer her customers a variety of products. She hopes that by dividing her time with both businesses, she will be able to earn the income needed to help her family move forward. Above all, she wishes to be able to provide an education for her children so that they can grow up to be decent people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Estelvina habita en el barrio Anexo Villa Libertad, tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, y su esposo trabaja de maestro de obras, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en la secundaria. Doña Estelvina trabaja en la costura y vende cosméticos tiene cinco años de experiencia e inició con ayuda de su esposo y con esfuerzos propios. Hasta ahora ha ido creciendo en las ventas de cosmético ya que es bien vendido y le está dedicando más de su tiempo. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para comprar ropa nueva, cosméticos, prendas de oro y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedades de productos. Espera que la división de su tiempo en estas dos actividades le puedan dar los ingresos para poder sacar a su familia adelante y sobre todo poder darles educación a sus hijos para que éstos sean personas de bien.

loans.use: Purchase gold-plated and silver jewelry, perfume, and cosmetics

loans.name: Luis Ponciano

texts.es:
Luis is 27 years old and lives with his parents. He is a young man who devotes all his vitality and youth to farming and is a very important contributor to the economy of his family. For 8 years, he has worked independently planting potatoes, corn, beans and peas. Luis’s work process is to first to prepare the land and pour the fertilizer. Then, he sows the seed, usually with plows and then later care for his plants through fertilizer, and if necessary, fumigation. Thus, Luis ensures that the crop yields good results as a reward for their daily effort. He acknowledges that, in recent years, agriculture is not being rewarded by the low prices being offered in the market, but this does not discourage him because he wants to continue on.

His constant motivation is continuing the same production being done, so that his family and his future have a good solvency.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis tiene 27 años y vive con sus padres. Es un joven que dedica toda su vitalidad y juventud en las tareas del campo y es un aporte muy importante para la economía de su familia, desde hace 8 años trabaja de manera independiente sembrando papa, maíz, habas y arveja, el proceso de trabajo que lleva Luis es primero el de preparar la tierra, echándole abonos y regándola, después es el momento de poner la semilla, generalmente con arados y luego es el cuidado que tiene que brindar, tanto de sus plantas, echándoles fertilizantes y si es necesaria la fumigación. De esa manera Luis garantiza que la cosecha rinda buenos frutos como recompensa de su esfuerzo diario, él reconoce que en estos últimos años la agricultura no está siendo recompensada, por los bajos precios que se ofrece en el mercado, pero esto no lo desanima porque quiere seguir adelante.

Su motivación constante es la misma producción que realiza, para que su familia y su futuro tengan una buena solvencia.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for sowing and recruiting staff for the next harvest

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Luis lives in the 14 de Septiembre neighborhood. His wife is a dressmaker, and they have a 16-year-old daughter in high school. Mr. D. has a sewig workshop in which his wife also works in order to get ahead in life. They have been working there for 11 years, and they got started with their own funds. The money they are requesting will be used to invest it in different types of fabric. The loan they previously received was used to purchase a sewing machine, so their business was able to grow upon being able to offer faster services. He hopes that with this growth, he will be able to pay for his daughter’s college expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis habita en el barrio 14 de Septiembre es casado y su esposa es modista y tiene una hija de 16 años de edad la cual está estudiando la secundaria. Don Luis tiene un taller de costura, donde su esposa también labora para salir adelante, son once años de estar laborando e iniciaron con dinero propio. El dinero que están solicitando es para invertirlo en capital de trabajo en la compra de diferentes telas, con el préstamo anterior logró adquirir una máquina de coser y así su negocio ha podido crecer al poder ofertar con más rapidez su servicios.
