Espera que con este crecimiento pueda tener la capacidad de pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija de 16 años.

loans.use: Purchase fabric for tailoring

loans.name: Regner Lino

texts.es:
Regner is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He is a humble farmer full of vitality and youth. From his childhood, he has been devoted to agricultural tasks, helping his parents. Now, he is the father of his own family, which represents a deeper commitment to sustain the family through this activity independently. Four years ago, he partnered with a group of farmers who produce and then sell food products to large companies. He mainly cultivated potatoes, peas and corn. Another strategy for sales is to take his entire harvest by truckloads directly to the city of Huancayo, despite the low price of products offered in the market. For Regner, overcoming this difficulty is a matter of large volume production and partnership.

This father works hard because he wishes to see his children as great professionals in the future and have his family prosper economically.

He asks for this loan which he will invest in the purchase of manure, fertilizer and everything else that is necessary for the preparation of his farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Regner tiene 27 años y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Humilde agricultor lleno de vitalidad y juventud, desde su infancia se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, ayudando a sus padres, ahora que es un padre de familia, es para él un compromiso más profundo el sostener su familia, mediante esta actividad lo viene haciendo de manera independiente hace 4 años, se hizo socio de un grupo de agricultores que producen para luego vender a grandes empresas alimentarías sus productos, él principalmente cultiva papa, arveja y maíz, otra estrategia para sus ventas es la de llevar directamente a la ciudad de Huancayo toda su cosecha por camionadas, a pesar del bajo precio de los productos que se ofrecen en el mercado, para Regner, superar esta dificultad es cuestión de producir en grandes cantidades y asociarse.

Este padre trabaja denodadamente porque desea ver a sus hijos en el futuro grandes profesionales y tener una familia prospera económicamente.

Solicita este préstamo, que invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizante y todo lo que sea necesario para la preparación de sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.use: Acquiring manure, fertilizer and other resources for the preparation of his agricultural land

loans.name: Nila Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia is 35 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children. She is a hardworking woman who is always looking for opportunities to develop her family, and she does this by way of her own business which she set up 2 years ago. She has a small store in her home, taking advantage of the opportunity that her house is located in one of the main streets in her neighborhood. Her stores offers daily staples, including all kinds of groceries. She also promotes her crops in that she and her husband are excellent farmers. This has assured Virginia more income for the economy of her home, which has brought her much satisfaction. She is aware of the current agricultural situation; for this reason, she has decided to open this shop to improve her economic situation.

As a mother, Virginia wants to give the best to her 4 children who are studying.

She is asking for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of store merchandise and farming activities.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y 4 hijos. Es una mujer trabajadora que busca siempre las oportunidades de desarrollo de su familia y esto lo hace a través de su propio negocio que instaló hace 2 años, se trata de una pequeña tienda en su casa, aprovecha la oportunidad de que su casa está ubicada en una de las calles principales de su zona, donde ofrece todos los días productos de primera necesidad, todo tipo de abarrotes y también aprovecha para promocionar el producto de sus cosechas, ya que ella y su esposo son agricultores por excelencia, es así que Virginia asegura un ingreso más para la economía de su hogar, la cual le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, ella es consciente de la actual situación de la agricultura, por la que ha decidido abrir esta tienda para la mejora de su situación económica. Como madre que es, Virginia quiere dar lo mejor a sus 4 hijos que están estudiando.

Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para implementar su tienda y otra parte será invertida en sus actividades agrícolas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store and farmland

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla lives in the Anexo el Riguero neighborhood. She is a 34-year-old married mother of four, high school age children. Her husband works as a taxi cab driver, and provides for the family. Ms. Karla O. owns a general store and sells cosmetics from home. She has been in business for 7 years. She got started with her own money. She had always dreamt of having her own business because she used to work at a restaurant from early in the morning to late in the evening, which was very exhausting. Now that she has achieved one of her goals, every day is a challenge for her to keep growing. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase staple grains, cosmetics, and fragrances.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla habita en el barrio Anexo el Riguero, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, y tiene cuatros hijos que están estudiando en la secundaria, su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi y lleva los alimentos para su familia, doña Karla tiene una pulpería y vende cosméticos en su hogar, tiene siete años de estar en las ventas, empezó con capital propios, ella siempre soñó con tener su propio negocio ya que antes trabajaba en un comedor, desde muy temprano hasta la noche y era muy cansado, ahora que logró uno de sus objetivos, cada día que pasa es un reto para seguir creciendo, con el dinero que esta solicitando es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos y perfumes.

loans.use: Purchase fragrances and cosmetics

loans.name: Ronald Cesar

texts.es:
Ron is 24 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. He works as a driver of his own daily bus. He has joined forces with his brother to manage the daily bus and transport passengers. He also supports his parents with their own bus, which operates during the free days. In this way, he feels productive for his family. He has done this for 10 years since he first learned how to drive and thanks his father for having trained him. Now, he supports his parents in support.

The reason for his effort is to have economic security, by which he supports his family.

Ronald requested this loan to repair the failing engine in his bus. His wish for the future is to purchase another type of microbus.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald tiene 24 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Trabaja diariamente como chofer de su propia movilidad (combi), junto con su hermano, se han asociado para manejar esta movilidad interdiario, haciendo transporte de pasajeros, también apoya en el trabajo a sus padres con otra movilidad, que conducir cuando los días libres, así se siente productivo para su familia, viene haciendo esto, desde hace 10 años cuando aprendió a conducir y agradece a su padre por haberlo instruido y ahora él es parte sustentadora, que retribuye diariamente a sus ancianos padres.

El motivo de su esfuerzo es tener seguridad económica, para cuando se case cuente con el sostenimiento para su familia.

Ronald solicita este préstamo para reparara su movilidad, su motor está fallando, su deseo a futuro es obtener otra movilidad tipo combi.

loans.use: Repairing his vehicle to transport passengers

loans.name: Dina Yawa

texts.fr: Dina Yawa A. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Elle est couturière à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et aussi des tissus pour les revendre à ses clients. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dina Yawa A. is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She works as a seamstress in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, she hopes to buy a sewing machine, as well as fabric to sell to her clients. This will allow her to earn more money and better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, and fabric for resale

loans.name: Raul Rolando

texts.es:
Raul is 32 years old and now lives with his brothers and his elderly parents. He is a young man who transports passengers on his daily bus, covering routes between the cities of San Agustín de Cajas and Huancayo, until approximately 9 pm. Thus, he is able to make income through the fruit of his labor. His future desire is to have his own fleet of cars. Raul mentions that he enjoys his work because it is simple, and he does not need much for his line of transportation.

The reason for his loan application is to buy tires for the complete repair of his bus.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Raúl tiene 32 años, en la actualidad vive con sus hermanos y su ancianos padres. Es un joven que se dedica exclusivamente al transporte de pasajeros, diariamente conduce su movilidad, cubriendo las rutas entre las ciudades de San Agustín de Cajas y Huancayo, hasta aproximadamente las 9 de la noche, de esta manera logra los ingresos económicos, fruto de su arduo trabajo. Él desea seguir adelante, en el futuro, tener su propia flota de autos, porque disfruta mucho de realizar esta actividad, Raúl menciona que es sencilla porque no necesita de muchos trámites para pertenecer a una línea de trasportes.

El motivo de su solicitud de préstamo, es para comprar llantas y para la reparación completa de su movilidad.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his bus

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina is 26 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She is a young mother who shares the farming duties with her husband , as much agriculture as with the livestock, because she really desires to get ahead. She primarily cultivates potatoes and corn as well as vegetables, which require much work and effort, and she also spends most of the day caring for her 4 Brown Swiss cows. She receives excellent profits from the daily sale of milk, and she also makes and sells delicious cheeses.

Yanina does not consider this daily labor to be a problem worth mentioning, since she and her husband are used to this work, and she does not neglect the care of her two small children. She has requested this loan because she needs to improve her next planting season and to buy balanced feed for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Yanina tiene 26 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es una joven madre de familia que se dedica, de manera compartida con su esposo, a las tareas del campo, tanto a la agricultura, como a la ganadería, ya que ella tiene muchos deseos de seguir adelante, cultiva principalmente la papa, el maíz, también verduras, las cuales requieren de un gran esfuerzo y trabajo, así también, casi todo el día en la cuidad, cuida de sus 4 vacas de raza Bronz Suiz con las cuales percibe mayores ganancias con la venta de la leche diariamente, también elabora y vende deliciosos quesos. Para Yanina no existen dificultades considerables de mencionarse, en el trabajo diario que realiza, ya que ella y su esposo están habituados a estas labores, y además no descuida la atención de sus dos pequeños hijos. La solicitud de su préstamo es a razón de que necesita mejorar su próxima siembra y comprar alimento balanceado para sus vacas.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her lands and balanced feed for her cows

loans.name: Rufina Margarita

texts.es:
Rufina is 33 years old, living with her husband and 3 children. She is a hard-working woman who is always seeking to make a significant contribution to the household finances. She does so with her embroidery, which began as a hobby helping one of her friends, then she realized that this work is profitable as well as enjoyable. She did not hesitate to begin her own business producing "talqueado" embroideries for costume parties called "Santiagos".

She has seen a profit from these 3 years of intense work and today her husband also encourages her to keep embroidering. He also engages in agricultural work and in the sale of firewood. In spite of the short time that her childcare leaves Rufina, she never stops working in her own home every day creating these beautiful embroideries, which realize their profit when they are sold after a month's labor.

Rufina's motivation is to give the best to her three children in school. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of the supplies necessary for her work, such as fabrics and colored wool yarn. She will also invest a part in her husband's firewood business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Rufina tiene 33 años y en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Es una mujer muy laboriosa que siempre busca aportar significativamente en la economía del hogar, y lo hace mediante los bordados, todo comenzó para ella como una afición, ayudando a una de sus familiares, luego vio que este trabajo era rentable y además, le agradaba, no dudó entonces en emprender ella misma su negocio, produce talqueados que son los fustanes bordados para una fiesta costumbrista que se llama Santiago, ha visto la ganancia de estos 3 años de intenso trabajo y su esposo hoy también es su aliado para seguir bordando, pese a que su esposo también se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y a la venta de leña, a pesar del corto tiempo que dispone Rufina atiende a sus hijos, no deja de trabajar en su propia casa todos los días realizando estos bellos bordados que después de un mes de labor puede ver sus frutos cuando cobra por ello. El motivo del esfuerzo de Rufina es dar lo mejor a sus 3 hijos que están estudiando. Solicita este préstamo será invertido en la compra de los insumos necesarios para su trabajo, como telas, lanas de diversos colores, etc. y una parte también será para invertir en el negocio de leña de su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her embroideries, wool and other fabrics, as well as to invest with her husband in a business to sell firewood.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is 41 years old, a devoted mother living with her 4 children and her husband. She makes the most of an opportunity, such as when she opened her grocery shop at the foot of the road. She saw that this was a good opportunity since travelers going by always buy something. In her shop she sells daily necessities as well as things produced in her area such as cheese and yogurt. In this way, with the constant attention she gives almost all day long every day , she gets shoppers which enable her to contribute to the home finances. This is an activity Julia enjoys because she can rest from the hard labor in the countryside, which because of her age she is no longer able to do as much.

She is motivated to do this work by the need to help support the family finances, and she is able to take care of the education of her children who study in Huancayo. She is requesting a loan with which she will invest in merchandise for her shop; she wishes to stock it with more products and offer the best every day.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Julia tiene 41 años de edad, es una madre muy dedicada que vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo. Aprovecha siempre las oportunidades y ésta es una de ellas, ya que abrió su tienda de abarrotes y productos diarios, al pie de la carretera, vio esta gran oportunidad, ya que pasan los viajeros y siempre compran algo, en su tienda vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y también lo que produce su zona, es decir, productos lácteos como el queso y el yogurt, de esa manera, con la constante atención que ofrece todos los días y durante casi todo el día, puede obtener entradas que le permiten sostener parte de la economía de su hogar, para Julia esta es una actividad que le agrada, porque puede descansar de las duras tareas del campo, que por su edad, ya no puede exigirse demasiado. Realiza este trabajo, movida por la misma necesidad de ser parte sustentadora en la economía de su hogar y pueda solventar la educación de sus hijos que estudian en Huancayo. Solicita un crédito con el que implementará con mercadería su tienda, ella desea surtirla con más productos y cada día brindar lo mejor.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino is 36 years old, living with his wife and two minor children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 10 years, and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk and cheese from his cows, which he sells in local markets. The hard part is the cheese manufacturing process.

Sabino keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his two children, along with his wife who is looking after him. The loan will be used to improve the breed of his cattle. Although it is risky because of the various complications cows have at birthing time, he is ready to improve the quality of his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Sabino tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Está dedicado a la crianza de sus vacas, hace más de 10 años y trata de mejorar la raza de estas para incrementar sus precios, invierte tiempo y dinero en alimentos y en medicamentos que sus animales requieren. Esta actividad le agrada, sobre todo cuando puede obtener de sus vacas leche y quesos, los cuales vende en los mercados de su localidad, lo difícil, es el proceso para la fabricación de los quesos. Sabino mantiene sus fuerzas gracias al entusiasmo y apoyo que le brindan sus dos hijos, juntamente con su esposa quien está al pendiente de él. El préstamo será utilizado para mejorar la raza de sus vacas, aunque es arriesgado, por las diferentes complicaciones que tienen las vacas al momento del parto, pero está dispuesto a mejorar la calidad de sus animales.

loans.use: To improve the breed of his cows so they will be more sought-after

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Hermenegildo is 53 years old, living with his wife and three minor children. He has grown vegetables for more than 40 years, which he fertilizes and waters every morning. His small plots are close to his home, which helps him to care for them patiently. This work takes all day, but because it is close to his home it is not too difficult to care for them. This pleases him because he has more time to spend with his family and his children. The hard part is transporting the products into the cities, because of the scarcity of buses that get to his community. Hermenegildo gets most of his enthusiasm and will to keep going from his family.

He will invest the money in the purchase of seeds and plants, in order to increase his production and therefore his income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Hermenegildo tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos menores. Desde hace más de 40 años se dedica al cultivo de verduras, a las cuales cuida y riega todas las mañanas y cuyas chacras están en las cercanías de su hogar, esto le ayuda a abonarlas con mucha paciencia.Esta actividad le toma todo el día, pero como está cerca de su hogar no es tan difícil el atenderlas, lo cual le agrada, porque pasa más tiempo con su familia y sus hijos. Lo difícil es trasportar estos productos a las ciudades, por los escasos carros que llegan a su comunidad. Hermenegildo tiene en su familia la mejor dosis de entusiasmo y esfuerzo para seguir creciendo como familia. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de semillas y plantas, para poder incrementar sus productos y de la misma forma sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and plants in order to increase his agricultural production

loans.name: David Teofilo

texts.es:
David is 40 years old, living with his wife and 6 children, all of whom are in upper-level studies. Recently he has gotten involved in agriculture, since his parents were the main farmers in their area and now he wishes to follow in their footsteps. For this reason he is giving his very best to his lands, where he is busy all day long. The harvest is what gives him the most pleasure from his work, since he can pick the products that cost him so much work cultivating and caring. Nevertheless, the most difficult thing is acquiring the fertilizers necessary for his plots, since they are very expensive and they raise the level of investment required in production.

David draws strength from his 6 children, whom he supports so that they may become professionals. He wishes to invest in the various fertilizers he needs for his crops, so that next season he can increase his production and his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

David tiene 40 años, vive con su esposa y sus 6 hijos jóvenes, los cuales cursan estudios superiores. Desde muy pequeño estuvo involucrado en la agricultura, ya que sus padres fueron los mejores agricultores de la zona y ahora desea seguir sus pisadas, por ello se esfuerza en ofrecer lo mejor de sí en sus tierras, en las que se ocupa todo un día.La cosecha es lo que más le agrada de su trabajo, ya que puede seleccionar sus productos que tanto trabajo le costó cultivar y cuidar, sin embargo lo más difícil es adquirir los abonos necesarios para sus chacras, ya que estos son muy costosos y eleva el nivel de inversión de su producción. David basa su esfuerzo en sus 6 hijos, a quienes apoya para que puedan ser profesionales. Desea invertir en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, que requiere para sus productos y en la próxima campaña incrementar su producción y ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for his agricultural lands

loans.name: Maurilio

texts.es:
Maurilio is 46 and lives with his wife and five young children. He grows potatoes in the local community, where he was born and learned agriculture as a boy through his parents, who taught him everything he knows relating to this activity. He had to assume new responsibilities since he got married.

Agriculture has helped him support his family, and he is grateful to his parents for teaching him how to work the land. Without a doubt, he enjoys selling the products that he hardly works on during months. Specially during harvest; selecting the products is the most tiresome part of being a farmer.

Maurilio’s family is the reason for him to be better every day. Now, he wishes to invest in seeds and fertilizer, both very expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Maurilio tiene 46 años, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos jóvenes. Está dedicado al cultivo de papa en su localidad, donde nació y desde pequeño aprendió la labor de agricultor por sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo concerniente a esta actividad y desde que contrajo matrimonio tuvo que asumir nuevas responsabilidades.

La agricultura es la actividad que le ayudó a mantener su hogar, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido con sus padres quienes le instruyeron en ello.Sin duda, lo que le agrada, es el momento de comercializar sus productos agrícolas, a los que se dedicó por muchos meses, sobre todo en la cosecha, la selección de los productos es lo más tedioso para todo agricultor.

Maurilio tienen en sus cinco hijos y su esposa las mejores razones para ser mejor cada día. Ahora, desea invertir en la compra de semillas y abonos, los cuales son muy costosos.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Rolando Alberto

texts.es:
Rolando is 38 and lives with his wife and 11 year old son. He has livestock, for a long time stock breeding has been his way of living. This activity takes all day, by taking care of his animals and when he goes to sell meat to the cities nearby.

He likes this activity because his animals are special and taking them out every morning is very important. Without a doubt, it’s difficult to take care of sheep at night, because wolves and other wild animals can attack the area where his animals are.

Rolando hopes to provide education to his beloved son, his major motivator in life, so that he can become a professional. He whishes to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of breeding sheep to improve the quality of his stock, so he can increase the price and be the farmer with the most demand and better products in the local community.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Rolando tiene 38 años, y vive con su esposa y su hijo de 11 años. Se dedica a la crianza de animales, ya que desde siempre la ganadería fue su medio de trabajo, esta actividad que le toma todo el día, el atender y cuidar a sus animalitos y sobre todo cuando va a vender carne a los mercados de las ciudades cercanas.

Este trabajo le agrada porque sus animales son muy tiernos y salir con ellos todas las mañanas es muy especial, sin duda, es difícil cuidar a las ovejas durante la noche, ya que los lobos o otros animales salvajes atacan su corral de ganado.

Rolando tiene en su hijo, su mayor motivador en la vida, desea brindarle una educación con la cual logre ser profesional. El dinero de préstamo desea invertirlo en la compra de carneros de raza para mejorar sus ganados y elevar el precio, así ser el más solicitado y mejor ganadero en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase breeding sheep to improve the quality of his livestock.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia is 47 years old and lives with her husband and six children. She works in stock breeding, particularly llamas breeding. Since she got married she has also worked in agriculture, these activities are a support for her husband to cover the home expenses.

Early in the morning she has to walk the animals to the hills, so the animals can eat and at the same time she can take care of her land. A difficult part of this activity is transporting the meat to the markets because these are far away from her community, and it’s hard to get there because there is no regular transportation.

Dionicia has in her husband and children the mayor motivation to work as a farmer. She wants to help her husband and will use the money to purchase animals and increase the sales of meat in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Dionicia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos. Se dedica a la ganadería, sobre todo a la crianza de llamas, desde que se casó, también siembra productos agrícolas, estas actividades son un apoyo a su esposo para solventar los gastos del hogar.

Desde muy temprano en la mañana tiene que salir a pastear sus animalitos en las alturas de las lomas, donde sus animales puedan comer mejor, y a la par, dedicarse a sus terrenos de cultivo que posee cerca de donde pastea a sus animales, lo difícil es transportar la carne a los mercados, porque se encuentran lejos de su localidad, es difícil de llegar porque no hay transporte frecuente.

Dionicia tiene en su esposo y en sus hijos su mayor motivación para su actividad como agricultora y ganadera. Ella desea seguir ayudando a su esposo, para ello, invertirá el dinero en la compra de animales para incrementar su venta de carne en los mercados.

loans.use: Purchase livestock to increase sales and profit.

loans.name: Alfonso Vicente

texts.es:
Alfonso is 38, lives with his wife and three children. He is an active farmer dedicated to grow corn and potato, activity he does for long periods, growing crops in areas that are far from his home where he walks to for two hours. Once there, he starts working watering and fertilizing his land, this takes all day.

He likes this activity and enjoys earning a living doing something he has liked since he was young, even with the difficulties he goes through when it comes the time to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and products necessary to take care of the land.

Alfonso sees in his family the best way to get better at work, because seeing his family happy satisfies the effort he makes. He plans to invest in expanding his land, to increase the amount of crop and be one of the best farmers in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Alfonso tiene 38 años, vive en con su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos. Es un activo agricultor dedicado al cultivo de maíz y papa, lo que realiza en largas temporadas, sembrando sus chacras que se encuentran en zonas muy alejadas de su hogar, a donde tiene que llegar caminando por un lapso de 2 horas y así iniciar su trabajo regando o abonando sus terrenos, esto le toma todo el día.

Sin embargo, esta labor no le desagrada, por lo contrario, le agrada ganarse la vida dedicándose a lo que en realidad le gusta desde joven, a pesar de las dificultades que tiene en el momento de invertir en la compra de abonos y diversos productos necesarios para el cuidado de sus chacras.

Alfonso ve en su familia la mejor forma de mejorar en su trabajo, ver a su familia feliz satisface su esfuerzo. Tiene pensado invertir en la ampliación de sus terrenos, para sí aumentar la capacidad de sembrío y lograr ser uno de los mejores productores de la zona.

loans.use: To expand and prepare faming land.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio is 55 years old and lives with his wife Antonieta. He is a humble person dedicated to grow crops in the land he inherited from his parents.

During 30 years he has grown different types of agricultural products, this activity takes all of his day, early in the morning he leaves to work at the land and returns home in the evening. Agriculture has helped him cover his home expenses. He enjoys being in contact with nature, although its hard to work with difficult weather conditions that affect his production.

For Gregorio, having a healthy wife gives him strength to keep working hard. He will invest the money to buy products for improving his land, such as insecticides needed during rain season. In the future, he would like to invest in a different type of business, for when his physical strength is not suitable for agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Gregorio tiene 55 años, actualmente vive con su esposa Antonieta. Es una humilde persona dedicada al cultivo de productos agrícolas en los terrenos que heredó de sus padres.

Desde hace 30 años se dedica a sembrar diversos productos agrícolas, esta actividad le toma todo el día, desde muy temprano sale rumbo a sus terrenos regresando en las tardes a su hogar.Este trabajo le ha ayudado a solventar los gastos de su hogar, además, el estar en contacto con la naturaleza le agrada, lo difícil que es batallar con las diversas inclemencias del clima que perjudican su producción.

Para Gregorio, el que su esposa esté bien de salud, le da fuerzas para seguir con las mismas fuerzas que de joven con su trabajo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de productos que mejorarán sus terrenos, como los insecticidas, que son necesarios en tiempos de lluvia. Con el tiempo, desea invertir en un negocio diferente para cuando las fuerzas ya no le den para los campos.

loans.use: Purchase products for his land

loans.name: Delali

texts.fr: Delali E. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Delali est revendeuse de poissons et d’autres produits congelés depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est à son troisième crédit et souhaite par ce dernier augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des poissons, des croupions, des saucisses et autres.
texts.en:
Delali E. is 39 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been a retailer of fish and other frozen foods for more than five years. This is her third loan. With it, she hopes to expand her business by buying fish, rump steaks, sausages, and other such foods.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish for retail

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. started her local restaurant nine years ago in Sunyani where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 37 years old and married with two kids, who are currently in school. 

She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Yaa wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. started her local restaurant nine years ago in Sunyani where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 37 years old and married with two kids who are currently in school.

She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Yaa wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan funds and peer pressure to repay the loan. Yaa was attending her usual group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Malaika Group

texts.en:
This group is called Malaika and this is their third time requesting a loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They have repaid their previous loans successfully and are now requesting a new loan of Le 2,400,000.00 to further add onto their businesses.

Members of this group are Haruna I. K., Isatu K., and Mohamed S.. Haruna is the group`s leader. He is 30 and married with three children. He owns a store in Magburaka town market and has been in business for the past six years. People pay him to keep their goods in his store and he also trades different goods depending on what he considers lucrative at the time.

loans.use: To expand their existing businesses.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth K. is 40 years old. She is divorced and the mother of five kids. Ruth is very resourceful for her family in providing food and paying bills. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well used clothes. She sells kenkey in the mornings and switches over to the sale of used clothes in the afternoon. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. Ruth was at a group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: Ruth would like to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood for her small food stand.

loans.name: Nilda Rossio

texts.es:
Nilda is 31 and lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and two daughters. She is a hardworking mom; she works in agriculture and stock breeding. The animals facilitate her work in the land and reduce her efforts when going from one place to another. She has worked on this since she got married with the purpose of helping her husband with his work. Working as a farmer takes all of her day, starting very early in the morning. She likes this activity because its good to see the result of her efforts during harvest season, that makes all the hours of hard work worth it, however, there are moments when the prices in the market go down, which is discouraging but doesn’t stop her from working harder. Now she wishes to purchase fertilizers for her land and this way have a good production.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda tiene 31, vive con su esposo que es agricultor y sus dos hijas. Es una trabajadora, madre de familia dedicada a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, los cuales le ayudan en su trabajo dentro de sus terrenos, y sobre todo aminoran la carga que tienen el trasladarse.Esta actividad como agricultora la realiza desde que contrajo matrimonio, con el fin de ser un apoyo y ayuda idónea para su esposo en su trabajo, dicha actividad le toma todo el día, desde muy tempranas horas.Esta actividad le empezó a agradar porque en los tiempos de cosecha puede ver los frutos de su trabajo, esto reconforta todas las horas de sacrificio, sin embargo, hay momentos en que los precios en los mercados disminuyen, lo cual la desanima, pero no la limita a seguir trabajando. Nilda tiene en su familia y sobre todo en sus hijos, las razones para seguir esforzándose. Ahora desea acceder a los abonos y fertilizantes que requiere para sus cultivos y así seguir produciendo favorablemente.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for land

loans.name: Good Never Done Group

texts.en:
This group is called Good Never Done. This is their 3rd time of getting a loan from Kiva through SMT. They have repaid previous loans successfully and are now requesting a new loan to further enhance their businesses.

These entrepreneurs are requesting a loan of Le 2,400,000.00. Their names are Delvin A. S., Kadiatu C. and Umu T.. All of them sell in Magburaka town market. Delvin is the group`s leader. He is 38, married with 4 children. Delvin sells jewelry at the Magburaka market. He has been in this business for 13 years now.

loans.use: Buy more jewelry to add to existing business inventory

loans.name: Good Heart Kombra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Good Heart Kombra. This is the 3rd loan they are receiving a loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have helped them a lot in improving the status of their businesses and thus their livelihoods.

Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are now requesting a loan of Le 2,400,000.0 to further expand their businesses. Members of this group are: Kadiatu K., Gbassay S., and Kadiatu J.. Kadiatu is the leader of this group. She is 38, a widow with 4 children. Kadiatu has been selling palm-oil for the past 15 years.

loans.use: Buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Capricornio Group

texts.en:
The Capricornio group is made up of ten women and two men who live in the La Primavera neighborhood in Santa C.. The group works in various sectors: Ana Karen and Yaneth sell Avon products, Jose, Carmen and Asunta sell food (bread and prepared meals), Teresa sells household appliances, Hugo makes and sells furniture, Eva is a domestic worker, Emileny sells party supplies, Yessica works at a day care, and Daniela sells cosmetics.

Most of the group plans to use their Kiva loans to increase their stock of merchandise, or to invest in new materials for their business. For example, Hugo plans to purchase new tools for his workshop.

Most of the group has taken out previous group loans, so they are familiar with the group lending methodology. The group is grateful to AgroCapital for providing them with access to this credit.

loans.use: Increase stock of merchandise, invest in new materials for business

loans.name: Tawoprr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tawoprr. They have received three loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have helped these people tremendously. However, they still need more loans to keep their businesses growing.

These entrepreneurs are Marie K., Ya Iye S., and Adama B.. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,400,000.00. Marie is the leader of this group. She is 35 years old. She sells food items at the Magburaka town Market and has been in this business for 21 years now.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Socios Unidos Group

texts.en:
The Socios Unidos ("United Partners") group is maD. up of eleven women and two men who live in the El Abasto area of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. The group members are involved in different business activities. Many of the women sell food: Guadalupe, Rosa, Mariza, Mery and Teresa sell prepared meals, chicken, bread and honey; Katia sells cosmetics; Roxana is an Avon representative; Nancy works at an Internet café; Tatiana sells handicrafts; Melina sells jewelry; Carmen works as a judicial solicitor; Ramon is an electrician; and Walter works at a karaoke lounge. Most of the group members have one to three years of experience with their businesses, though some have more. Rosa and Melina have six and seven years of experience, respectively, and Ramon has 20 years of experience.

Most of the group's female members plan to use the loan to expand their businesses by purchasing more merchandise to sell. The two men plan to buy more tools and equipment with their loans.

Most of the group members have participated in group loans before at other financial institutions or foundations, but this will be Socios Unidos's first loan cycle as a group with AgroCapital.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Gideon Tangwan

texts.en:
Gideon Tangwan A. has completed six successful years with GHAPE, a small NGO in north west Cameroon. He is 42 and has five children.

With previous loans he has expanded his farm, where he grows vegetables and raises pigs. Like some other long-term borrowers in this part of the world, Geoffrey is keen to diversify beyond agriculture.

To that end, he hopes this loan will allow him to set up a 'cold store' in the small village of Njembeng. Specifically, he intends to buy drinks and provisions, as well as invest in a deep freezer and fixtures and fittings for the shop.

He says his site is well located and will help the local community by saving people from having to travel to buy goods.

Gideon hopes the profits of his work will go some way towards the cost of building a family home. He adds that he likes GHAPE because the terms of the loans are fair and "the organisation makes you work hard".

loans.use: Stock, fixtures and fittings for a shop.

loans.name: Nicholas Kah

texts.en:
Nicholas's first loan in 2001 was for 15,000 CFA francs ($38), which he invested in his farm. Over the years, he has used other loans to expand his businesses and increase his income.

GHAPE, a small NGO in northwest Cameroon, has a policy of increasing loan size only when borrowers have shown they are responsible. As a long-standing member with an excellent repayment record, Nicholas has recently applied for a larger loan over 24 months. He intends to use this money to further invest in his farm. Some of his output will help feed his family; the rest, he will sell at market.

Nicholas is 58 and has two wives and eight children, two of whom still live at home with him. He says that previous GHAPE loans have been a great help in paying for his children's school fees and looking after their health.

loans.use: To buy seeds and animals.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es:
Gerardo is 52 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He is married and his wife is a housewife and has an 18 year-old daughter. Gerardo works in a company as a Public Accountant and has been so for the past three years. The loan he is requesting is for infrastructure purposes, to fix his home. He wants to build a room, since his home is made of wood and zinc he hopes to improve his house with the help of AFODENIC, and in this was provide a worthy home to his wife and daughter. He plans to be able to work independently in order to serve many customers at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Don Gerardo tiene 52 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene una hija de 18 años de edad, es casado y su esposa es ama de casa. Don Gerardo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como Contador Publico, tiene una experiencia de tres años en esta labor. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para infraestructura, en mejoras de su vivienda, quiere construir un cuarto, ya que su casa es de madera y zinc, desea ir mejorando su vivienda con la oportunidad que le brinda AFODENIC, y así darle una vivienda digna a su esposa e hija. Sus planes son poder trabajar independiente para cubrir varios clientes al mismo tiempo.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make a room

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une veuve, mère de 10 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants puisqu’en tant que veuve elle devient le seul soutien de la famille. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de nététou (graine d’un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local). Elle va faire dans cette activité donc et en même temps  acheter et vendre de la pate d’arachide. <b>Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a widow and the mother of 10 children. She is requesting this loan to take care of her children's education because as a widow she became the sole provider for the family. She wants to bolster her business of netetou (seed pods of nere, a leguminous shrub, transformed into a local food product by cooking and fermenting). She will practice this activity and at the same time will purchase and re-sale peanut paste. She will reimburse this loan in one single sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Prépation et vente de nététou (graine d'un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local)

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna is 32 years old. She lives in the Lomas del Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She came to live in this neighborhood when she was young and it is here that she met her husband. They had two children, now ages 2 and 14. Her husband works and supports the family. Reyna has a "fritanga", which is a small food stand where she sells traditional Nicaraguan fried foods. She also sells tortillas. She has been in this business for 9 years and so far she has been able to get ahead with her family. She sells her food in the afternoon and the tortillas in the morning. It's hard work but it's profitable.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase beams and zinc sheets to make repairs to her home. The roof is in bad shape and she cannot continue to risk her family's safety.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Reyna tiene 32 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino, desde joven vino a vivir a este barrio donde conoció a su esposo y procreó dos hijos de 2 y 14 años de edad, él trabaja y apoya a su familia. El negocio de doña Reyna es venta de fritanga y de tortillas y tiene nueve años de estar en las ventas que hasta ahora le ha permitido sobresalir con su familia, la fritanga la vende todos los días por la tarde y las tortillas desde la mañana, es un poco duro por que se agita mucho pero es rentable. Con el dinero que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de perlines y zinc de su casa, ya que el que está lo tiene en mal estado y no puede seguir arriesgando a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase beams and zinc sheets to make repairs to her home

loans.name: Dinora Del Socorro

texts.es:
Dinora lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She is 63 years old, married and has five grown children. They all work. Her husband makes stoves and iron gates which are in high demand. Dinora started a small general store in her home four years ago. She also sells clothing to stores and the profits are good. Sometimes when the sales of clothing are slow she gets by with the general store. The loan she is requesting is to make improvements to her home. She wishes to lay ceramic tile in her living room and in one bedroom. This will make her home more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Dinora habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos los cuales son mayores y trabajan , su esposo elabora estufa y verjas las cuales son bastantes adquirida por los clientes. Dinora tiene una pulpería que puso hace cuatro años, además sale a vender ropa a los departamentos ya que las ventas son buenas y así fue que inició, después de un tiempo puso una pulpería en su vivienda a veces cuando las ventas están bajas en la ropa se ayuda en la pulpería, con el préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura va a embaldosar el piso de la sala y de una habitación y así estar mas cómoda con su familia en la prosperidad de nuevos beneficios para su hogar.

loans.use: To lay ceramic tile in her living room and in one bedroom

loans.name: Jonas Amabo

texts.en:
61-year-old Jonas is a farmer and married with three children. He has been a member of GHAPE in Cameroon since 2004, and has used his loans to expand his farm. He used his last loan to buy pigs, and also to grow cassava, a starchy staple popular in many Cameroonian meals.

With the loan he has recently applied for, Jonas intends to buy more palm trees and invest in an oil-milling machine and one for milling cassava. As well as making tasty palm wine, the trees are used to produce (unrefined) palm oil, which is a deep orange colour and rich in flavour and nutrients. It is the most important oil used in Cameroonian cooking and forms the basis of many dishes.

Jonas says he will use his experience to build a successful business and plans to hire at least two workers over the coming year.

loans.use: To buy palm trees and invest in an oil milling machine.

loans.name: Francisco Xavier

texts.es:
Francisco lives in the Hialeah IV etapa neighborhood. She has lived there with his family since he was a child. He is now married and has a 6 year old son. His wife's name is Fabiola Marenco and she is a housewife. She is now thinking about looking for a job so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. Francisco is a driver with 5 years of experience.

The loan he is requesting will be used to make improvements to his home, specifically for the purchase of ceramic tile for his living room. He also has a truck that is in bad shape and he hopes to be able to fix it so that he can start a transportation business. In this manner he hopes to increase his family's income and help his son, who is growing and will need it for his education.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco habita en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa, desde niño ha habitado en ese barrio con su familia, es casado y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, su esposa se llama Fabiola Marenco y es ama de casa, ella está pensando en la idea de buscar trabajo para apoyar a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Francisco es conductor y tiene cinco años de experiencia en esta actividad, el dinero que está solicitando es para hacer mejoras en su casa en la compra de cerámica para ponerla en la sala. Tiene una camioneta que está en mal estado, espera poder repararla, y empezar un negocio de acarreo para tener más ingresos para su familia. Su hijo está creciendo y los gastos de estudios están aumentando.

loans.use: To purchase ceramic tile for his home

loans.name: Zilghian Julissa

texts.es:
Zilghan is 29 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood. She has two daughters who attend school. She is a single mother and has been forced to get ahead with her children. Zilghan owns a ciber cafe where she offers different services such as document scanning, copies and internet access among others. She has been doing well because her services are very popular with the young people in her area.

She started the business with four computers and now she wants to expand. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase two computers and their accessories. This will allow her to offer a better service to her customers and increase her earnings. She hopes that with the income from this business she is able to provide an education and a good quality of life for her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Zilghan tiene 29 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380 tiene dos hijas mujeres que están estudiando, es madre soltera y le ha tocado salir adelante con sus hijos. Zilghan tiene un caber café donde brinda los diferentes servicios de levantado de texto, copias, Internet, y otros. Esto le ha permitido mejoras ya que está muy solicitado por los jóvenes de su barrio. Inició su negocio con cuatro computadoras y ahora quiere crecer un poco más. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para la compra de dos computadoras y sus accesorios para brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes y así obtener más utilidades. Espera que este negocio pueda darle los ingresos para poder darles educación a sus hijas y también darles una buena calidad de vida

loans.use: To purchase two computers and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jewelry and other items.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
33-year-old Celine Fointain lives in Cameroon's North West Province and is hoping to take out her third business loan.
Celine runs a small but successful food stall near the centre of Bamenda, a medium-sized town in the country's Anglophone west.

She intends to spend the money buying three sacks of rice, a large bag of beans, groundnuts (fresh peanuts), sugar, soap, washing powder, and firewood. She will also invest in a drum of palm oil. Unrefined palm oil is a deep orange colour and rich in flavour and nutrients.  It is the most important oil used in Cameroonian cooking and forms the basis of many dishes. 

Celine is married with six children, five of whom are school age. She is happy that previous business profits have allowed her to pay school fees and buy study books. As well as continuing her children's education, she hopes to eventually buy some land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Amigos Por Siempre Group

texts.en:
The Amigos Por Siempre ("Friends Forever") group is maD. up mostly of young mothers who are trying to get ahead with their businesses. The ten women and two men in the group live in the Cochabamba region of central Bolivia and work in different areas, depending on the season. Right now, Erika and Alejandrina both own neighborhood stores. Leonor sells ice cream, Graciela and Jhonny Alberto sell candles for religious rituals, Jeankarla and Gladys sell t-shirts at local fairs. Ricardo sells athletic clothing, and Paola sells prepared meals. It's only appropriate that many of the group members work selling food, since "cochabambinos" priD. themselves on being the most food-loving of all Bolivians.

Most of the group members have one to five years of experience, with the exception of Flora, who has had her shop for 10 years, and Patricia, who has worked at a general store for 12 years. The group members will use their Kiva loans to purchase more merchandise to sell at their repective businesses.

The group gets along well and is very cheerful, as you can see in their picture.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell (food, candles, t-shirts, ice cream, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add the sale of fresh meat to her small business of selling vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of goods, espcially drinks, to restock a small market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of live chickens to re-sell

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
The Emprendedoras ("Enterprising Women") group is maD. up of twelve women and two men who live in the El Abasto area of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, a tropical region in eastern Bolivia. Most of the women sell clothing and cosmetics, while some work as cleaning personnel and secretaries. Carlos works as an electrician, and Ricardo works at a hardware store. Marisela works in an auto body shop. She and Mirtha, a saleswoman, have the most work experience of all the group members, working 10 and 12 years in their respective areas.

Most of the group members plan to use the loan to expand their businesses by purchasing more merchandise to sell. Others plan to buy more tools and equipment for their businesses with their loans.

Though many of the group members say they have had previous loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions, this is Emprendedoras' first group loan with AgroCapital (Kiva's Field Partner).

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell, and buy tools and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to keep operating her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing for her store; also to buy vegetables and meat to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of silver-plated jewelry to sell

loans.name: Ana Belkis

texts.en:
Ana Belkis, a dynamic, optimistic and assiduous young mother of a three-year-old girl, is fighting tooth and nail to improve her family's lifestyle and move ahead.  She's been selling fresh vegetables for two years in her community.   Her business is much profitable as the country people love to consume fruits and vegetables in the morning.  Ana Belkis thinks that time has come to diversify her offer and attract more clients to her business.  With her loan, she'll add fresh meat, especially chicken to her actual inventory.  The entrepreneur also is thinking about renting a small establishment to run her activity.
Ana Belkis wants to have enough money to provide her daughter with the best education to become a great professional in life.

loans.use: To introduce fresh meat in her small business of selling vegetables.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Sr. Ismael F. C. lives in the La Ramada area of tropical Santa Cruz de la Sierra, in eastern Bolivia. He lives with his partner and two children, who are 12 and 15 years old. Don Ismael runs a video rental and copy shop in the Villa Primero de Mayo neighborhood. Most of his business comes from binding and copying, since it's hard to make money renting videos when bootleg DVDs are widely available for less than $1. He charges 30 Bolivian cents (about 4 U.S. cents) per copy, and also sells drinks and sweets. Don Ismael plans to use this loan to purchase more photocopy materials and snacks for his store.

This is Don Ismael's fourth loan with AgroCapital; his credit history is excellent. Previously, he had loans with both AgroCapital and the San Martin Cooperative, and he repaid both punctually and in full. Currently, he only has a loan with AgroCapital.

Since Don Ismael was not at his copy shop when his loan officer visited, this photo is of the outside of his store instead.

loans.use: Purchase photocopy materials and snacks

loans.name: Normawati

texts.id: Pinjaman kali ini merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Normawati (44). Sebelumnya pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.000.000 dari KIVA melalui DINARI telah dipakai untuk mengembangkan usaha lain selain menjual bakso. Kalau sebelumnya dia hanya menjual bakso, dengan bantuan modal usaha dari KIVA dia sudah mulai mengembangkan usaha lain yaitu menjual mie ayam. Dengan adanya dua variasi makanan yang dijualnya, pembeli lebh senang karena mempunyai dua pilihan. Dengan cara ini, dia sekarang bisa mendapatkan penghasilan bersih Rp.40.000 per hari, padahal sebelumnya dari satu usaha saja dia hanya mendapatkan Rp.20.000 per hari. Hal ini sangant membantu dia dalam mengembalikan pinjamannya ke KIVA. Saat ini, dia berharap mendapatkan pinjaman yang lebih besar dari sebelumnya. Rencananya pinjaman tersebut akan dipakai untuk mengembangkan usahanya lagi seperti menambah jumlah rombong dan peralatan yang diperlukan.
texts.en:
For Normawati (44) this is her second time loan. Before, KIVA through DINARI has lent her IDR 1.000.000 (USD 109.9) which she used to diversify her business of selling meatball soup. Now, with the help from KIVA she is developing another business of selling chicken noodle soup. This makes her customer happy of the variety. She enjoys raise on her daily net income, from IDR 20.000 (USD 2.2) of selling only meatball soup, to IDR 40.000 (USD 4.4) of selling both meals. This helps her in repaying her loan to KIVA and she hopes to receive bigger amount for her second loan. She plans to use the loan to buy new equipments and utensils needed to develop the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Sutriyani

texts.id: Usaha jual ayam goreng yang dijalani oleh Sutriyani cukup mengalami peningkatan. Dari hasil usahanya ini, dia sudah bisa melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya. Kali ini merupakan periode pinjaman kedua bagi Sutriyani, dan dia berharap mendapat jumlah pinjaman yang lebih besar dari sebelumnya. Pada pinjaman pertama dia mendapatkan bantuan modal usaha sebesar Rp.800.000. Modal tersebut telah dipergunakan untuk mendukung usahanya dengan membeli daging ayam, bumbu dan sayur-sayuran untuk lalapan. Usahanya ini saat ini bisa menambah penghasilannya dari Rp.60.000 menjadi Rp.100.000 setiap hari. Dengan kenaikan dari segi pendapatan dia berharap nantinya bisa mengembalikan pinjaman kedua ini tepat waktu seperti pinjaman pertama. Selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari, keuntungan yang diperoleh juga dipakai untuk menabung bagi pendidikan dan kesehatan bagi bayinya yang berusia 14 bulan.
texts.en:
Sutriyani’s Fried Chicken business is developing. From the business, she is able to repay her previous loan. This time is her second round of loan, and she expects to receive bigger amount of it. From her first loan, she received IDR 800.000 (USD 87.9). The loan was used to buy chicken meat, seasoning, and fresh vegetables that goes with the meal she is selling. From the loan and the business, she gains from IDR 60.000 (USD 6.6) to IDR 100.000 (USD 10.98) a day. With the income raise, she hopes to repay her second loan on time like she did for the first loan. The profit from her business will be used to support her daily needs and to save for education and health care of her 14-months old baby.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Dasirah

texts.id: Usaha jual nasi goreng yang dijalani Dasirah (46) sampai saat ini masih berjalan lancar. Saat ini Dasirah sudah melunasi pinjaman yang pertama, dan bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman yang kedua yang nantinya akan dipakai modal untuk mendukung usahanya, seperti membeli bahan untuk nasi goreng berupa sayur dan bumbu, dan ada juga yang dipakai untuk memperbaiki sarana usahanya yaitu gerobak dorong. Dari pinjamannya yang pertama, Dasirah sudah mengalami peningkatan dari segi pendapatan harian dari Rp.50,000 per hari menjadi Rp.100.000 sekarang ini. Dengan semakin meningkatnya usaha jual nasi goreng miliknya, dia bisa melunasi pinjaman yang pertama sebelum masa pinjaman berakhir. Dasirah berharap, dia diberi pinjaman yang lebih besar untuk mengembangkan usahanya ini.
texts.en:
Dasirah's (46) fried rice business is running well so far. Currently Dasirah has paid off her first loan and wishes to apply for a second loan which will be used for additional capital to purchase ingredients in a form of vegetables and spices as well as to fix her pushing cart. From her first loan, Dasirah already increases her earning from 50,000 IDR to 100,000 IDR* per day. As her business grows, she was able to pay off her first loan even before it was due. Dasirah wishes that she could get a bigger loan to expand her business. *1 USD is roughly 9,000 IDR

Translated from Indonesian by Arliadi (Ludi) Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding working capital

loans.name: Titik

texts.id: Titik H. (36) adalah ibu 2 anak dan memiliki usaha sebagai penjual kue. Saat ini dia sudah memasuki tahap pinjaman kedua, setelah sebelumnya telah melunasi pinjaman yang pertama. Pada pinjaman pertama, modal usaha yang deberikan dipakai untuk membeli bahan dasar membuat kue seperti tepung, telor dan alat membuatnya. Usahanya tersebut memberikan dia keuntungan sekitar Rp.100.000 setiap harinya, terlebih lagi di saat hari raya umat agama seperti Galungan dan Lebaran. Biasanya pada hari raya tersebut, banyak masyarakat yang memesan kue untuk perayaan. Contohnya saat ini memasuki masa menjelang Lebaran, Titik mendapat banyak pesanan kue untuk perayaan nantinya. Oleh karena itu, dia butuh modal usaha yang lebih besar, dan dia sangat berharap bisa meneruskan usaha ini sampai benar-benar memiliki modal sendiri nantinya.
texts.en:
Titik H. (36) is a mother of two and sells cake. Currently she is in her second stage of funding, after paying off her first loan. During her first stage of the loan, the capital was used to purchase raw materials such as flour, eggs and equipments. She earns around 100,000 IDR* profit every day, especially during religious holidays such as Hindu's Galungan and Muslim's Idl Fitr. For example, during a period prior to Idl Fitr such as now, Titik receives a lot of orders. Hence, she needs more working capital and she really hopes she could continue her business until she could 100% fund it by her own. * 1USD is roughly 9,000 IDR

Translated from Indonesian by arliadi (ludi) mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding working capital

loans.name: Sri

texts.id: Sri I. (42) saat ini menjalani usaha sebagai penjual sembako, yaitu bahan-bahan pokok kebutuhan rumah tangga seperti beras, minyak tanah, makanan ringan bahkan ada juga rujak. Setiap hari dia mulai membuka warungnya dari jam 8 pagi sampai jam 7 malam. Para pelanggannya adalah mereka yang tinggal disekitar rumah tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Ahmad Yani Denpasar. Saat ini Sri I. telah melunasi pinjamannya yang pertama, dan bermaksud untuk meminjam lagi. Dari pinjamannya terdahulu, sebagian besar dipakai untuk membeli kebutuhan pokok untuk warungnya yang lalu kemudian dijual lagi. Dari usahanya saat ini dia bisa mendapatkan keuntungan Rp.400.000 setiap minggunya dan dia sangat bersyukur atas semua itu. Dia berharap, bisa diberi pinjaman yang lebih besar lagi yang nantinya akan dipakai untuk mengembangkan usahanya supaya lebih besar.
texts.en:
Sri I. sells staple goods, such as rice, kerosene, and snacks. Her kiosk is open for business from 8 am till 7 pm. Her clients are mostly her neighbours. She lives in Ahmad Yani Road, Denpasar. Sri I. has paid back her earlier loan and now asking for a second loan. Her first loan was used to purchase more merchandise for resale. This business brings her about $40 profit per week. She is thankful for her business success. She is hoping to get a bigger loan so she can expand her business faster.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Rohadiah

texts.id: Usaha Rohadiah (53) sebagai penjual barang bekas adalah dengan membeli barang bekas dari pemulung lalu kemudian dijual kembali ke pengumpul dengan harga yang lebih tinggi. Usaha ini tentu saja membutuhkan modal tunai, dan dia sangat berterimakasih sudah diberi bantuan pinjaman modal untuk usahanya. Modal usaha yang dia terima sudah dipakai untuk usahanya ini dan memberikan keuntungan yang cukup besar, oleh karena itu dia bisa melunasi pinjamannya lebih cepat dari waktu seharusnya. Saat ini dia sudah melunasi pinjamannya yang pertama dan ingin meminjam lagi dalam jumlah yang lebih besar dari sebelumnya. Dengan semakin banyaknya modal yang dia miliki, dia berharap pemasukan dari usahanya bisa lebih besar. Keuntungan tersebut ingin dia sisihkan untuk tabungan pendidikan anaknya nanti. Anaknya saat ini masih berusia 12 tahun, dari suaminya Sunarto yang berprofesi sebagai pemulung.
texts.en:
Rohadiah works as a used junk seller. She buys used goods from collectors then sold to wholesaler at higher price. This business is very cash intensive. She is very grateful for previous loan that she used to expand her business and brought her more profit. She paid back her previous loan earlier than promised and now asking for a bigger loan. With increased funding, she hopes to expand her business. She plans to use the business profit to pay for her child's tuition. Rohadiah is 53 year old and married to Sunarto, who works as a junk collector. Her child is 12 year old.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mr. Chin B. is a 37 year old fisherman who earns US$2.20 per day. He lives in Anlong Somnor Commune, Siem Reap Province with his wife, Mrs. Prom Saly. Mrs. Prom Saly is a 39 year old farmer, who has been farming since 1990, earning about US$2 per day. Chin lives with his four children, all of whom live in the family home and are students. To increase his family's income, Chin has requested a loan of US$275 to purchase more tools (nets etc.) for his fishing business. He hopes that the loan will help him to expand his business and increase family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing tools for his fishing business

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en: This is the fourth time Mrs. Soeurng S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a rice and Khmer cake seller in Kann Yuor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Ech Morn, is a pig breeder in the local village. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for her husband's business. Mrs. Soeurng S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Previously, Mrs. Soeurng S. had obtained a loan to buy Khmer cakes to resell, and she has fully paid it back. Her husband is on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for her husband's business.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: This is the fourth time Mrs. Hok S. has taken out the loan to improve her business. She owns a rice store in Kann Yuor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Hok S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Hok S. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sam Nath, assists his wife in business in order to improve their living conditions together. Mrs. Hok S. is 53 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Hok S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell.

loans.name: Aorn

texts.en: This is the fourth time Mrs. Aorn K. T. has taken out a loan to improve her business. She is 29 and single, and she owns a small grocery store in Kann Yuor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Aorn K. T. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business, and she has fully paid it back. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Aorn K. T. decided to ask for a loan again to buy more groceries to resell and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men C. L. owns a small grocery store in Kampong Prasath Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Thin Korng, is a dentist and farmer in the local village. Since it is the rainy season, Mr. Thin Korng needs to cultivate rice; unfortunateL., he does not have animals to plow. Thus, Mrs. Men C. L. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with oxen to plow the field in order to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To hire a labourer with oxen to plow the field in order to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia C. L. lives in Armenia, in the municipality of Sonsonate. Like many Salvadorian women, Amalia is a single mother of five children that live with her and for whom with much courage and sacrifice she has managed to get ahead. 25 years ago Amalia started a hair cutting business that became the cornerstone of her life and with which she could bring food to her children's table. With a firm vision of progress, Amalia expanded her business and opened a small Cosmetology academy, with the aim of covering her growing expenses due to her extensive family. Unfortunately, two years ago the C. family suffered a tragedy that would cloud her future. Like many Salvadorians, Amalia was the victim of a whim of nature. losing all of her furniture in the latest earthquake in El Salvador. The earthquake ruined all of her furniture and caused severe damage to her business and house. Amalia didn't give up and with enormous maternal instinct, she pulled strength from weakness and decided on picking herself up, requested a loan to restart her business, buying cosmetology (dyes, shampoos, combs, etc.) that will allow her to get back on track, which she has been on for more than 25 years.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Amalia C. L. vive en Armenia, municipio del departamento de Sonsonate. Como muchas mujeres salvadoreñas, Amalia es madre soltera de cinco hijos, que viven con ella, y a quienes con valor y sacrificio ha logrado sacar adelante. Desde hace ya 25 años, Amalia inició un negocio de corte de pelo, que se volvió la piedra angular de su vida, y con el que pudo llevar diariamente pan a la mesa de sus hijos. Con una firme visión de progreso, Amalia amplió su negocio y abrió una pequeña academia de Cosmetología, con el fin de cubrir sus gastos acrecentados por su extensa familia. Lastimosamente hace ya un par de años, la historia de la familia C. sufre una tragedia que nublaría su futuro. Como muchos salvadoreños, Amalia fue víctima de un capricho de la naturaleza, perdiendo todos sus muebles en el último terremoto en tierras salvadoreñas. El terremoto arruino todos sus muebles y causo severos daños a su negocio y casa. Amalia no desiste y con un enorme instinto maternal, saca fuerzas de flaqueza, y se encuentra decidida a levantarse, solicitando un préstamo para reinicar su negocio, comprando productos de cosmetología (Tintes, Shampoos, Peines,etc), que le permitan recuperar el buen camino , en el que desde hace ya 25 años lleva firmes de su mano, a sus cinco hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products (Dyes, shampoos, combs, etc.)

loans.name: Arif

texts.id: Arif M. menggeluti usaha sebagai pembuat dan penjual krupuk. Krupuk adalah makanan khas Indonesia terbuat dari tepung yang digoreng dan mengembang, dan biasanya dimakan bersama nasi. Setiap hari dia berkeliling menjual krupuk, dari satu warung ke warung lain, terutama ke pelanggan tetapnya. Krupuk merupakan makanan ringan yang paling laris karena harganya murah. Disamping itu, rasanya yang juga gurih membuat orang sangat senang memakannya bersama nasi. Bahan dasar pembuat krupuk sebenarnya hanyalah tepuk yang sudah dijadikan adonan, lalu dibentuk menjadi bulatan tipis lalu kemudian dijemur sampai kering. Setelah kering, krupuk digoreng menggunakan minyak panas sampai mengembang. Setelah selesai digoreng krupuk siap untuk dijual. Dengan harga yang sangat murah yaitu Rp.100 per buah, krupuk menjadi sangat familiar dengan masyarakat. Dari anak kecil sampai dewasa mengkonsumsi krupuk. Arif merasa usaha ini sangat menjanjikan. Oleh karena itu Arif berkeinginan memohon pinjaman dana untuk mengembangkan usahanya supaya lebih berkembang.
texts.en:
Arif M. makes and sells krupuk. Krupuk is Indonesian traditional cracker made of dough that is deep fried to fluff, usually eaten as side dishes with rice. Every day he travels from one kiosk to another selling his krupuks, usually to his regular clients. People likes krupuk due to its crispy texture, savory taste and cheap price. Arif makes krupuk by mixing flour to make the dough, then sun dried. After drying, krupuk is deep fried to make the dough fluff. After frying, the krupuks are then ready to be sold. Due to its very cheap price (Rp. 100 or US$ 1 cent per piece), krupuk is very popular. People of every age, from little kids to adults eats krupuks. Arif feels that this business can be promising. Seeing this potential, Arif is seeking loans to expand his business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Hoar

texts.en: This the third time Mrs. Hoar M. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She was born in 1972 and she is a farmer in Preak Talai Village in Kandal Province. On her plantation, she cultivates twice a year. Since Mrs. Hoar M.'s field is now infertile and she does not have enough rice seeds for cultivating, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds. In addition, Mrs. Hoar M. would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticide to kill insects. Her husband, Mr. Nao Sal, is a stove maker and helps his wife when he has free time. Mrs. Hoar M. has four children who are 15, 12, 8, and 6, and they are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seeds to cultivate and buy pesticide to kill insects.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa S. was born in 1954 and she now lives in Preak Talai Village in Kandal Province. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school. Mrs. Soa S. is a pig breeder. Previously, she had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business, and she has fully paid it back. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Soa S. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng K. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Svay Chuor Village in Kandal Province. She is a widow with six children, two of whom are vegetable farmers while the others are attending school. Mrs. Sreng K. owns a small store on the street where she sells food for passengers. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients in order to reach her customer demand. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients in order to reach her customer demand.

loans.name: Hoeung

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeung P. is a villager in Chek Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who tries to work hard on a small piece of land growing rice and vegetables.
