Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Since the second business is going well, Mrs. Hoeung P. wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Hoeung P. is a 48-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Khoeng

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeng S. lives in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Phai Rorn, is a farmer. In order to meet the family expenses, he tries to work hard on the rice field where he cultivates twice a year. In his farming, Mr. Phai Rorn faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to purchase rice seeds for cultivating. Therefore his wife decided to ask for a loan for her husband, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to protect the crops from insects. Mrs. Khoeng S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Khoeng S. had obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to hire a laborer to plow the rice field, and to buy rice seeds and pesticides. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds for cultivating and buy more pesticides to protect the crops from insects.

loans.name: Ngi

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Ngi T. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She lives in Preak Run Village in Kandal Province. She is a vegetable farmer who grows cabbage, potatoes and garlic. Her husband, Mr. Chheng Dara, helps his wife with farming in order to improve their living conditions together. 

Since Mrs. Ngi T.'s farming is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds to grow, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to protect the crops from insects. Mrs. Ngi T. has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Ngi T. had obtained $150 from AMK to buy pesticides, and she has fully paid it back. Mrs. Ngi T. is busy with her work, so her husband, Mr. Chheng Dara, is shown in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Soaphy

texts.en: Mrs. Soaphy P. is  a 48-year-old widower who sells groceries, including biscuits, candy, oil, and ingredients for cooking food. She also makes Khmer cakes to sell. She has been selling since 2001, earning about US$3.00 per day. She has two children, both of whom are students and who live in Compong Kdei Commune, Siem Reap Province.  Because of increasing customer demand she wants to satisfy her needs. Hence, Mrs. Soaphy seeks a loan of US$500 to purchase more grocery stocks to sell. The rest she will use for Khmer cake making.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stocks for sell and the rest use for Khmer cake making

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Phann K. E. has taken out a loan to improve her business. She is a Khmer Cheese (Prohok) maker in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. In this business, Mrs. Phann K. E. can earn around $4 per day. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Phann K. E. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more small fish to make Prohok to sell. Her husband, Mr. Nheb Tuot, assists his wife in business. Mrs. Phann K. E. is 51 years old and the mother of seven children, four of whom are employed in different business activities while the others are attending school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more small fish to make Prohok (Khmer Cheese) to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen Elena de Galdámez lives in Armenia, in the municipality of Sonsonate, with her husband and two children. The older is an 11 year old girl and the younger is a 6 year old boy; both attend primary school.

Carmen's husband sells metal structures and she sells cosmetics and beauty products. Because of the school fees for her children and the fixed household expenses Carmen doesn't get to spend that much time with her children; she has to walk around the nearby streets and neighborhoods trying to sell her products in order to earn a little more income. Thinking about spending more time with her children, Carmen dreams about putting up her own store in her house that would allow her to be more involved in her children's development. In search of this dream, Carmen is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics, lotions and perfumes, with the aim of improving day by day the condition of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen Elena de Galdámez vive en Armenia, municipio de Sonsonate, con su esposo y dos hijos. La mayor es una niña de 11 años y el pequeño tiene tan solo seis, ambos cursan su educación primaria. El esposo de Carmen vende estructuras metálicas, y ella vende cosméticos y productos de belleza. Por causa de los continuos gastos que provoca la colegiatura de los niños y los costos fijos del hogar, Carmen Elena no logra pasar tanto tiempo con sus hijos, y debe ambular en calles y colonias aledañas, intentando vender sus productos, para reunir un poco mas de ganancias. Pensando en poder pasar más tiempo con sus niños, Carmen sueña con poner una venta propia en su casa que le permita estar presente en el crecimiento de sus hijos. En búsqueda de este sueño, Carmen Elena solicita un préstamo, para comprar cosméticos, lociones y perfumes, con la mirada puesta en mejorar diariamente el presente de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, perfumes and lotions

loans.name: Laos

texts.en: Mrs. Laos M. was born in 1962 and she now lives in Phlov Trei Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Mao Oun, own a small piece of land where they grow a lot of mango trees. In farming they face a problem because insects come to damage the crop, so Mrs. Laos M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pesticides to kill all the insects, and she would use the rest of the loan to purchase more fertilizer to support her mango trees. Mrs. Laos M. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The youngest one is enrolled in school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pesticides to kill all the insects and fertilizer to support the mango trees.

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Mrs. Saom S. is 52 years old and she is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She gives massages in the local village, and her husband, Mr. Choem Sam, is house construction worker who can generate a small income to support his family. In Mr. Choem Sam's business, he faces a small problem because he does not have enough homebuilding equipment. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Saom S., decided to ask for a loan to buy equipment for her husband. 

They have three children, one owns a small grocery store in the local market while another one is working in Thailand as a laborer. The youngest one is 18 years and is a waiter in a Chinese noodle restaurant. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy homebuilding equipment.

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoem T. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Kouk Romeat Village in Kandal Province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is pursuing Bachelor's Degree in Phnom Penh, Cambodian city. The remaining two are attending school. Since Mrs. Nhoem T.'s living conditions are poor, she cannot afford the school fees for her fist child so she decided to ask for a loan to pay for them. Mrs. Nhoem T. hopes to improve her child's knowledge with this loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to pay for her child's college fees.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang H. was born in 1955 and she is a farmer in Svay Chuor Village in Kandal Province. She grows only cabbage in the field. Her husband, Mr. Tun Khnong, assists her on the plantation. They have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The remaining three are attending school. Although these family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Seang H. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a breeding business, and she would use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food to feed her pigs. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a breeding business and pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos P. Meléndez lives in the small town of Armenia in the province of Sonsonate. For five years now, Santos has been running a small business selling sandals and CDs. He lives with his wife and four children, all of them school aged. His large family gives him various costs and economic complications, but at the same time, it's family that gives him inspiration and a desire to advance. The journey hasn't been easy; in the beginning Santos lacked work capital and no banking institution trusted him nor loaned him money. This forced him to borrow money from individual lenders that sometimes charged him interest costs much higher than that of the loan itself. With courage and faith in himself Santos never stopped believing in his dream. Santos P. dreams about opening a store selling milk products and clothing, which will guarantee a decent education for his children. For now, Santos is looking to expand his business. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan to buy more sandals and CDs, which will help his small shop to grow and develop.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos P. Meléndez vive en el pequeño pueblo de Armenia, en el departamento de Sonsonate. Desde hace ya cinco años, Santos maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de sandalias y discos musicales (cd´s). Junto a él, viven su esposa y cuatro hijos, todos pequeños y todos estudiantes en la escuela. Su amplia familia le provoca múltiples gastos y complicaciones económicas, pero a la vez, es la misma familia, quien se vuelve su inspiración y fuerzas de avanzar. El camino no ha sido fácil, pues en sus inicios, Santos carecía de capital de trabajo, y ninguna institución bancaria confiaba en el, ni le prestaba dinero. Esto lo forzó a prestar dinero a prestamistas individuales, que le cobraban tasas de intereses a veces más altas que el préstamo mismo. Con valor y fe en sí mismo, Santos nunca dejo de creer en su visión. Santos P. sueña con abrir una venta de de lácteos y ropa, que garantice a sus hijos, una educación decente. Por ahora, Santos busca expandir su negocio. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo para comprar más sandalias y cd´s, que ayuden al crecimiento y desarrollo de su pequeña venta

loans.use: Purchase of sandals and CDs to sell

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She is a mat maker and her husband, Mr. Ong Saophornarith, is a teacher who makes $30 per month.  Mrs. Seng S. faces a problem with her business because she does not have a sewing machine, which she needs to sew the edge of the mats. Therefore, Mrs. Seng S. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Mrs. Seng S. is 43 years old and the mother of four children who all attend high school. Her husband is to the right of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to sew the edge of the mats.

loans.name: Boeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Boeurn S. lives in Roka Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Chhuom Chhoeun, is a construction worker. They have seven children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other five attend school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Boeurn S.'s family has only three business activities which make a small income to meet the needs of household expenses. Currently, the family do not have a toilet in the house. Thus, Mrs. Boeurn S. has decided to ask for a loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a toilet for the household.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town. He has settled in the Fizuli region, in a Bahmanli village. He was born in 1987 and is single. You can see his sister in the picture. Nizami has run a cattle breeding business for 7 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy two calves to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Mrs. Uth C. was born in 1968 and she now lives in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks food for her husband and children. Her husband, Sa Thavy, sells ice-cream in the local village. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand his customer base by selling products from door to door, but needs a motorbike to travel around. Thus, Mrs. Uth C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband's business. Mrs. Uth C. has two children who both attend high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S. was born in 1973 and she now lives in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Sin S. is a farmer who works very hard on a piece of land next to the village. Since it now is the rainy season, Mrs. Sin S. needs to cultivate rice. In order to do this, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase rice seeds. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers for her field.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and to buy fertilizers for her field.

loans.name: Thi Tinh's Group

texts.vi:
chị N. thị Tình năm nay 41 tuổi Ms 01020028 chị vay mức 3.186.000 VND để buôn thóc và chăn nuôi lợn. vợ chồng chị sinh được 4 con, 2 con gái đi lấy chồng, 1 con đi làm và 1 con đang đi học. Chồng chị ngoài việc chăn nuôi, anh còn đi đánh bắt cá về bán.Vì vậy mức thu nhập của gia đình từ 120.000 VND đến 150.000 VND / ngày. Nên chị rất thích hình thức vay vốn này vì nó giúp chị có cơ hội trả dần. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Tính Ms 01020004 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Cảnh Ms 01020063 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ buôn thóc, gạo
  • chị Nguyễn thị Chiên Ms 01020064 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để sản xuất giò chả
  • chị Nguyễn thị Đức Ms 01020065 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi buôn thóc, gạo
texts.en:
Mrs N. thị Tình is 41 years old. She is seeking a loan of 3.186.000 VND to buy rice for retail and to raise pigs. She is married and has 4 children: 2 girls who are already married, 1 who is working and the youngest one is still in school. Her husband is responsible for the pigs. He is also a fisherman. Her family income is 120.000 VND to 150.000 VND a day. She likes SEDA program a lot because it gives her the opportunity to pay back in small payments. Her group is comprised of:
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Tính, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND. She sells basic goods
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Cảnh, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND. She sells rice
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Chiên, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND. She's a sausage maker
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Đức Ms, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND. She sells rice

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise pigs and sells rice

loans.name: Than

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Than S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She owns a small grocery store in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Tun Vuthy, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Than S.’s family has little money and they cannot afford to build a new house. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Than S. has four children one of whom works in a garment factory while the other three are enrolled in school. Previously, Mrs. Than S. had obtained a loan to start her current business and she has now paid it back.

loans.use: to buy timbersto build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: This is the second time that Mrs. Chea S. E. has asked for a loan to improve her standard of living. She is a cow breeder in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. YoE. Iv, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support his family. Mrs. Chea S. E. is 34 years old and the mother of four children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others all attend school. Her eldest child’s workplace is far from home and Mrs.Chea S. E. spends a lot of money on moto-taxis for her son. She is therefore asking for a loan so that she can buy a motorbike for her son so that he no longer has to pay for taxis.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son

loans.name: Alsafa

texts.en: Alsafa was born in 1978. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli town. Alsafa has settled in the Fizuli region in the Mahmudlu village. He is single. Five years ago, he started a business in clothing and shoe sales. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy shoes and clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: Sevil is the mother of 3 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She settled in the Fizuli region, in a Garabulag village. Sevil was born in 1971. You can see in the picture Sevil's husband. This family has been in this business for 6 years. Now they need a loan of $875 to buy a calf to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Namoz

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Намоз житель  города Турсунзаде. Возраст 37 лет, женат , имеет 4 детей. На местном рынке города Турсунзаде имеет небольшую торговую точку,где торгует продуктами питания. Имеет опыт в бизнесе более 3 лет. В данный момент хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, для чего ему нужны деньги. Намоз решил взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Namoz A. lives in the city of Tursunzoda. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children. At the local Tursunzoda market he has a small stall where he sells foodstuffs. This has been his sphere of business for three years. Now he wants to expand his inventory, and to do that he needs money. Namoz decided to take out a 10-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Market stall inventory expansion

loans.name: Kalamnisso

texts.ru: Азизова Каламниссо жительница города Куляб.Возраст 62 года, замужем  , имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Каламниссо занимается куплей продажей ткани для пошива женской одежды. Она покупает оптом товар  на оптовом рынке и реализует его в розницу. Этот вид деятельности  является  основным источником дохода  ее большой семьи.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. В даный момент Каламниссо  хочет закупить  ткань для чего ей нужны деньги . Посоветовавшись с близкими она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Kalamnisso A. lives in the city of Kulyab. She is 62 years old, married, and has four children. She has a secondary education. Kalamnisso sells fabrics for making women's clothing. She buys goods wholesale at the wholesale market and sells them retail. This activity is her large family's primary source of income because her husband is temporarily unemployed. Now Kalamnisso wants to stock up on fabric, which will require money. After talking with those close to her, she decided to apply for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Камалова Мавджуда жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 34 года , замужем, имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее .Клиентка занимается куплей продажей  детской одежды. Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на рынке « Саховат» . Торговля помогает тей содержать семью. В данный момент Мавжуда хочет увеличить ассортимент тороговй точки. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavjuda K. lives in Tursunzoda. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She completed high school. Mavjuda sells children's clothing from her small stall at the Sakhovat Market. Her business helps support her family. Now Mavjuda wants to increase the inventory at her stall. She will pay back the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand market stall inventory

loans.name: Bibiroy

texts.ru: Давлатова Бибирой жительница района Яван. Возраст 50 лет, вдова , имеет 5 детей. Бибирой занимается пошивом женской одежды. Имеет опыт в этой деяйтельности более 12 лет. Этот бизнес помогает содержать ей свою большую семьюь.Дети Бибирой еще учатся в средней школе. В данный момент клиентка хочет купить более современную швейную машинку.Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 9 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bibiroy D. lives in Yavan. She is 50 years old, a widow, and has five children. Bibiroy tailors women’s clothes. She has been doing this for more than twelve years. This business helps to support her large family. Bibiroy’s children are still in high school. Now, the client wants to buy a more modern sewing machine. Therefore, she has decided to take out a loan for nine months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Саидова Инобат жительница города Турсунзаде. Вдова , имеет 2 детей. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей и фруктов на рынке «Дехкон».Она скупает у местных крестьян фрукты и овощи оптом. На доход от  торговли она содержит своих детей. Сейчас она хочет закупить юольше товара. Планирует погасить кредитт в течении 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Inobat S. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is a widow with two children. She works buying and selling vegetables and fruit in the Dekhon market. She buys fruit and vegetables wholesale from local farmers. She supports her children with this income. Now she wants to buy more goods. She plans to pay off the loan in fifteen months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying goods

loans.name: Djalal

texts.en: Djalal (his father is pictured) was born in 1972. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in the Fizuli region, in a Kayidish village. This village was built for IDPs. Djalal is married and has 2 children. He has been in this business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy fruits and vegetables to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Holnisso

texts.ru: Нурова Холниссо жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 37 лет, разведенна , имеет 3 детей. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей пледов и одеял. Она торгует на рынке «Саховат».Содержит своих детей она сама,так как  муж бросил семью.Холниссо хочет получить кредит на увеличение ассортимента торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 8 месяцев..
texts.en:
Holnisso N. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 37 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. The client buys and sells rugs and blankets. She trades in the Sakhovat market. She supports the children herself since her husband abandoned the family. Holnisso wants to take out a loan to increase the variety of goods in her shop. She plans to pay off the loan in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Lutfillo

texts.en:
Lutfillo D. is 34 years old. He is married with 3 children. Lutfillo is an optimistic, hard-working father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Lutfillo has been in agro-business for more than 4 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix up his house and save enough money to pay for his kids’ school. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) which he has committed to repay within 10 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Lutfillo appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.en:
Nurmahmad E. is 37 years old. He is married with two school-age children. At first Nurmahmad worked as a car driver. But what he earned was not enough to feed his family. That’s why 10 years ago he decided on also running a farming business.

Nurmahmad is a strong man who works hard every day to obtain a good harvest, never wasting a moment of valuable time. Thanks to his efforts he has been able to provide for the well-being and education of his family. Nurmahmad grows potatoes, onions, and carrots. He feels fortunate to have the opportunity to obtain some financing for his lands. He plans to invest in seeds and some pesticides.

For this reason Nurmahmad is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) for the term of 10 months. The loan will help him avoid borrowing from informal lenders who charge way too much and take a large part of the profits he makes from his crops. He expresses his gratitude to everyone who decided to support him.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and some pesticides for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Кудратов Рузибой .житель района Шахринау.Возраст 26 лет, холост. Клиент живет  с престарелыми родителями. Рузибой имеет небольшой лепешечный цех на местном рынке.Этот бизнеес явяляется основным источником дохода его семьи.Так как родители Рузибоя пенсионеры. На полученный кредит клиент хочет закупить  муку для выпечки хлебобулочных изделий. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Ruziboy K. lives in Shahrinav. He is 26 years old and single. The client lives with his elderly parents. Ruziboy has a small flat-bread shop in the local market. Because his parents are pensioners, this business is the main source of income for his family. When he receives the loan, Ruziboy wants to buy flour for baked goods. He plans to pay off the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing flour

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon I. is 35 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 3 children. Guljahon is an enterprising woman with a great desire to improve the quality of life of her family.

Guljahon produces mouse traps. She has been in this business for more than 15 years. This is a hard job and her husband and her kids help her at it. Guljahon wants her children to get a good education, thus allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes her sacrifice worthwhile.

There is a big demand for mouse traps in autumn but Guljahon doesn't have enough raw materials to produce them. That’s why she wants to borrow money and buy more raw materials. She needs a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the down-payment that she will repay over a period of 12 months. You can play an important part in Guljahon's family's life; she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her. .

loans.use: Buying raw materials for mouse traps

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Арипов Абдусалом житель района Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет, женат , имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Клиент занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота.Он покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков, откармливает их .После 40 дней откормки реализует их на рынке.На доход от этого бизнеса Абдусалом содержит свою семью.Сейчас он хочет получить кредит для покупки 2 бычков. Планирует погасить кредит в течении10месяцев
texts.en:
Abdusalom A. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education. This client raises cattle. He buys calves in the local market and fattens them. After fattening them for forty days, he resells them at the market. Abdusalom supports his family with the income from this business. Now he wants to take out a loan to purchase two calves. He plans to pay off the loan in ten months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying two calves

loans.name: Mohammad Rahim

texts.en:
Mohammad Rahim is married. He lives with his wife. His children are married, and his wife is a homemaker, so he is supporting her. He works as a tinsmith, a business that he has been involved in for more than 14 years in Kabul. He has a good number of workers; some of his students are good workers. They have shops in Kabul. But he has 3 workers now, so he needs a loan to further his business. In the last 5 months, he is looking weak in his business.

He bought a house in Kabul and he spent all his money on his house, but now he can't work well. Therefore he needs a loan. He wants to take out an individual loan to complete his stock and ship more boxes to the bazaar.

He is happy with this loan process in his country. He suggests other workers should use these loans and he wants to thank lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock and ship more boxes to the bazaar

loans.name: Hasina's Darajabovu Group

texts.en:
Hasina is 25 years and is married with a 1 year old child. She has been a bites seller since 2006. She works everyday from 6am to 5pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Hasina has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Hasina is now requesting a loan to further expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes, bites, firewood and charcoal.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Salha's Wakakamavu Group

texts.en:
Salha is 23 years and is married with a 2 years old child. She has been selling clothes since 2006. She works everyday from 10am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $37 from her sales.

In the past, Salha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salha now requests a loan to buy more clothes for her business for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanahija, who has a business selling bananas, cassavas and sweet potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nuriyya

texts.en: Nuriyya (her husband is pictured) is married with 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. She settled in the Fizuli region in the Horadiz settlement, an area built specifically for IDPs. Nuriyya and her husband have been in this business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy fruits and vegetables to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en:
Gulom K. is a young man who works on agricultural activities and has many plans. He is 27 years old, married with a child. Five years ago he decided to work in agri-business in his parents’ fields, working very hard and applying what he learned while in university, he is also writing his thesis and preparing to defend it.

On his plot of land he grows different kinds of vegetables. Because his parents are ill and also because he has a small child, he works from early morning till late night hoping to gather a rich harvest. This is why Gulom is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) that he's is willing to pay back over 10 months.

With this money, he will be able to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds to grow seasonal vegetables and make improvements to his business. With his effort, dedication, and your important contribution, his land will produce more and better products.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is a very responsible and hard working woman. She is married and has four adorable children. Three years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She rents a sewing workshop which produces clothes she sells in the market. Her kids go to kindergarten and school.

Nazira wishes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a loan of 700 USD that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover the customers' demands. She commits herself to return back the amount in 12 months. From the money she earns she wants to fix the house and pay for her kids’ education.

Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Nazira's business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for making school clothes.

loans.name: Djamaladdin

texts.en: Djamaladdin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He settled in the Fizuli region in the Arayitli village. He was born in 1967, is married, and has 3 children. He has run this business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy two calves to improve his cattle business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Komshot

texts.en: Mrs. Komshot P.  is 29 years old, and her husband, Pouv Pho, is 32 years old. They are fishermen on the Tonle Sap Lake. They live with three children, all of whom are students who live in the Anlong Somnor Commune, Sieap Reap Province. To develop their business she has decided to request a loan of US$250 to purchase more fishing tools (fishing nets etc.). Mrs. Komshot hopes the loan will improve their business so that they can sufficiently support their family.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing tools including nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Siti's Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Siti is 35 years and is married with 3 children ages 6, 4 and 2. She has been selling clothing since 2001. She works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

Siti now requests a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sabah and Hamisa, who also have businesses selling clothing and food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re- sale

loans.name: Fatma's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Fatma is married and has a 6 month old child. She has been selling clothes since 2005. She works everyday from 8am to 4pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Amina.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en: R. Gulandom is 30 years old. She is married with two school age children. Gulandom’s business is sewing women’s clothes. She has a sewing workshop at her mother’s house because she can’t afford to have it in her house. Fortunately, the good service that she offers and the good materials with which she works helps her to make a monthly profit from her small factory.  Thanks to this job, which she works hard from 8AM until the late hours of the night, she can cover the costs of her home and of the education for her two dear children. She has only one sewing machine right now. As a result of the large quantity of orders, she needs to acquire another machine to satisfy her orders.  Today she asks for a loan of 1400 Somoni (425 USD) for the term of 12 months to buy a sewing machine and repair sewing workshop. With your help, Gulandom can grow her business and improve her family’s quality of life. She thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: For repair of the workshop and to purchase a second sewing machine.

loans.name: Ilgor

texts.en:
This is the story of Ilgor T. who, at the young age of 25, has managed to make a path for himself, working the land he inherited from his parents, with great effort but, above all, with great love, as that land constitutes his patrimony.

In spite of being already independent and not having responsibilities towards others, he wishes to increase his production, so that, when he decides to start a family, he’ll be able to offer them financial stability and a cozy place to share many happy moments. He saves every day toward this goal, and remains a good son to his parents, helping out financially whenever necessary and providing a little extra money for his younger brothers’ well-being.

In this way, Ilgor helps his loved ones and works to ensure a promising future for himself. In order for his dreams and wishes to come true, he needs the support of your generous heart. Today Ilgor asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 12 months. With this loan, he’ll be able to improve his produce and increase his income and savings to then start his family. With your collaboration he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizers and paying for labor force for his land

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet was born in 1974, is married, and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He settled in the Fizuli region in the Alkhanli village. He has been in this business for 7 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy foods to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy foods to improve his business

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
Narzullo U. is 42 years old. He is married with 4 children. Narzullo and his wife work together in the cultivation of potatoes, onions, and carrots, something he has done since he was very young. Thanks to his work, he's been able to provide an adequate education for his four beloved children.

Narzullo has a big family. Besides his wife and children, he is also supporting his mother who is very ill. This year he hopes to get a rich harvest so he will be able to take his mother to a good hospital which is very expensive. With this purpose in mind, he is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) for the term of 10 month in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer to grow seasonal vegetables. With your help he can grow his business and provide his beloved mother with good treatment in a good hospital.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi G. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Komi exerce depuis plus de 6 ans, le métier de menuiserie à Adeta un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il espère, par ce troisième crédit, acheter des planches pour l’exécution des commandes reçues et aussi pour aménager son atelier. Il espère mieux gagner sa vie par les gains qu’engendrera son activité.
texts.en:
Komi G. is 37 years old, married and the father of two children. For six years Komi has been working as a carpenter in Adeta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this third loan he hopes to buy planks of wood to fulfill the orders he has received and also make improvements to his workshop. He hopes to make a better living from the earnings his business will create.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks of wood to fulfill orders he has received and also improve his workshop

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mr. Eng C., 64, is a farmer who grows rice as well as being a construction worker. He can earn up to about US $3.00 per day. He lives in Compong Kdei Commune, Siem Reap Province. His wife, Mrs. Hem Lab is 58 years old and a Khmer cake and desert seller and earns about US $2.50 per day. They both have three children, all of whom are married. One lives in the family home with her husband, whilst the other lives away. Currently, it is the rice growing season and Eng is now requesting a loan of $500 to spend on their farming business (to buy things such as fertilizer). The remainder of the loan he will use for his wife business making Khmer cake and deserts. The loan will support their investments to increase their income. Eng's wife is in picture because Eng is unavailable.

loans.use: to expand the farming business

loans.name: Zalfa's Kina Mama Bora Group

texts.en:
Zalfa is 22 years old and is married. She has been tailoring clothes since 2005. She works everyday from 8am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Zalfa now requests a loan in order to buy more tailoring materials for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Laila.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi S. is 40-years-old, married with four children. The family lives in Ojodu, Lagos State, Nigeria. Kemi has been selling eggs since 1996.

She is requesting a loan to buy a deep freezer so that she can begin selling frozen foods, thereby expanding her business and increasing her profit margin. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer to expand the business into frozen food sales

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is the mother of 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region in the Bala Bahmanli village. She was born in 1987. She has run a cattle breeding business for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy two calves to improve her cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Afi Glwadis

texts.fr: Afi Glwadis A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est revendeuse de bassines et d’assiettes de puis plus de 7 ans. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et par là mieux gagner sa vie
texts.en:
Afi Glwadis A., 42, is married and the mother of 5 children. She lives in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been selling bowls and plates for more than 7 years. With this loan, she would like to purchase more merchandise so as to satisfy the demands of her clientele and better earn her living in this fashion.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase plates and bowls for re-sale

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en:
Modupe A. lives in Ojodu, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 42-years-old and is married with three children. Modupe sells food staples; yams, rice, garri and plantain. She has been in this business since 1996.

Modupe is requesting the loan to buy more food staples for resale. She expresses her gratitude to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more food staples for resale

loans.name: Amina's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Amina is 33 years old and is married with one 15 years old child. Since 2003, she has owned a small shop. She works everyday from 7am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Amina now requests for a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mgeni.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Masha

texts.en:
Masha is 24 years old and has 2 children ages 8 and 6. She has run her own salon since 2007.She works everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Masha is now requesting a loan to buy more salon items so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items to expand her business.

loans.name: Adenuke

texts.en:
Adenuke A., 42, lives in Ojodu, Lagos State, Nigeria with her husband and four children. She has been producing and selling vaseline since 2003. Vaseline is a body cream that is used mostly by women and children in Nigeria. The demand for her product is high.

Adenuke is requesting the loan to purchase more raw materials to increase her production of vaseline so that she can supply her numerous customers. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for body cream production

loans.name: Abdulwosah

texts.en:
Abdulwosah is an uneducated man who works in agriculture. He lives in a household of 9 members, including his brother's family. Wosah lost his brother during the war in Kabul, 6 years ago. He is also supporting his brother's family. He has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years. He used to be able to support his two families well, but things are not very good now. He is faced with lots of economic difficulties in his family, so he wants to expand his business.

He needs money here to expand his business to help these two families. He wants to take out an individual loan to complete his seed stock and ready all his land for cultivation to work hard and make a better income to support his family.

He is happy about this loan. He would like to thank Kiva and the lenders that make this opportunity possible in this poor country where people are faced with lots of problems. He hopes to be successful in his business in the future.

loans.use: To complete his seed stock

loans.name: Bella

texts.fr:
Madame A. Bella est née le 31 décembre 1978 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a ouvert un magasin de vente de produits de premières nécessités à Lomé et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis de réaménager son magasin.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’achat des produits tels que 9 sacs de riz, 6 bidons d’huile, 5 sacs de sucre et 5 cartons de savons. Ainsi son stock sera attrayant et elle pourra mieux vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bella A. was born on December 31, 1978 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of 2 children. She has opened a store selling grocery staples in Lomé and buys her merchadise in the big market in Lomé. Her first loan allowed her to refurbish her store.

This second loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy some additional merchandise such as 9 sacks of rice, 6 jerry cans of oil, 5 sacks of sugar and 5 cases of soap. Thus her inventory will be more attractive and she will be able to sell more.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery staples

loans.name: Tanimowo

texts.en:
Tanimowo S. sells building materials; sand, cement, blocks, head pans, shovels, etc. She has been in this business since 2006. Tanimowo is 45-years-old and married with three children and lives in Ojodu, Lagos State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan to buy more building materials for resale. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials for resale

loans.name: Oluwashehun

texts.en:
Oluwashehun O. is a photographer and also engages in video coverage and she sells film. She learned how to take pictures two years ago. Oluwashehun is 50-years-old and is married with three children. The family lives in Ojodu, Ogun State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan to buy more film and a small camera and flash for her business expansion. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more film and one small camera and flash

loans.name: Ache

texts.en:
Ache is a 29 year old single woman with 2 children ages 11 and 8. She has been selling fruit since 2005. She works everyday from 10am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Ache now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for re-sale.

loans.name: Nofal

texts.en: Nofal is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He settled in the Fizuli region in the Geca Gozlu village. Nofal was born in 1956, is married, and has 4 children. He has been in the cattle breeding business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Dasola

texts.en:
Dasola S., 40, is married with four children. She sells food products; Elubo (grinded dried yam), palm and vegetable oil, and garri. These foods are used in the preparation of major Nigerian foods. She started selling these items in 2000.

Dasola is requesting a loan to buy more garri, palm and vegetable oil and increase her sales and profits. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food (Elubo, palm oil and vegetable oil and garri) for resale

loans.name: Aziza's K/hudumu Group

texts.en:
Aziza is 48 years old and is married with 2 children ages 11 and 8. Since 2003, she has been a tailor as well as a seller of juice and handbags. Each day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Aziza now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mkufu.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Fatimon

texts.en:
Fatimon A. is 26-years-old and married with one child. The family lives in Illogbo, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells beverages and provisions in her community. Her products include toothpaste, tomatoes paste, butter, milk and sugar. She started this business in 2005. Fatimon is hardworking; she opens her business at 8AM and closes for the day by 6:30PM. She loves her business and family.

She is requesting a loan to buy more beverages and provisions for resale. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and beverages for resale

loans.name: Mwashamba's Tukubaliane Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba is 24 years old. She is married. She has been a charcoal seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business.

Mwashamba now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Harusi.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret T. is 36 years old and married with two kids. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She needs the loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc to scale up sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education. She belongs to the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Her photograph was taken when her group was having a meeting. She would be thankful for that support.

loans.use: Margaret would like to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. for her small grocery shop.

loans.name: Eniola

texts.en: Eniola B. rears birds. She has been in this business since the year 2003. Eniola is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Jakunde, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a client of LAPO. She is requesting the loan amount of $850 to buy more pullets so that she can rear them into adult birds for sale. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more pullets

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. is a 46 year old mother of two children who are schooling. She is very hard working and resourceful for her family. She trades in charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Esther obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Sunyani, where she lives and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of charcoal to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children's educational fees. She belongs to the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Esther would like to buy a bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar has been in the taxi business for 5 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli town. He settled in the Fizuli region in the Horadiz village, an area built specifically for IDPs. He was born in 1967 and is single. Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Dame D. Edoh est née le 31 décembre 1970 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, ville située à 45km de la ville de Lomé. C’est une ville où la pêche est bien développée. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur AKOUETE Koffi qui est un agent de sécurité et a deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des légumes et des produits de premières nécessités. 
Compte tenu de l’approche des rentrées scolaires, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 10 cartons de cahiers et quelques fournitures scolaires. Avec l’achat de ces articles, elle pourra satisfaire les parents d’élèves de son quartier.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edoh D. was born on December 31, 1970 in Aného in the Prefecture of the Lakes, a town situated 45 km from the city of Lomé. This is a town where fishing plays a major role. Edoh is married to Mr. Koffi Akouete who is a security guard and they have 2 children. Her business is selling vegetables and grocery staples.

Since children will be going back to school soon, she is asking for this loan to purchase 10 cases of notebooks and some other school supplies for re-sale. With the purchase of those articles, she will be able to satisfy the needs of the parents of school children in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. started her local restaurant nine years ago in Goaso where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 35 years old and married with one kid and two step kids who are currently in school. Ama serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Ama wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: Ama would like to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood for her popular food stand.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla Nyawoulé est âgé de 25 ans et célibataire. Il réside à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Komla  tient depuis plus de 3 ans, un atelier d’exploitation des noix de palme destinées à la préparation de l’huile. Avec cette chance de Kiva, il peut commencer à tellement améliorer la qualité de sa vie.
texts.en:
Komla Nyawoulé is 25 years old and single. He lives in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. For three years Komla has had a work space for processing palm nuts used to make oil. With this opportunity from Kiva, he can begin to really improve his quality of life.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts to make and sell oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 50 years old. She is a wife and the mother of five kids who are all in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains a daily source of livelihood. She has been selling yams for seven years to support her family. Yam is one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in diets. Mary takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Mary is a member of a community group called Vineyard Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: Mary would like to buy yams in bulk to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose K. B. is 52 years old. She is a wife and the mother of two kids who are currently in school. She operates a clothing shop and sells jeans, clothes, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags and headscarves for the past eight years. Rose is constrained by lack of funds to run her business. She needs the loan to enable her to inject more working capital into her business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourceful in purchasing good quality items and large quantities to upgrade her inventory. She belongs to the community group called "Yonkopa" (meaning, good friend) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan

loans.use: Rose would like to purchase jeans, clothes, ladies wears and slippers for her women's clothing shop.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel O. is thirty three years old. He is married with two kids who are currently in school. Emmanuel is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like televisions, sound systems, speakers, electric fans, etc. He also provides repairs and service for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts. He belongs to the community group called Alive Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Emmanuel would like to increase his stock of electrical and electronic gadgets and parts for his electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Gismat

texts.en: Gismat is married and has one child. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli town. He settled in the Fizuli region in the Kayidish village, an area built specifically for IDPs. He was born in 1984. He has transported loads for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy  spare parts for this truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A., 45, lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria with her husband and five children. Grace buys fish at wholesale and sells to retail fish vendors.

She is requesting a loan to buy one deep freezer so that she can freeze her fish, thereby preserving it. This will enhance her profit margin. Grace thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy one deep freezer for preserving fish

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Yen S., 56, fishes with her husband Mr. Ngem Bon, 47, together earning around $5.00 per day. They have one daughter, who is married. To increase their family's income during fishing season, Mrs. Yen seeks a $600 loan to purchase more fishing tools including mats and bamboo, and traps. He hopes that she will be able to catch more fish, and better support her family. Yen's daughter is pictured because Yen and her husband were unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools including mat, bamboo, and traps

loans.name: Godfred

texts.en: Godfred A. is a 33 year old businessman and the father of two kids who are currently in school. He owns a stationery shop and sells items like printed books, writing pads, pens, flip papers, etc. He has been in business for the past four years. Godfred says the sale of stationery stock moves very fast because many school kids buy from his shop. He needs the loan to enable him re-stock his shop for improved sales. He believes the loan will allow him to purchase more in order to grow his business. He belongs to the community group called Adomako Trust Group. In this group, Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Godfred would like to increase his stock of stationery for his stationery store.

loans.name: Ifeaka

texts.en:
Ifeaka E. is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. Ifeaka sells eggs in crates and Indomie noodles in cartons. Most families in her neighborhood eat eggs and noodles for breakfast. She has been in this business for a long time.

Ifeaka is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more Indomie noodles wholesale, so that she can cut the cost of buying from distributors and thus increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy Indomie noodles wholesale to increase her profit margin.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence S. B. is 34 years old and he is married with two kids who are currently in school. Lawrence is a dealer in mobile phones and accessories. He also provides repairs and service for his customers. He says the sale of mobile phones has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and gives them to his customers at retail prices.He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of mobile phones and accessories. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts. He belongs to the community group called Alive Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Lawrence would like to increase his stock of mobile phones and accessories to sell and repair.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing A. is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives in Iyano-era, Lagos State, Nigeria. Blessing has been selling palm oil in gallons for the past five years. Twice a month, she travels four to five hours by bus to the eastern part of Nigeria (Imo State) to buy gallons of palm oil to resell.

Blessing is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more gallons of palm oil at one time, so that she can cut her traveling costs from twice a month to once a month.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Anthonia A. is a 54 year old woman and married with six children who are currently in school. She is an agro chemical seller and sells various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Many local farmers patronize her products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farm lands. With the loan, Anthonia wants to purchase more supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to serve the needs of her customers. She hopes to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education. She would be very appreciative for that assistance.

loans.use: Anthonia would like to increase her supply of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to sell to local farmers.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin D. lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 36 years old and married with three children. Toyin sells catering materials, including baking butter, decorations, and flour. She also engages in catering services at both inside and outside functions. She has been employed in this business for a long time.

Toyin is requesting a loan of $1025 UDS to buy additional catering materials to grow her business and maximize her profits.

loans.use: To buy additional catering materials to grow her business and maximize her profits.

loans.name: Mafunda

texts.en:
Mafunda is 49 years old. She is married with 8 children between the ages of 32 and 7 years old. She has been a charcoal and bites seller since 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mafunda is now requesting a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata S. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut ce prêt pour améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille, en renforçant son activité d’embouche  caprine. Elle achète des chèvres qu’elle élève dans le but de les revendre plus tard surtout à l’approche des fêtes. <b>Elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Fatoumata S., 33, is married and the mother of 4 children. She wants this loan to improve the living conditions, health, and education of her family by bolstering her business fattening goats. She buys goats which she raises with the intention of selling them later on, when the feast days are approaching. She is intending to reimburse this loan at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her goat-raising business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is 34 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ijanikin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 2003, Comfort has been catering indoor and outdoor events, including cooking for social ceremonies. She also bakes snacks and supplies them to schools and small-scale entrepreneurs to sell.

Comfort is requesting a loan of $1025 USD to buy additional catering supplies such as butter, flour, and sugar.

loans.use: To buy additional catering supplies such as butter, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta C. est âgée de 22 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des graines d’arachide et à les transformer en pate afin de la revendre. Elle va aussi acheter et revendre du nététou (graine d’un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local). Son commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins familiaux. <b>Elle remboursera ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Fanta C., 22, is married and the mother of 3 children. She would like to use this loan to bolster her business which consists in buying peanuts and transforming them into peanut butter to sell. She is also going to buy and re-sell nététou (the seeds of a tree which are transformed into a local food product). Her business allows her to contribute to family expenses. She will reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of nététou, the seeds of a tree transformed into a food product

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en: Pricilla E. sells provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks in a small store. Pricilla lives in Ijanikin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 26 years old and married with three children. She hopes for a loan of $850 USD to buy more supplies to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs, provisions, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat G. is 44 years old and married with four children. She is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. Saidat lives in Ijanikin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Saidat has been selling kerosene in her shop for a long time. The demand for her kerosene is high, and she wants to meet the demands of her customers.

Saidat is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more kerosene to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Diénabou

texts.fr: Diénabou K. est mariée mère de 05 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle veut renforcer le capital de son activité qui consiste à acheter de la graine d’arachide, à la transformer en pate afin de la revendre.  Elle veut aussi en même temps acheter et revendre du nététou (graine d’un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local), commerce très rentable. <b>Elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Diénabou K. is married and the mother of 5 children. She is asking for this loan to improve the living conditions, health, and education of her children. She wants to bolster the working capital of her business which consists in buying peanuts and transforming them into peanut butter which she then sells. At the same time, she wants to sell nététou (the seeds of a tree which are transformed into a local food product), a very lucrative business. She intends to reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of peanuts and transformation into peanut butter for re-sale

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en:
Jennet O. lives in Agbara, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with three children. For a long time, Jennet has been working as a hair stylist. She also sells drinks and sachet water.

Jennet is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. She is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy more hair extensions and weaves to sell to her clients. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and weaves to sell

loans.name: Amina's Food And Khanga Seller Group

texts.en:
Amina is 48 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 27 and 18 years old. She runs her own food shop and she is a khanga seller. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Amina is now looking for a loan to buy more food items and khanga for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Fatma.

loans.use: To buy more food items and khanga for business.

loans.name: Abike

texts.en: Abike O. lives in Ijanikin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 65 years old and married with four children. Abike has been selling kerosene since 1988. Abike is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client, and she is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more kerosene to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 41 years old and married with four children. Agnes sells cooked food in the Akuberu market. Every day Agnes wakes up as early as 4:00 am to start preparing the food she will sell each day.

Agnes is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more food to cook and sell to her customers. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders who make this loan possible

loans.use: To buy more food items to cook and sell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi T. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il est un éléveur de bovins depuis des années à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce premier crédit augmenter la capacité de son bétail en achetant des bovins. Les gains issus de l’activité permettront à monsieur T. de rembourser le crédit et cet acquis contribuera beaucoup à la qualité de sa vie et de son activité.
texts.en:
Kossi T. is 39 years old, married and the father of three children, all of whom are at school. For years he has raised cattle in Adéta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He wants to use this first-time loan to increase his livestock by buying cattle. The earnings from the business will allow Mr. T. to repay the loan, and the experience will contribute greatly towards his quality of life and his business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase his livestock

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 50 years old. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 20 and 3 years old. She is a bites seller. Every day, she works at her business so that she can earn.

Amina now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith I. lives in Iyano-era, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old and married with four children. Edith sells clothing and undergarments in her shop. She is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more clothing and jewelry to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Heun

texts.en: Mrs. Heun S., 30, is a seller who lives in Kchas Commune, Siem Reap Province. She has been selling groceries since 2006, earning around US$2.00 per day, while her husband, Mr. Yem Va, 31, sells chickens in the market. Heun would now like to expand her business and has requested a loan of US $800 to allow her to purchase more vegetables for resale. The loan will allow her to increase her family's income and support their family adequately.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for resale

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is married with one child aged 1 year old. She has been a shop seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Salma now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana E. lives in Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 41 years old and married with six children. Juliana started farming in 2003. She owns a farm where she cultivates pumpkin leaves and bitter leaves. Pumpkin leaves are used in the preparation of Nigerian soups, while bitter leaves are useful herbs.

Juliana is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy pumpkin seeds for planting, as the demand for pumpkin leaves is high. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more pumpkin seeds to plant for cultivation of pumpkin leaves.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther T. lives in Isshashi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 37 years old and married with two children. Esther owns a farm where she cultivates pumpkin seeds and bitter leaves. Pumpkin seeds are used in the preparation of Nigerian soups, while bitter leaves are useful herbs.

Esther is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client, and she is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy more pumpkin seeds for planting on her farm She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more pumpkin seeds for planting and culttivation.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory C. sells weavons and hair extensions. She has been in this business since 2006. Glory lives in Badagry, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 23 years old and married with a child. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $425 to buy more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria I. is a fashion designer who sews in her house. She makes lovely Nigerian designs. She has been sewing for a long time now, and her customers are happy with her designs. Victoria is 39 years old and married with two children. She lives in Mebamu, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $600 to buy more tailoring materials. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret T. is 35 years old and married. She lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. Margaret has a video club, where she rents VCDs and DVDs. She has been in this business since the year 2000. She needs the loan amount of $425 to add the sale of eggs to her business, because selling eggs, she says, will help her business. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy eggs to sell in her VCD and DVD shop

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma was born in 1985.  While her husband is employed in Italy as a seasonal worker, Selma produces healthy food at home. She makes and sells homemade jam and different kinds of salads and she can earn about 120 KM monthly. 

She has asked for a loan of 600 KM in order to buy compost and prepare the land for sowing wheat.  Her hope is to earn enough money from wheat sales to buy a greenhouse for her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy compost.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla A. est âgé de26ans et célibataire.  Il chôme depuis un certain temps et arrive à joindre difficilement les deux bouts. Pour gagner de l’argent, il prévoit entreprendre la conduite de taxi moto à Adéta, un village situé à 150 km de Lomé la capitale du Togo. Avec ce 1er  crédit de FECECAV, Monsieur A. espère acheter sa propre moto pour commencer son entreprise.  Avec cette chance de Kiva, il peut commencer à gagner quotidiennement  sa vie.
texts.en:
Komla A. is 26 years old and single. He has been unemployed for some time and has difficulty making ends meet. To earn money, he plans to operate a motorcycle taxi in Adéta, a village located 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this first-time loan from FECECAV, Mr. A. hopes to buy his own motorcycle so he can start his business. With this opportunity from Kiva, he can begin to earn a daily living.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Simiatu

texts.en: Simiatu A. lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells fruit, such as mangoes, oranges, and watermelon. She started selling fruit in 2006. Simiatu is 35 years old and married with five children. She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy rice and groundnut oil. She wants to add these items to her fruit business, because she says that this will increase her profits. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy rice and groundnut oil to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. sells secondhand clothes in Iyano community, where she lives. She started selling secondhand clothes in 2006. Mercy is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a LAPO client. Mercy needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. The demand for her secondhand clothes is high.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Muibatu

texts.en: Muibatu S. sells clothes in her shop, which she opens at 8:00 am and closes by 6:00 pm. She has been selling clothes for the past three years. Muibatu is 45 years old and married with six children. She is a LAPO client. Muibatu needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more clothes so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda O. sells sachets of water, drinks, and provisions such as milk, sugar, eggs, and tomato paste. She has been in this business since the year 2002. Linda is 31 years old and married with three children. She is a LAPO client. Linda lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. Linda says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Elisabeth
