Ana tiene 20 años de experiencia en la venta de comestibles, siempre se ha dedicado a su pequeña tienda, la cual puede administrar sin problema porque se encuentra en su propia casa, su trabajo empieza a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche, tiempo en el cual se interesa mucho por atender a su clientela, la que se ha ido incrementando a lo largo de todos estos años.A ella le encanta su trabajo, ya que gracias a él, pudo brindarle a sus hijas educación superior, la cual, ellas han aprovechado con mucho ahínco.Lo difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer durante casi todo en día en su tiendita, sin salir ni un momento a pasear, distraerse o visitar a sus hijas, que se encuentran en la ciudad, ya que el trabajo es durante toda la semana. Ana quiere ver a sus hijas formando sus propias familias y con un futuro mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo implementará su tienda con los productos que la gente está demandando, así poder mantener la fidelidad de su clientela y atraer a nuevos clientes, para que en un futuro pueda poner una sucursal.

loans.use: To supply her store with a large amount of her products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla A. est âgé de 43 ans, marié et père vde 3 enfants. Il tient depuis plus de 6 ans, à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise, un commerce. Il espère par ce crédit, approvisionner sa boutique afin de satisfaire aux exigences de la clientèle et aussi gagner plus pour la survie de sa famille
texts.en:
Komla A. is 43 years old, married, and the father of three. He has been in commerce for over six years in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He hopes to use this loan to supply his shop in order to satisfy customer demands and also to earn more for the survival of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk, sugar, and cooking oils

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. has been selling maize, groundnuts, beans and other food items on the Cape Coast since 2008. Veronica has received no schooling, is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. Veronica is responsible for supporting her husband in providing for their children's education. She will use her loan to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband acquire a piece of land on which they can build a family house.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials to produce fried vegetables and meat.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her small salon.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a wide variety of goods to restock her small grocery store

loans.name: Hamidu

texts.en: This group is called Mabai Zone. Its members includes: Hamidu S., Mamusu Thullah and Mohammed Kamara. They have twice received loans from Kiva through SMT. They however need a 3rd loan to further enhance their businesses. This group is thus seeking a new loan of Le 2,400,000. Hamidu S., who is the leader of this group is now 45. He is married with 10 children. Hamidu is a blacksmith and has 27 years of experience in this job.

loans.use: Buy working tools

loans.name: F & G Enterprises Group

texts.en:
This group is called F and G Entreprise. Its members include Foday Sankoh, Sorie M., Mohamed Kamara, and Alhaji Kabia. They are businessmen in Magburaka town. This will be their 3rd loan from Kiva through SMT. They have repaid previous loans successfully and are now requesting a new loan of Le 3,400,000.00. This will help their businesses grow to a new height.

Foday Sankoh is the leader of the group. Foday is now 35 years of age. He is newly married with no children. Foday runs a cinema at the centre of town. He has been in this business for over 10 years now. With a new loan, Foday will be able to buy more CDs and pays his subscription fees to televisions channels.

loans.use: Buy CDS, televisions and pay subscription fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a large quantity of ingredients to keep producing food.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo R. T., 33, is married and has a three-year-old son; his wife is currently working in Spain. Residing in the El Abasto area of Bolivia's tropical Santa Cruz de la Sierra region, Oswaldo owns a store where he sells computer parts and accessories. He also assembles and repairs computers and installs computer programs for his customers. In operation for three years now, his business does well, thanks in part to its convenient location in the Comercial Chiriguano.  Although facing much competition, Oswaldo has a good customer base purchasing his merchandise and requesting his services regularly. 

The enterprising entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy more computer accessories for his store. This will be his third loan with AgroCapital; his previous loans have shown him to be responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Crecimiento De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Paulina es casada, tiene 7 hijos con edades D. 10 a 27 años, ellos están en L. escueL. y los mayores en L. universidad, se dedica a L. venta D. comidas y tiene una tienda D. abarrotes. Su negocio empezó cuando elL. vivía en Ambato, donD. los gastos los costeaba su esposo que era el único que trabajaba como Promotor D. Salud, el dinero no les alcanzaba, entonces Paulina empezó a llevar dulces al Colegio, con mucho esfuerzo empezó a incrementar sus ventas y a preparar almuerzo para los profesores, así inicio su negocio. Paulina solicita un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles, para comprar mas mercadería entre carne y verduras y así surtir su tienda y cafetín. Paulina sale adelante, uno D. sus hijos tiene retardo mental, el cual necesita cuidados especiales. ElL. esta segura que podrá salir adelante.

Leoncia, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, tiene un negocio D. tejido a palitos, hace medias, guantes, gorros. Leoncia nos cuenta que su esposo era machista no le gustaba que elL. trabaje, elL. tenia que hacer sus tejidos a escondidas y luego los vendía y a veces hacia trueque con azúcar o verduras. Ahora elL. maneja sus ingresos con L. ayuda D. los prestamos compra lanas en cono y moldes y continua tejiendo. Leoncia solicita un préstamo D. 200 soles, que le ayudaran en su negocio. ElL. sueña con tener su propia empresa textil.

Emilia es casada y tiene 6 hijos, tiene su negocio D. venta D. hoja D. coca y hace tejidos que venD. por semanas. Emilia solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles con los que desea surtir su negocio. ElL. espera ahorrar para poder construir su casa y poner una tienda D. abarrotes que le ayudara a pagar los estudios D. sus hijos y tenerlos profesionales.
texts.en:
Paulina is married and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 27. All of them are in school, the older ones in university. Paulina's job is selling food and she has a grocery store. Her business began when she lived in Ambato, where her husband used to pay for everything as he was the one with work. He used to be a health advocate, but he didn't earn enough, so Paulina began taking candy to the local high school. By working hard she began to increase sales and to prepare lunches for the teachers--in this way her business got going.

Paulina is asking for a loan of 1000 soles to buy more merchandise such as meat and vegetables to stock her store and small cafe. She is making progress, but one of her children is developmentally challenged and needs special care. She is sure that she will succeed.

Leoncia is married and has five children. She has a knitting business making socks, gloves, and woollen hats. Leoncia says that her husband used to be a male chauvenist and didn't like his wife working. She had to do her knitting, hiD. the items, and then sell them. Sometimes she exchanged them for sugar or vegetables. Now she manages her income with the help of loans. She buys wool and patterns and continues her knitting. She is asking for a loan of 200 soles which will help her with the business. Her dream is to open her own textile company.

Emilia is married and has six children. She has her own business selling coca leaves and she also does weaving which she sells during the week. She is asking for a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to stock her business. She hopes to save enough to build her own house, open a grocery store which will help to pay for the education of her children, and have her children in professional jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The bank Crecimiento de Jes´su is asking for a loan of 5,500 soles to support its members and allow them to buy stock for their businesses.

loans.name: Angelica Consuelo

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Angélica es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Angélica y su esposo son D. profesión técnicos dentales y tienen un laboratorio dental donD. elaboran prótesis dentales para lo cual trabajan con consultorios dentales a quienes brindan estos servicios, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en un local alquilado, los materiales son adquiridos en la ciudad D. Lima a donD. viajan mensualmente. Angélica tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio D. alquiler D. maquinarias pesadas.

Angélica necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. acrílico, cromo y revestimiento. Angélica sueña con que su negocio crezca, implementar con toda la maquinaria necesaria su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the Comunal Glorioso Bank.

She is 53 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband are dental technicians and have a dental laboratory where they make dental prostheses. Because of this, they work as dental consultants to the dentists who use their services. Their business in located in the centre of Ayacucho in rented premises, and they obtain the material for their work from Lima where they travel every month. Angélica is planning to start a new business renting out heavy machinery.

Angélica needs a loan of 1050 soles which will be used to buy acrylic, chrome, and cladding material. Her dream is that her business will expand so that she outfit it with all the machinery necessary for her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Angélica needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase acrylic, chrome, and cladding material.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Teodosia es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Teodosia es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Teodosia vive en la asociación 11 de abril en el distrito de San Juan Bautista, Teodosia vende leña en su casa, la leña le distribuyen los productores, pero tiene proyectado hacer leña directamente. Además por las noches y mañanas vende emoliente (bebida caliente con propiedades curativas, preparado a base de hierbas curativas), todos los días se ubica en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad.

Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones que realizaran la leña y para el pago del carro que alquilara. Teodosia sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y ,mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Teodosia is affiliated with the Banco Comunal Glorioso. Teodosia is married. She is 35 years old and has 4 children. Teodosia lives in the association “11 of April” in the District of San Juan Bautista. Teodosia sells firewood from her home. She gets the firewood from a distributor, but she has plans to get the wood directly. Also, in the night and mornings she sells emoliente (a hot drink with curative properties, prepared from a base of curative herbs) every day. She is located in a busy street very close to the city. Teodosia needs a loan of 1050 soles, money that she would invest in the payment of the laborers that bring the firewood and for the payment for a car that she rents. Teodosia dreams that her children will finish their studies and to be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the workers who bring firewood and to rent a car

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosaura Adelaida

texts.es:
Rosaura is a member of “Banco Comunal Sarita. She lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Rosaura is an obstetrician. She rents 3 practices in strategic places in the town of Ayacucho, all located on crowded main streets and there are 3 people assisting her at the offices. At one of the practices there is a pharmacy where they also sell gift items, jewellery, and make photocopies. Rosaura supervises the practices on a daily basis.

Rosaura needs a loan of 1400 soles to be invested in buying glass cabinets for her offices. It is her dream to own a clinic and finish building her house with all possible comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Rosaura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita. Rosaura es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Rosaura es de profesión Obstetriz, Tiene 3 consultorios obstétricos en lugares estratégicos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, están ubicados en avenidas principales y concurridas, para lo cual cuenta con 3 personas que le ayudan en la atención de los consultorios, todos los locales son alquilados, en uno de los consultorios también tiene una farmacia y vende artículos de regalo, joyas, servicio de fotocopiado, Rosaura visita diariamente todos los consultorios para supervisar.

Rosaura necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas para implementar sus consultorios. Los sueños de Rosaura son tener una clínica y terminar de construir toda su casa con todas las comodidades.

loans.use: Purchase of glass cabinets to be installed at medical offices.

loans.name: Hortensia Y Edith Group

texts.es:
Hortensia and Edith are members of “Banco Comunal Cusi Urpi”. “Cusi urpi” means “happy dove” in Quechua. Hortensia is married, 45 years old and has 5 children. She sells cosmetics from catalogues to friends and relatives as well as small devices such as blenders, irons and pots requested by her clients. Her sales are on credit.

Edith is a single mother, 33 years old and has 1 son. She sells “Unión” products which are industrialized bread and cakes, her sales are on credit and she sells to employees at institutions that pay at the end of the month.

Hortensia and Edith need 800 soles each to be invested in buying pots, blenders and a variety of bread. It is their dream to expand their businesses, that their children have their needs covered and a solid education, and to set up a stable shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hortensia y Edith son socias del Banco Comunal Cusi Urpi que significa Palomita Feliz en Quechua. Hortensia es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Hortensia vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Hortensia vende artefactos pequeños como licuadoras, planchas, ollas, que le piden sus clientes, sus ventas son al crédito.

< Mientras que Edith es madre soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Edith vende productos Unión, que son panes industriales, también pasteles, sus ventas son al crédito y ofrece a trabajadores de instituciones que pagan cada fin de mes.

Hortensia y Edith necesitan un préstamo de 800 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, licuadora, panes variados. Los sueños de Hortensia y Edith son ampliar sus negocios, a sus hijos no les falte nada, tengan una buena educación y tener una tienda estable

loans.use: Purchase of pots, blenders, and a variety of bread to improve business and increase income.

loans.name: Iris Reyda

texts.es:
Iris is a member of “Banco Comunal Kusikuy”. “Kusikuy” means “be happy” in Quechua. She is married, 43 years old and has 2 children, she processes cereals which she buys from wholesalers and people that bring cereals to her; the processing takes place at her brother’s mill where she pays the minimum production cost, Iris manufactures flour and cracked cereals which are sold to state institutions. She carries out this activity with the help of hired personnel in accordance to orders.

Iris needs a loan of 1800 soles ($625) to be invested in paying the personnel. It is Iris’ dream to expand her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Iris es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua. Iris es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Iris se dedica a procesar cereales, los cereales los adquiere de los mayoristas y también de personas que le llevan, el proceso lo realiza en el molino de su hermano en donde paga los mínimos costos de producción, produce harinas, cereales partidos que provee a instituciones estatales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personales, que contrata de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga.

Iris necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago del personal que trabaja. Lo sueños de Iris son ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Pay hired personnel in order to increase production of flour and cracked cereals.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila is a member of “Banco Comunal Kusikuy”. “Kusikuy” means “be happy” in Quechua. She is married, 39 years old and has 2 children. Luzmila buys cereals from wholesalers and people who bring cereals to her house, then she grinds them at her brother’s mills; she pays a minimum to use the machines, and she sells to state institutions. She also owns two vehicles which she rents out daily as taxis in the town of Ayacucho.

Luzmila needs a loan of 1050 soles to be invested in the purchase of different cereals. It is her dream to make more progress with her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua. Luzmila es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Luzmila compra cereales de los mayoristas y también de personas que le traen a su casa, para luego procesarlos en los molinos de su hermano, a quien da un pago mínimo por el uso de sus maquinarias, sus ventas lo realiza a las instituciones estatales. Además Luzmila tiene dos carros que alquila diariamente para que realicen servicios de taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales variados. Los sueños de Luzmila son progresar más con su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals to increase sales.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a member of “Banco Comunal Kusikuy”. “Kusikuy” means “be happy” in Quechua. Norma is married, she is 32 years old and has 2 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Cuchipampa located at the foot of the Picota hill. Norma travels to the regional markets to buy animals and cereals; the animals are slaughtered and sold from door to door while the cereals are sold to merchants at the markets of the town of Ayacucho.

Norma needs a loan of 1050 soles ($375) to be invested in the purchase of goats and cereals. It is Norma’s dream to improve her house using better building materials and that her children get more ahead in life than she did.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua. Norma es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, vive en el barrio de Cuchipampa que se encuentra en las faldas del cerro la Picota. Norma viaja a las ferias de la región donde compra animales y cereales; los animales los beneficia para luego vender de casa en casa, mientras que los cereales los vende a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Norma necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado caprino y cereales. Los sueños de Norma son mejorar su casa, construir a material noble, y que sus hijos sean mejores que ella.

loans.use: Purchase of goats and cereals to increase sales.

loans.name: Iris Karin

texts.es:
Iris, de 27 años, es soltera, de profesión Secretaria Ejecutiva, vive con su mamá y sus dos hermanas menores que estudian.
Por la gran demanda de trabajo no desempeña su carrera profesional, sin embargo no se queda atrás, ya que vende utensilios de cocina (ollas arroceras, termos, jarras, platos y otros) negocio en el que le va muy bien y le es muy rentable. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años, solo trabaja por horas, ya que cuenta con una clientela seleccionada, a los mismos que les deja los artefactos al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que socializa e intercambia ideas son sus clientes. Lo difícil es no tener un lugar adecuado donde exhibir sus productos. 
Ella trabaja para apoyar con los gastos familiares, como también para mantener activo su negocio.
Quiere invertir en la compra de un mostrador y colocar sus productos de una manera adecuada para que estén más seguros.
texts.en:
Iris is 27 years old. She is single and works as an executive secretary. She lives with her mother and her two younger sisters, who are still studying. Because of the heavy demand of work she cannot pursue her professional career. Nevertheless, she refuses not to succeed, and so she sells kitchen utensils (rice pots, thermoses, jars, plates, and other things), a business that has gone very well and is very profitable. She has been doing this activity for the past two years, working alone for hours, and now she has a selective clientele, whom she gives articles on credit or for cash. What she enjoys about her work is socialising and exchanging ideas with her clients. The hard part is that she doesn’t have an adequate place where she can exhibit her products. She works to help with the family expenses, and also in order to maintain her business activity. She wants to invest in the purchase of a counter and to place her products in an adequate manner in order that they may be more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a counter to protect and exhibit the items and utensils that Iris sells.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela de 32 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, vive con su madre, a quien acogió en su casa y quien también la apoya mucho. 
Ella estudió cosmetología, dentro de su vivienda puso su salón de belleza, donde brinda servicios de corte de cabello, manicura, pedicura, entre otras cosas. Viene realizando este trabajo desde hace 4 años, durante casi todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que las personas que acuden a ella se vayan satisfechas con trabajo que les hizo y le gusta conversar mucho con sus clientes. Lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado.   
Ella quiere mandar a construir en una parte de su terreno un local, para su salón de belleza y desde luego, dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela is 32 and the single mother of two. She lives with her mother, who took Estela in and helps Estela a lot. Estela studied cosmetology as her home became her beauty salon, where she provides haircutting, manicures, pedicures and other services. She has been doing this work all day for four years. What she likes about the work is that the people who come to her leave her shop feeling satisfied with her work, and she really likes talking with her clients. The problem so far is that she does not have adequate premises. Estela wants to have a building constructed on part of her property for her salon so that she can give her clients a better welcome.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a better location for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela tiene 53 años, tiene 2 hijos que cursan estudios universitarios,  es madre soltera, pero no hay dificultad para salir adelante, nos menciona.
¿Qué hace?	Ella se dedica a vender sábanas, ropa para niños y adultos, lleva en este trabajo 3 años y le va muy bien, lleva a vender sus prendas por los distintos lugares de Pucallpa, dejándolos al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que intercambia ideas y socializa más, lo más importante es que mediante él, está pagando los estudios de sus hijos, que pronto serán profesionales. 
Ella quiere alquilar un local para la venta de sus productos, así dejar de caminar y tener una labor más tranquila.
texts.en:
Rafaela is 53 and has two sons in university, and although she is a single mother, she is having no trouble progressing in life. She has been selling sheets and adult and children’s clothing for three years, and it is going well. She sells her goods in various places in Pucallpa for cash or on credit. The thing Rafaela likes about her work is discussing ideas and socializing with others, but the most important aspect is the fact that she can pay for her son’s education. They will soon be professionals. She wants to rent premises to sell her products so that she does not have to move around. Then her work will be more peaceful.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renting premises to sell her products

loans.name: Cemira

texts.es:
Cemira tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, los mismos que son independientes y de familia, en la actualidad solo vive su esposo Angel, quien es agricultor y la apoya en lo posible.
Se dedica a la venta de fruta y abarrotes, dentro de su vivienda, actividad que la viene realizando desde hace tres años, durante casi todo el día. Ella se siente muy bien con su negocio, ya que el mismo la hace sentir útil ante la sociedad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y socializarse con las distintas personas que recurren a ella para comprar algún producto. Lo difícil es no contar con un ambiente adecuado para su negocio.
Cemira trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y mantener activo su negocio.
Quiere mandar a ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su tienda e implementarse de más productos.
texts.en:
Cemira is 54 years old, the mother of 2 independent children, and a family. She now lives alone with her husband Angel, who is a farmer and supports her however possible. She sells fruit and groceries inside her home, an activity that she has been performing daily for three years. She feels good about her business, since it makes it feel useful to society. What she most enjoys about her job is selling and socializing with the different people who rely on her to purchase products. The hard part is not having a proper environment for her business. Cemira works to meet her daily expenses and maintain an active business. She wants to expand her shop and her environment and to help through offering more products.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply and improve the environment of her store

loans.name: Leocrecia

texts.es:
Leocrecia is a member of the microfinance institution called “Kusikuy,” which means “cheer up” in Quechua.

Leocrecia is a 55-year-old married mother of 9 children. She lives in the Quinuapata neighborhood of the city of Ayacucho. From her home, she operates a small general in which she sells groceries, vegetables, meats, ice cream. She is open every day of the week from 5am to 9pm, getting help from her children.

Leocrecia needs a loan of 2,550 Peruvian soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, chicken, and ice cream. Leocrecia dreams of building a beautiful home, buying a car, and offering her children a better life than the one that she has had.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Leocrecia es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.

Leocrecia es casada, tiene 55 años y 9 hijos, Leocrecia vive en el barrio Quinuapata D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Leocrecia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carnes, helados, actividad que realiza todos los días D. la semana desD. las 5 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos.

Leocrecia necesita un préstamo D. 2550 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, pollo y helados. Los sueños D. Leocrecia son construir su casa y tener una casa bonita, comprar un carro y que sus hijos sean mejores que ella.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, chicken, and ice cream

loans.name: Blanca Nory

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.

Blanca es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Blanca viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales y luego D. acopiar venD. al por mayor a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, en la época D. cosecha D. papa se dedica a realizar papa seca (sancochan la papa luego D. pelarlo lo hacen secar al sol, este producto se utiliza para preparar platos típicos D. la costa), la papa le adquiere D. los productores que le llevan a su casa, este producto lo envía a mercados D. la costa.

Blanca necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa por sacos. Blanca sueña con sacar profesionales a sus dos menores hijos, tener una tienda estable que no le genere mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Kusikuy Communal Bank (happiness in Quechua) Blanca is 56 years old, married, and has 6 children; she travels to different markets in the region where she buys grains. After her purchase she sells to wholesalers at different markets in the city of Ayacucho; during the potato harvest she makes “dried potatoes” (boiled and peeled potatoes that are then let to dry in the sun; these are then used to prepare food typical of the coastal areas); she acquires the potatoes from producers who bring them to her but also send their products to the coastal area. Blanca needs a loan of 1200 soles that she will invest in the purchase of potatoes by the sack. She dreams that her two young sons will become professionals and will have a stable store that generates income without much effort.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blanca needs a loan of 1200 soles that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes by the sack.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Luren.

Magdalena es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Magdalena junto a su esposo viajan a las ferias D. Ccejelambras y Matara que se ubica a 2 y 3 horas respectivamente D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, en donD. compra animales y luego lo traen caminando a la ciudad D. Ayacucho para venderlo en la feria D. animales D. la ciudad, en algunas oportunidades lo envía directamente a la ciudad D. Lima. Además Magdalena en algunas oportunidades beneficia a los animales que venD. D. casa en casa a crédito y cobra cada semana.

Magdalena necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno. Los sueños D. Magdalena son tener una tienda granD., un restaurante, que sus hijos tengan estabilidad económica y descansar.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the Senor D. Luren Communal Bank. Magdalena is 52 years old, married and has 5 children; Magdalena and her husband travel to the Ccejelambras and Matara markets that are located 2 to 3 hours from Ayacucho where they purchase livestock. They then return with them to Ayacucho. Once there they sell them in the city animal market and in some cases they send them directly to Lima. Sometimes Magdalena also makes a profit from the sale of her animals which she sells from house to house on credit. Magdalena needs a loan of 1200 soles which she will invest in the purchase of cows. Magdalena’s dream is to have a large store and restaurant where her children will have economic stability and the ability to rest.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Magdalena needs a loan of 1200 soles which she will invest in the purchase of cows.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren.

Teodosia is a widow; she is 55 years old and has 7 children. She travels to the Ccejelambras fair on Saturdays, where she buys cereals that she sells in the city of Ayacucho to business owners and markets. The rest of the days, Teodosia sells "emoliente" (hot beverage made from herbs and flax seed), and traditional "chicha" (fermented beverage). She is a traveling salesperson and carries her containers of drinks.

Teodosia needs a loan of $475 USD which she will use to purchase blue corn, barley, and various cereials. He hopes to improve her business and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Teodosia es viuda, tiene 55 años y 7 hijos, Teodosia viaja a la feria de Ccejelambras los días sábados en donde compra cereales que luego lo vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho a los comerciantes de los mercados. Además Teodosia los demás días vende emoliente (bebida caliente elaborada con hierbas y semillas de lino) y chicha típica, actividad que realiza caminando cargando sus baldes de chicha.

Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz morado, cebada y cereales variados. Los sueños de Teodosia son mejorar su negocio, su casa y brindar buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Teodosia needs a loan of $475 USD which she will use to purchase blue corn, barley, and various cereials.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren.

Rosa lives with her partner; she is 39 years old and has 3 children. She has a kiosk located at the last urban bus stop where she sells sodas, fruits, and breads. She works from 9am until 6pm. In addition, Rosa sells food on Sundays at the kiosk and operates a small store out of her home where she sells groceries while she cares for her son.

Rosa needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase rice, sugar and sodas. Rosa hopes to buy land to build another home and to expand her business, and stock it better.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Rosa es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Rosa tiene un kiosco ubicado en el paradero final de una ruta de transporte urbano, en donde vende gaseosas, frutas, panes, actividad que realiza desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Además Rosa los días domingos vende comida en su mismo puesto y también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes y quien atiende es su hijo.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas. Rosa sueña con comprar un terreno para construir otra casa y ampliar sus negocios, surtirlos más.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase rice, sugar and sodas.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren.

Alicia lives with her partner; she is 28 years old and has 2 children. She lives in the neighborhood 27 of Octover. Her house is made of raw material, and it is there where she has a small store where she sells groceries, fruit, meats, and cereal. She operates the store with the help of her children and most especially her brother who lives with her. Alicia also works as a literacy tutor in her neighborhood in the afternoons.

Alicia needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and soft drinks. Alicia hopes to build her home out of decent materials, would like her business to grow and wishes her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Alicia es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Alicia vive en la asociación 27 de octubre, su casa es de material rustico en donde tiene una pequeña tienda en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, carnes, cereales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos y principalmente de su hermano que vive con ella. Alicia además trabaja como alfabetizadora de adultos en su barrio actividad que realiza por las tardes.

Alicia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas. Alicia sueña con construir su casa de material noble, su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Alicia needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren.

Yolanda lives with her partner; she is 31 years old and has 3 children. Her major in school was cosmetology and she now has her own beauty salon, located in a rented space in her neighborhood. She works from 9am to 10pm, depending on the number of clients she has. In addition to catalog cosmetics, she also sells small gifts and jewelry which she showcases at her salon.

Yolanda needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase stuffed animals, earrings and hangers. She hopes to be able to expand her business, own her own house, and wishes her children to be young professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Yolanda estudio la carrera técnica de cosmetología y tiene su salón de belleza ubicado en una avenida de su barrio, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche dependiendo de los clientes que tuviere. Además vende cosméticos por catálogos y también artículos de regalos y joyas que exhibe en vitrinas en su salón.

Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de peluches, aretes y ganchos. Yolanda sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de peluches, aretes y ganchos.

loans.name: Alfoncia

texts.es:
Alfoncia is a member of the Comunal Bank Señor de Luren.

Alfoncia is separated from her husband; she is 67 years old and has 5 children. She lives in the traditional neighborhood of Belén. Alfoncia travels to the Paras fair located 5 hours away from the city of Ayacucho every 15 days to sell groceries. At the fair, she also purchases cheeses, cereals, animals and fish, which she then sells on foot at the Nery García market. She also sells door to door in residential areas or at stores.

Alfoncia needs a loan of $475 USD. She plans to use the money to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, and cereal. Alfoncia's dreams that her last son be a young professional, with a secure job. She also hopes to help her grandchildren so they can study and would like her business to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Alfoncia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Alfoncia es separada, tiene 67 años y 5 hijos, Alfonsia vive en el barrio tradicional de Belén, Alfoncia viaja a la feria de Paras que se ubica a 5 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde viaja cada 15 días en donde vende abarrotes y de la feria compra quesos, cereales, animales, trucha que posteriormente lo vende de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García y si también vende de casa en casa o tiendas.

Alfoncia necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo y cereales. Los sueños de Alfoncia son que su hijo ultimo sea profesional, tenga un trabajo seguro, ayudar a sus nietos para que estudien y su negocio mejore.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pasta and cereal

loans.name: Midori Rossana

texts.es:
Midori tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos.  Es una gran negociante de animales, junto a su esposo, se dedican a este rubro desde hace 20 años y esta gran experiencia les ha servido para ubicar sus mercados de venta y dónde adquirir su animales. La dinámica de su trabajo consiste en comprar animales de las localidades de Mito y Matahuasi, para luego revenderlas en las ferias ganaderas de Coto Coto y Chupaca, de lunes a viernes  se dedican a adquirir los animales y los fines de semana de  venderlos, por ello, este trabajo arduo tiene sus recompensas, lo que anima a Midori a continuar. gran motivo, es el  bienestar de su familia y el sostener la educación de sus hijos. 
Midori quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo, razón por la cual solicita el préstamo con el que podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de animales.
texts.en:
Midori is 41 years old, lives with her husband and her three children. She has been an animal trader with her husband in this area for 20 years. This great experience has served to place her markets and where she purchases her animals. The dynamics of her job consist of buying animals from the towns of Mito and Matahuasi and then reselling them at livestock fairs in Coto Coto and Chupaca. From Monday through Friday, she acquires the animals and on weekends she sells them. This hard work has its rewards, which is what encourages Midori to continue. A big reason is the welfare of her family and the support of her children's education. Midori wants to increase her working capital, which is the reason why she asks for this loan with which she may purchase a larger quantity of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital to purchase a larger quantity of animals

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Mrs. Norma B. is a hardworking, middle-aged woman who works as a sales supervisor at a shopping center. Aside from that, she is a mother and a homemaker. She and her husband work long hours daily in order to put food on the table. She is requesting this loan in order to waterproof the roof of their house because the rain has damaged their furniture little by little. For this reason, they also want to plaster the dilapidated interior walls. Let’s help and support her!

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

NORMA LETICIA B. N. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

La señora Norma es una mujer de mediana edad y muy trabajadora, ella trabaja en un centro comercial como supervisora de ventas. Aparte de esto es madre de familia y ama de casa, su marido y ella trabajan dia con dia largas horas para llevar "comida a su mesa" ; ella esta solicitando este prestamo para impermeabilizar su techo ya que a causa de tanta lluvia se llueve y sus muebles se han ido dañando poco a poco, por ello tambien quiere disponer para enjarar con yeso su casa ya que se le ha caido en la parte interior. APOYEMOSLA Y AYUDEMOSLE!!!

loans.use: Roof waterproofing and plaster interior walls

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Luren.

Rosa es casada, tiene 60 años y 10 hijos, Rosa viaja a las ferias D. la región los días viernes a Matara que se ubica a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y los sábados a Ccejelambras que se ubica a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, D. donD. compra cereales, tubérculos, que luego D. acopiarlos lo transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho para venderlos a los comerciantes D. los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada, maíz. Los sueños D. Rosa son mejorar su negocio, tener capital propio y que sus hijos sean mejores que ella.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Senor D. Luren. She is 60 years old, and married with 10 children. Rosa travels to the fairs and markets in the region - Fridays to Matara, located about 3 hours away, and Saturdays to Ccejelambras, about 2 hours away from Ayacucho. On these trips, she purchases cereals and tubers which she gathers together and transports back to Ayacucho where she sells them to the shops in the market.

Rosa needs the loan so she can purchase flour, barley, and corn. Her dream is to be able to grow her business, increase her income, and see that her children have a better quality of life.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa will purchase flour, barley and corn to stock and grow her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria tiene 49 años, vive con 4 D. sus 6 hijos, que ya son mayores e independientes. 
Durante muchos años ha cumplido su noble tarea D. ser madre y realizó para ello, valerosas tareas, hoy que ya terminó esa tarea, pero no desea parar, pues sigue dedicándose al negocio   D. la venta D. abarrotes y golosinas en el pequeño kiosco que adecuó en su casa, en este pequeño establecimiento, pero bien surtido, atienD. todo el día, por ello que siempre está atenta en ver lo que necesitan sus vecinos, para que pueda adquirir la mercadería, para ella, una dificultad, es el incremento constante D. los precios, que no le permite obtener las ganancias esperadas.
Maria trabaja porque siempre le ha motivado el ser algo en la vida y superarse constantemente. 
Solicita este préstamo para acrecentar su capital D. trabajo, comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para surtir con mas productos su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, living with 4 of her 6 children, who are now grown and independent. For many years she fulfilled her noble calling to be a mother and completed that work. Now that she is finished, she does not want to stop, so she has started a business selling groceries and sweets in a little kiosk that she built in her house. She attends this small but well-stocked establishment all day long, always attentive to notice what her neighbors need, so she can acquire the merchandise. One difficulty is the constant rise in prices, which prevents her from earning the hoped-for profits.

Maria works because she has always been motivated to be something in life and to constantly better herself. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her working capital. She will buy a large quantity of merchandise in order to supply her small shop with more products.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her small shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Isaura Dominga

texts.es:
Mrs. Isaura is 65 years old and has 2 daughters. She is a hard working woman who works selling shoes for adults as well as children for the past 4 years. She used to sell desserts that she brought from her trips to Trujillo called “Kinkones”, but with more capital she got the idea to bring shoes and sell them to her neighbors, as it worked out well, she continued and now she is working harder selling all kind of shoes for every occasion, she even sells on layaway and once she gets back her capital she travels again. Isaura raises animals that proviD. her extra income, some times she has difficulties when her neighbors are late on paying her back. Isaura is full of vitality and she enjoys working on sales. She would like to buy more shoes from Trujillo, because she has several orders, and with the loan she will be able to fulfill those sales.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Isaura tiene 65 años y vive con sus 2 hijas. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica a la venta D. zapatos, tanto para adultos como para niños, desD. hace 4 años, antes vendía unos postres que traía D. sus viajes D. la ciudad D. Trujillo que se llaman “Kinkones”, pero con más capital surgió la idea D. traer zapatos y ofrecerlos a sus vecinos, como dio buenos resultados, continuo y ahora está con más fuerzas, que la motivan a seguir adelante, venD. zapatos D. todo modelo y para toda ocasión, venD. al crédito y luego una vez recuperado su capital vuelve viajar, durante su proceso D. cobranza, Isaura cría animales, que también le dan un ingreso extra a su economía, a veces la dificultad es cuando uno D. sus vecinos se demora en pagar por completo. Isaura se siente llena D. vitalidad y su motivo D. trabajo es el gusto para las ventas. Quiere comprar una mayor cantidad D. zapatos D. Trujillo, porque tiene muchos pedidos, con este préstamo podrá hacer realidad esas ventas.

loans.use: Increase her capital to buy more shoes she can sell in her region / Incrementar su capital para comprar más zapatos que pueda vender en su zona.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She is an exercise instructor on a gym for the last 4 years, she also offers her services as instructor on several health institutions, she works everyday per hours, except weekends. Her work consists on guide the movements to burn fat, she also sells health products that offers to the clients that go to the gym. Vilma feels being gym instructor is her vocation and thanks her father that always inspired her to practice sports, she also helps people with nutrition because she graduated as a nutritionist. She has some land where she would like to build her own gym and improve the equipment she has, this is why she is soliciting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Ella es guía de ejercicios en un gimnasio, tiene este negocio desde hace 4 años junto a un socio, también ofrece sus servicios como instructora de ejercicios a diversas instituciones de salud, atiende todos los días por horas, excepto los fines de semana, su trabajo consiste en orientar los movimientos corporales para quemar grasa, adicionalmente vende productos de salud, los ofrece a sus clientes que van al gimnasio, Vilma siente que ser instructora de ejercicios es su vocación y agradece a su padre que siempre la motivó a realizar deportes, además de contribuir con la salud de las personas en temas de nutrición porque es de profesión ingeniera en industrias alimentarias, especializada en nutrición. Tiene una extensión de terreno en la que invertirá construyendo su propio local de gimnasio y también en mejorar el equipo de gimnasio que posee, para ello, es que solicita este préstamo.

loans.use: Improve the equipment at her gym and invest in construction of her own space / Mejorar el equipo para gimnasio que posee e invertir en la construcción de su propio local.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Las Frutillitas Group

texts.en:
The Las Frutillitas Group ("The Little Strawberries) is maD. up of 14 people, all of whom have been together for several loan cycles. Rosely R. organized the group in 2007 and the group decided to call themselves Las Frutillitas, because the name brought back memories of good luck at other microfinance institutions. Most of the women in the group have stable businesses, while others are public employees. Wilma, Josefa, Sussy, Julia, Patricia and N. all sell food (rice, cakes, prepared meals, salchipapas (French fries with hot dog slices), and sweets), Erick works as a driver, Encarnación sells macramé crafts, Julia and Rosely sell shawls, Denis works as a security guard, Rosmery sells knitted goods, Wendy fixes ovens, and N. Antonia sells bottles. Most of the group members plans to use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell, or to buy ingredients for cooking. Las Frutillitas have never been late on their payments, so they were approved for this, their fourth loan. All of the group members are committed to repaying their loan, so that they can keep working with AgroCapital. Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

GRUPO CONFORMADO POR 14 PERSONAS QUE SE ESTABLECIERON DESD. EL PRIMER CICLO, EL GRUPO LAS FRUTILLITAS EMPIEZA EN EL AÑO 2007 DOND. LA SRA ROSELY R. CONFORMO EL GRUPO Y TODAS LAS SOCIAS LE DIERON EL NOMBRE D. LAS FRUTILLITAS POR QUE ESTE NOMBRE LES TRAJO MUY BUENOS RECUERSOS Y SUERTE EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES

LA MAYORIA D. LAS SOCIAS TIENEN NEGOCIOS ESTABLES Y LA OTRA PARTE SON EMPLEADOS PUBLICOS POR LO QUE NUNCA EL GRUPO ENTRO EN MORA NI TUVO RETRASOS, POR LO QUE SE LES CONCEDIO EL PRESTAMO PARA ESTE CUARTO CICLO.

TODAS COMPROMETIENDOSE A LA CANCELACION D. SU DEUDA, PARA PODER SEGUIR TRABAJANDO CON LA INSTITUCION.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Nilo Jose

texts.es:
Nilo is 59 years old; he lives with his wife, 2 children and his aging father. He is a very responsible father, each day he works hard building bricks to sell them to a construction fair, his dedication to work has allowed him to obtain vital profit for his family, his work consists primary on obtain raw goods like sand, wood and clay, then he mix them, and prepares the molds that cook for 2 days on the oven, he is able to prepare about 23 thousand bricks on a week, that he transports in trucks to the construction materials fair. His work is very hard and requires lots of strength, Nilo is strong and years of experience. Nilo wants the best for his family and that is his motivation. He will invest the loan on buying those necessary items to elaborate his bricks, he also raises cuyes, and he will use the loan for that too.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Nilo tiene 59 años, vive con su esposa, sus 2 hijos y su padre anciano. Es un padre responsable, cada día se esfuerza fabricando ladrillos para poder venderlos en una feria constructora, su dedicación en la fabrica le ha permitido obtener las ganancias esenciales para su familia, su trabajo consiste primero en obtener la materia prima, que es la tierra arcillosa, arena, aserrín y palos, luego viene la fase de preparación de la maza, en la cual cada detalle cuenta, para luego ponerlos en moldes para que cosan por 2 días en el horno, a la semana puede producir hasta 23 millares de ladrillos, que luego transporta por camionadas a la feria de materiales de construcción, su labor es muy ardua y requiere de mucha fortaleza, Nilo tiene esa fuerza, amparada en su gran experiencia de muchos años. Nilo quiere dar lo mejor a su familia esa es su gran motivación. Invertirá en la compra de todos esos insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus ladrillos, también incursionara en la crianza de cuyes, para lo cual también invertirá el dinero del préstamo.

loans.use: To buy items to prepare bricks and sell cuyes / Compra de los insumos para la fabricación de ladrillos y para iniciar un negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Aida Ynes

texts.es:
Aida is 39 years old and currently lives with her husband and 2 of her children. She works in several activities during the day, which allow her to obtain income to support her family, she works raising animals since she was a kid, she also works on agriculture and has a business selling food. Mondays through Fridays in the mornings she sells food like ceviche and fried fish; in the afternoons takes care of her animals, she sells the animals during the weekends and gets new ones to feed them, she also takes care of the fields to keep them clear of pests. With her work she has been able to obtain income to support her 7 children, 5 of them are already grown and independent. She enjoys her work very much. Aida will invest on buying more animals and improve her sales cart.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Aída tiene 39 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y 2 de sus hijos. Es una mujer multifacética, que cada día trabaja en diversas actividades, que le permiten obtener el sustento diario para su familia, se dedica a la crianza de animales desde su niñez, también a la agricultura y tiene un negocio de venta de comida. De lunes a viernes por las mañanas vende platos como ceviche y pescado frito; en las tardes cuida de sus animales que envió a pastar, los fines de semana los vende y adquiere otros flacos para engordar, ocasionalmente cuida sus campos de cultivo para ver si todo va bien y no haya plagas. Así es el trabajo de Aída, a podido obtener lo necesario para solventar los gastos de sus 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 de ellos ya son hombres y mujeres independientes. Para ella, no existen dificultades que han de considerarse al contrario es una gran complacencia su trabajo. Aída invertirá en la compra de sus animales y también mejorará su carreta de ventas.

loans.use: Improve the condition of her sales cart and increase the quantity of animals she sells / Mejorar el estado de su carreta de venta de comida, además de incrementar la cantidad de animales que vende.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gaby Luz

texts.es:
Gaby is 46 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children. She works on agriculture since she was a kid, now is a mother and supports her home and keeps on working on cattle raising, she raises pigs, sheep and cuyes to sell their meat later on, she provides meat to grocery stores around her region, she feeds her animals with pasture and alfalfa that she cultivates (in the photo), so she saves on food which allows her to obtain the necessary profit, not long ago with the profit obtain from the sales of meat she was able to sow another field of alfalfa and keep on working. Gaby wants peace for her family and wants to improve her children’s life. With the loan she will buy 3 sheep to feed them and improve her farmyard.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Gaby tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas desde su niñez, ahora es madre de familia y un sostén para su hogar, sigue desempeñándose en la ganadería, cría animales como cerdos, ovejas y cuyes para luego vender su carne, es una proveedora de carne de las bodegas y tiendas de su zona, alimenta a sus animales con pasto y alfalfa que ella misma cultiva (en la foto), así ahorra en los gastos de alimentación, esto le permite obtener las ganancias necesarias, hace poco tiempo con las ganancias de la venta de carne pudo sembrar otro terreno de alfalfa, y así seguirá trabajando. Gaby desea la tranquilidad para su familia, y adquirir mejores cosas para sus hijos. Con el dinero proporcionado, Gaby comprará 3 ovejas para engordarlas, además de ello mejorará su corral de crianza.

loans.use: To buy sheep to feed them and then sell their meat, and improve his farmyard / Comprar tres ovejas para engordarlas y luego vender su carne, además de mejorar el corral donde cría sus animales.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rosaura Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosaura is 30-years-old and lives with her husband and one-year-old son.

This woman has always been in search of opportunities to generate her own sources of income. This is how she found the way to do it, which is selling all types of sweets outside of an elementary school. Years ago, she and her sister attended to a cafe, where she learned all about the movement of the business. Now she works outside of the school every day, except on weekends, when she is dedicated to raising and selling pigs. She has noticed that this brings her good profits. This is why she continues dedicating herself to this business.

Her constant motive is to improve the quality of life for her family.

Rosaura will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise: sweets for her business and acquiring more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rosaura tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de un año.

Esta mujer, siempre ha estado en búsqueda de oportunidades para generarse sus propias fuentes de ingreso, tal es así, que encontró la forma de hacerlo, la cual es vendiendo todo tipo de golosinas en la puerta de una escuela primaria, años anteriores, junto a su hermana atendían en un cafetín, ahí aprendió todo el movimiento del negocio, que hoy Rosaura desempeña vendiendo en la puerta de la escuela, todos los días, excepto los fines de semana, donde se dedica criar y vender cerdos, ella se ha dado cuenta que esto le trae buenas ganancias, por ello continuará dedicándose a este negocio.

Su motivo constante es mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.

Rosaura invertirá este préstamo en la compra de mercadería, de golosinas para su negocio y en adquirir más cerdos.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise (sweets) and to purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Vilma Nelly

texts.es:
Vilma is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For the past four years she has worked intensely to raise small animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs, although she specializes in raising chickens. She purchases the chickens in bulk, fattens them, and then sells them later for a better price. She does the same with the hogs, waiting until they grow in order to sell them. The guinea pigs, however, are generally for personal consumption. The difficulty for Vilma comes when one of her animals gets sick and dies, which can bring a loss of income. Vilma will invest the money from her loan in improving her chicken farm.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica intensamente a la crianza de animales menores, como pollos cerdos y cuyes, pero en mayor proporción a los pollos, los compra al por mayor, los hace engordar para luego venderlos a un mayor precio, de igual manera hace con los cerdos, espera a que sus crías crezcan para venderlos, los cuyes son generalmente para su consumo personal. Lo dificultoso para ella es cuando a veces uno de sus animales se enferma y llegar a morir, lo cual le puede generar pérdidas. Vilma invertirá el dinero del préstamo en mejorar la granja de sus pollos.

loans.use: To improve and supply the farm where she raises chickens

loans.name: Edith Shony

texts.es:
Shony is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. Each day she works using her talent to prepare meals, for this reason, each day she prepares several diverse menus and supplies her clients, who are usually drivers and bus collectors of a transportation line, whose stop is very close to Shony’s sales place. She wakes up very early to prepare her meals, she offers breakfast and lunches. She has also stock her small restaurant with sodas and pates, now she has a great challenge because there are more places that offer food, competition is stronger every day. Shony has always liked to work, wishes a better future for her family and wants to open a grocery store in the future to increase her profit. She will invest the money on buying supplies at wholesale prices and stock ingredients she uses in the preparation of her menus.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Shony tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Cada día trabaja utilizando el talento que tiene para la cocina, es muy hábil para ello, por esa razón, cada día cocina variados menús y abastece a sus clientes, que por lo general son chóferes y cobradores de una línea de transportes, cuyo paradero es muy cercano al lugar de ventas de Shony, ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar sus alimentos, ofrece desayunos y almuerzos. Adicionalmente a esto Shony ha implementado su pequeño restaurante con gaseosas y pastelitos, ahora tiene un gran reto, ser más competitiva, ya que existe otros establecimientos que ofrecen comida, la competencia es cada vez más exigente. A Shony siempre le ha gustado trabajar, desea un futuro mejor para su familia, por ello, quiere a futuro abrir una bodega para incrementar sus ganancias. Invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para abastecerse de los ingredientes que ella utiliza en la preparación de sus menús.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and items to elaborate her food dishes / Compra de los ingrediente e insumos para la elaboración de sus platos de comida.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Yeny Mercedes

texts.es:
Yeny is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children. She has been making mattresses out of wool and straw over the past 8 years. Yeny and her husband share responsabilities. The furniture is made during the week and it's sold on weekends. Every weekend, she goes out to sell her mattresses in the city of Huancayo to all the furniture stores around the city. She likes to do so because it gives her a chance to see the whole process from start to finish. In order to make these mattresses, you need a few of the key materials such as straw from wheat, rice and plenty of wool which she purchases in fabric stores. She uses needles of different sizes and diameters, thread, candle wick to sew the fabric in place. The hardest part is to obtain all of these materials when they're not in season. This is precisely why Yeny buys as much material as possible and in bulk so that she can store it and be available whenever she needs it.

Yenny's motivation are her kids so that they can finish school. She's requesting this loan so that she can purchase more material. Her goal is to be a mayor distributor and for that she will need a lot of clients.

Translated by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, a Kiva Volunteer.

Yeny tiene 42 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 8 años se dedica a la fabricación de colchones a base de lana y paja, todos los días, ella y su esposo comparten roles, los fines de semana ella sale a la ciudad de Huancayo para vender sus colchones a las tiendas que venden muebles, de esa manera Yeny puede ver el fruto de la ardua labor que realizó durante la semana. Para fabricar estos colchones se abastece de los materiales necesarios, tales como la paja de trigo, arroz y retazos de lana que compra en las empresas que fabrican frazadas, también las telas que le servirán para darle la presentación a los colchones, las herramientas que utiliza son las agujas de diferentes diámetros y medidas, así como pabilo e hilo para unir las costuras que han de hacerse, la dificultad radica en obtener los materiales, sobre todo cuando no es época, por eso que Yeny tiene que abastecerse de ellos con anticipación. Yeny se esfuerza por sus hijos, para que sigan superándose a través del estudio. Solicita este préstamo que invertirá en la compra de los materiales que requiere para su producción, ella se ha puesto como meta ser una distribuidora mayorista de colchones, para lo cual se asociará con algunas personas más.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make mattresses

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina is 24-years-old and lives with her husband and two children. She is a young mother, and she strives day after day to attend to her small children and to her difficult work in the fields, which she has done since she was 5 in an independent manner. Her parents taught her everything about agriculture since her childhood. She started working after leaving secondary school to capitalize on her own economic strength. Today her responsibility as a mother is larger. Therefore her daily tasks consist of reviewing the progress in her fields where she grows alfalfa and corn. She sells the corn at the local market and sells the alfalfa to neighbors who have farms. She also tends to rent out plots of land.

Melina works hard because she wants to see her children be better every day. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in her next planting. She would like to increase her production and grow cereal.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Melina tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Es una joven madre de familia, que día a día se esfuerza por atender a sus pequeños y también a las duras tareas del campo, lo viene haciendo desde hace 5 años, de manera independiente, ya que desde su niñez sus padres le enseñaron todo lo referente a la agricultura, ella comenzó, al salir de la educación secundaria, para capitalizar su propia fuerza económica, hoy su responsabilidad como madre es grande, por ello que sus tareas diarias consisten en revisar el progreso de sus campos de cultivo donde siembra alfalfa y maíz, el maíz lo comercializa en el mercado local y la alfalfa la vende a sus vecinos que tienen granjas, también suele a arrendar los surcos de sembrío.

Melina se esfuerza porque desea ver a sus hijos cada día mejor. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá invertir en su próxima siembra, pues en esta ocasión quiere agregar a su producción, el cultivo de cereales.

loans.use: Purchase of necessary supplies to prepare her land for sowing season

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children. She's a hard worker.

She raises guinea pigs and has been doing so for over the past 5 years. Her house has become a farm but it's good because her house is big enough to accomodate all her guinea pigs. She also grows alfalfa in her land to feed her animals. She takes good care and feeds them very well so that they are ready to be sold every weekend. The hardest part about her job is the transportation part because she has to be able to transport many at once. In the past, she has had to overcome many difficulties like the time when she lost all of her guinea pigs due to illness. She's currently getting ready to start the alfalfa season.

Fanny works because she wants to and needs to help her family. She needs to take care of the well-being of her children and her husband. She's requesting this loan because she would like to buy guinea pigs in pairs so that they can multiply and to buy fertilizer to grow alfalfa

Translated by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, a Kiva Volunteer.

Fanny tiene 36 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es un persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a la crianza de cuyes en su granja desde hace 5 años, aprovecha los amplios espacios que tiene en su casa, además siembra alfalfa en sus propias tierras para la alimentación de sus animales, lleva un control minucioso del alimento que les da a sus cuyes, de esa manera están listos para su comercialización generalmente los fines de semana. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es transportar los cuyes en grande cantidades, pero eso lo va superando poco a poco, en el pasado tuvo que enfrentar una gran perdida cuando sus cuyes fueron atacados por una enfermedad, ahora se está levantando y preparando nuevamente sus campos de cultivo para la alfalfa. Fanny trabaja porque está motivada por su familia, ella quiere ver superarse a sus hijos y el bienestar de su esposo. Solicita este préstamo porque invertirá en la compra de parejas de cuyes, para repoblar su granja y también comprar fertilizantes que utilizará en sus campos de alfalfa.

loans.use: To purchase more guinea pigs and fertilizers to grow alfalfa

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros is 30 years old. She lives with her son who's 7 years old and her husband.

She raises guinea pigs and she attends to her farm daily which she runs out of her home. The reason why she decided to do this was because her brother-in-law is a zoo technician and he has supported her in how to take care of her animals. She remembers that she only started with 100 guinea pigs and she now has 300 of them. She grows alfalfa in her land to feed the guinea pigs. A private company purchases the guinea pigs from her monthly, but they prefer to buy males weighing more than 2 lbs. She has been able to find more clients such as government institutions.

Milagros is very motivated because she wants to move ahead in life and to be able to offer a good life to her son. She's requesting this loan because she wants to invest it in the farm by installing new corrals.

Translated by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, a Kiva Volunteer.

Milagros tiene 30 años, en la actualidad vive con su hijo de 7 años y su esposo. Atiende diariamente su granja de cuyes, que ha instalado en su propia casa, la razón para que pueda iniciar su negocio fue porque vio la oportunidad y posibilidad de hacerlo, su cuñado es zootecnista y desde que se empezó la apoyó en la orientación técnica de los cuidados en su granja, recuerda que con 100 cuyes y ahora cuenta con más de 300 cuyes, para alimentarlos cultiva la alfalfa en sus tierras, la razón de su rentabilidad, se debe a que una organización no gubernamental le compra periódicamente sus cuyes, cuyo estándar exigido son machos de un kilo, además, está adquiriendo más clientes, como una municipalidad u otras instituciones. Milagros está motivada porque desea seguir adelante, para superarse y darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo. Solicita este préstamo porque desea invertir en el mejoramiento de su granja, instalando nuevos corrales.

loans.use: To invest it in a guinea pig farm

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
Livia is a single, 54 year woman who lives with her parents and supports them economically. She is a natural of the city of Junin. She started her own business 18 years ago in her parent’s home. She runs a grocery store which is her main source of income. Usually she works on her business every day of the week, and she runs her business with love and dedication. Livia wants to give her parents a good life, since she is the one that is providing for them. She would like to buy more products so that she can grow her store and increase her sales and in the future make her business a more stable source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Livia tiene 54 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres a los cuales apoya económicamente. Es natural de la ciudad de Junín, hace 18 años, puso en la casa de sus padres una pequeña tienda de comestibles, que el día de hoy es su principal fuente de ingresos.Usualmente, atiende en su negocio todo el día, durante toda la semana, siendo la única actividad que realiza, ya está acostumbrada a este tipo de trabajo, el cual hace con amor y dedicación. Livia quiere brindarles a sus padres una vida digna, ya que ella aún los ayuda económicamente. Piensa comprar muchos productos, para hacer crecer su tienda y así incrementar sus ventas, en el futuro sea una fuente de más ingresos muy estable.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 34 years old. She's divorced and she lives with her children who are Kevin age 14, Sandra age 12 and Judith age 9.

She has been selling furniture for the past 14 years which she has had plenty of time to learn the business very well. She's now able to make a very good living off of this business which she dedicates all her time from early morning until early evening every day. Rosa loves to sell and to be able to convince people to buy her furniture. The only disadvantage is that she does it by herself and it's a lot of work.

She wants to be able to give her kids a good and secure future so that they can go to school and one day become professionals. They all attend school and she wants them to only dedicate to school and nothing more. With this loan, she would like to purchase more furniture and make her furniture business grow so that one day she can own a big furniture store.

Translated by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, a Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa tiene 34 años, es divorciada, vive con sus hijos; Kevin de 14, Sandra de 12 y Judith de 9. Se viene dedicando a la venta de muebles, desde hace 14 años, tiempo en el cual, ha aprendido bien el negocio, ahora le arroja muy buenos frutos y al cual le dedica casi todo el día, ya que empieza la venta desde muy temprano hasta aproximadamente las 6 de la tarde.Lo que a Rosa le gusta es vender, convencer a las personas para que adquieran sus muebles, la desventaja, es que lo hace sola y esto es más trabajoso. Ella quiere brindarles a sus pequeños hijos un futuro seguro, en el cual puedan estudiar y desenvolverse como profesionales, ahora estudian en la escuela, y ella no quieren que se dediquen a otra cosa, que no sea estudiar. Con el dinero del préstamo podrá adquirir muchos más muebles, mejorar la venta, ya que en el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y tener una gran tienda con todo tipo de muebles.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture to sale

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde is single, and lives with her two sons (15 year old Jimy and 11 year old Orlando, who are still studying). She is from the district of Ayaviri, but for the past 6 years she has been living in the city of Juliaca. She sells gold, which she acquires in the La Rinconada mine. She sells it throughout the week in Juliaca, on Sundays in Arequipa, and on Wednesdays and Thursdays in the city of Moquegua. Her work takes up most of her time, and for her it is very difficult to constantly be on the road, but her business is going well and she does what she needs in order to support her children. She sacrifices every day in order to provide a better future for her sons. Matilde would want to grow her business and in the future have an additional business such as a bookstore or a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Matilde es soltera, vive con sus hijos; Jimy de 15 y Orlando de 11, quienes aún son estudiantes de secundaria. Ella es natural del distrito de Ayaviri, pero hace 6 años vive en la cuidad de Juliaca, se dedica a la venta de oro, el cual adquiere de la mina La Rinconada. En Juliaca vende durante la semana, los días domingos en la ciudad de Arequipa, y los días miércoles y jueves en la ciudad de Moquegua.Usualmente, su trabajo le toma la mayor parte del día, para ella es muy difícil tener que estar de viaje en viaje constantemente, pero el negocio va bien y es lo que ella necesita para poder mantener a sus hijos. Se sacrifica día a día para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor porvenir. Matilde quiere incrementar su venta de oro y en adelante tener un negocio adicional, como una tienda de comestibles o una librería.

loans.use: To increase capital for her gold selling business.

loans.name: Las Magníficas De Rsr Group

texts.en:
The Las Magnificas de RSR group is comprised of twelve people, eleven women and one man. This is their fourth loan; they have paid off their three previous loans in full and on time. The group's members have all different types of businesses: Simona sells DVDs and CDs, Martha has a dry goods store, Pablo and Hernan are drivers, Giovanna and Deisi sell comforters for beds, Victoria sells clothing, Blanca sells cosmetics, Maria Isabel teaches German classes, Dionicia announces stops on a minibus, Regina sews blankets, and Fernanda sells prepared food. Most of the group members have 1-5 years of experience, although some have more than ten years.
