Most of the group members plan to use this loan to buy more merchandise for their businesses, although some plan to use the loan to do construction on their homes, which were provided by the Morales government. All of the women understand their debt to AgroCapital. If they keep working together the way that they have been, Las Magnificas will be around for many more loans. Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

GRUPO CONSTITUIDO POR DOCE PERSONAS 89 % MUJERES Y UN VARON. EL GRUPO LAS MAGNIFICAS RSR ENTRÒ A SU 4TO CICLO CUMPLIENDO CON NORMALIDAD TODAS SUS CUOTAS. EL PRESTAMO QUE HICIERON ES PARA SUS NEGOCIOS Y ALGUNAS PARA LA AYUDA A LA CONSTRUCCION DE SUS CASITAS QUE FUERON ENTREGADAS POR EL ESTADO.

TODAS SABIENDO SUS DEUDA Y LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE LLEVA ELLAS TRABAJARAN POR MUCHOS CICLOS MAS

loans.use: Home construction and purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Bertha Oralia

texts.es:
Bertha started her business because she wanted to feel like a useful person and give herself the opportunity of experiencing new challenges and obtaining an extra income that would allow her to take good care of her son. She divorced his father, and the money they had didn't cover all of their expenses. She had to opt to start a business that would allow her to obtain an extra income to give her son better living conditions and at the same time improve herself in a personal manner.

She started selling cosmetics in the month of April, 2005, thanks to the invitation of a friend that organized a demonstration of skin care products in her house. She liked the products and started to sell them among her friends and neighbors. Currently she is a consultant with more experience, but her goal is to become a director, to be in charge of various consultants, and to be able to earn incentives like trips and cars that are offered to those who reach certain goals.

She needs a loan of $775, which she will repay in 5 months, to be able to supply her clients' orders and to continue satisfying her product needs in an opportune manner. With your support, Bertha will accomplish her goal!

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Bertha inició el negocio porque quería sentirse una persona útil y darse la oportunidad de experimentar nuevos retos y obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que se divorció del padre de su hijo y la pensión que les daba no les alcanzaba para todos los gastos, por lo que tuvo que optar por iniciar un negocio que le permitiera obtener un ingreso extra para darle a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida y al mismo tiempo superarse de manera personal. Comenzó con la venta de cosméticos en el mes de Abril de 2005 gracias a la invitación de una amiga que organizó una demostración de los productos en su casa acerca del cuidado de la piel. Le gustaron los productos y empezó a venderlos entre sus vecinas y amigas, en la actualidad es consultora con mas experiencia pero su meta es llegar a ser Directora y tener a su cargo varias consultoras y poder ganar los incentivos que le ofrecen como viajes y carros a los que cumplen con determinadas metas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 5 meses para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y seguir satisfaciendo sus necesidades de productos de manera oportuna. Con tu apoyo Bertha lograra alcanzar su meta!!.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth is 22 years old. She's single and lives alone in a rental. She sells bucket-ropes and buckets to do laundry from town to town in different fairs in the city of Juliaca.

She's been doing this for the past 7 years which have given her a lot of experience and security in doing this type of job. Yaneth works from morning 'till late in the evening so that she can make enough money to pay for rent and for food. The difficult part about this job is to work alone, but sometimes her sister comes along with her when she goes to visit her. Yaneth's family lives in Ayaviri, far away from her.

Yaneth works to move ahead in life and to provide a better future for herself. With this money she will be able to purchase bucket-ropes and laundry buckets so that she can increase her earnings and hopefully one day rent a locale/stand where she can sell her products from.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Yaneth tiene 22 años, es soltera, vive sola en un cuarto alquilado. Se dedica a la venta de sogas y lavadores para ropa, de forma ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, se viene dedicando a esta labor desde hace siete años, tiempo en el cual ha ganado mucha experiencia en la venta y ahora realiza su trabajo con mayor soltura y seguridad.Yaneth trabaja durante toda la mañana y parte de la tarde para ganar lo suficiente y cubrir sus gastos de alquiler de cuarto y alimentación, lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que trabajar sola, solo se acompaña con su hermana las veces que va a visitarla, ya que toda su familia vive en Ayaviri, lejos de ella. Yaneth trabaja para salir adelante y forjarse un buen futuro. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más lavadores y sogas para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y en el futuro poner un negocio más estable, alquilando un local o stand.

loans.use: To purchase bucke-ropes and laundry buckets

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is 34-years-old and is a single mother of 4 children: Lisbeth, who is 15; Yordan, who is 13; Víctor, who is 9; and Mileydi, who is 7.

Eva has sold food for 2 years now. She is from Juliaca, and since she didn't finish high school, she has had to work since then to support herself and her children when they arrived. She didn't have support from her husband, who abandoned her. Having 4 children isn't easy, and she had to put forth a lot of effort to give the four of them a good education. But the love that they give her strengthens her, and that is enough for her to keep going.

Her 4 children are her reason for living. She wants them to get ahead and to see them become professionals.

With the money she obtains from this loan, she will be able to purchase more furniture to make her customers more comfortable. She will also buy ingredients to make a larger variety of dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Eva tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos; Lisbeth de 15, Yordan de 13, Víctor de 9 y Mileydi de 7. La venta de comida es el negocio al cual se dedica Eva desde hace ya 2 años, ella es juliaqueña de nacimiento y al no terminar la secundaria, tuvo que trabajar desde ese entonces en diferentes labores, para mantenerse y mantener a sus hijos cuando estos llegaron, sin el apoyo de su pareja quien la abandonó. Tener cuatro hijos no es nada fácil, ya que tiene que hacer mucho más esfuerzo para darles una buena educación a los cuatro, pero la fortalece, el amor que ellos le brindan, con ello es suficiente para que siga adelante en su trabajo.

Sus cuatro hijos son la razón de la vida de Eva, ella quiere sacarlos adelante y verlos hechos profesionales. Con el dinero que obtenga podrá comprar más en sillas y muebles, para una mejor comodidad de sus clientes, además de ingredientes para cocinar más variedad de platos.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture for her customers' comfort and supplies to prepare her food

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es:
Raymunda is 66-years-old, is separated from her husband, and lives alone in her small house since she doesn't have children. She is dedicated to selling clothing such as ponchos, sweaters, t-shirts, etc., to support herself. She has done this for 48 years. She has always had to work to support herself. She is a native of Juliaca, but she never had the economic means to go to school, so she never learned how to read or write. But that wasn't a problem for Raymunda, who continues working every day with much faith and happiness. She never learned anything else besides business because she likes it a lot and doesn't find it difficult to carry out.

She wants to continue working as long as she is able to secure her retirement.

With the money from this loan, she will buy more ponchos, t-shirts, and clothing in general to increase her sales. In the future, she wants to have more merchandise to increase her sales even more.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Raymunda tiene 66 años, es separada D. su pareja, y al no tener hijos vive sola en su pequeña casa. Se dedica a la venta D. ropa, venD. mantas, chompas, poleras, etc. para mantenerse, esta actividad la ha venido realizando desD. hace 48 años, siempre tuvo que trabajar para mantenerse, ella es natural D. Juliaca, pero nunca tuvo las posibilidades económicas para estudiar, por ello, no aprendió a leer ni a escribir, pero eso no fue problema para Raymunda que sigue trabajando día a día con mucha fe y alegría. Ella no conoció otra cosa mas que el mundo del comercio, así que esta actividad le gusta mucho, y no encuentra dificultad en realizarla.

Quiere seguir trabajando hasta que las fuerzas le den y asegurar su vejez.

Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar más mantas, poleras y ropa en general para mejorar su venta, en el futuro ella quiere tener más mercadería para incrementar sus ventas cada vez más.

loans.use: To supply herself with a larger quantity of the garments that she sells.

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina is 54 years old. She's a widow and lives with her daughter named Flor who is 19 years old and goes to the local university. She's originally from the city of Juliaca.

She's always worked for her family, but since her husband passed away, her responsability has doubled since now she has to provide an education for her daughter. This is why she sells honey and pastries around the town in different areas in Juliaca. She sells to her neighbors who ordered her delicious honey and pastries. The most difficult part of her job is that she has to walk all over the town since she's of age and therefore not strong enough to walk for long periods. Nonetheless, she loves her job since it gives her a purpose in life and it makes her forget the loneliness her husband has left behind. Her only reason for working is to help her daughter Flor Ofelia pay for school.

With this loan, she will be able to purchase more honey and hopefully sell more so that she can make more money to help her daughter with college expenses.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Orfelina tiene 54 años, es viuda, vive con su hija Flor Ofelia de 19 años, quien estudia en la universidad local. Es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, siempre ha trabajado en bien de su familia, pero desde que murió su esposo la carga se le ha incrementado, ahora tiene que ser ella sola, quien vele por los estudios de su hija.Es así, que se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja y queques, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulatoria por las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Juliaca y por pedidos de sus vecinas, quienes la apoyan comprando su rica miel y sus deliciosos postres.Lo difícil para Orfelina es tener que caminar por las calles ofreciendo su mercadería, ya que la edad ya no le permite contar con muchas fuerzas, a pesar de eso, le gusta su trabajo, ya que le permite sentirse útil y olvidar la pena que dejó la ausencia de su esposo. A la única razón de su esfuerzo, es velar por el bienestar de su hija Flor Ofelia. Con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá más miel para comercializarla y apoyar a su hija con sus gastos universitarios.

loans.use: To buy more honey to sell around town

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny is 31 years old, single, and lives by herself at a room that she rents. She is an elementary school teacher with lots of desire to move ahead. She works at a school in the city of Juliaca, where she teaches kids from 6 to 12 years old. In addition to her job, she sells natural medicinal products to increase her income, since today the cost of living is increasing. Usually, she teaches in the mornings and sells the natural medicinal products from house to house in the afternoons. In this way, she is busy all day working, which is heartening and dignified. Yenny works tirelessly to forge a better future for herself. The money from the loan will be invested in buying more natural medicinal products. In the future, she wishes to have another type of business like a grocery store or a book store.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Yenny tiene 31 años, es soltera, vive sola en un cuarto que alquila. Es una profesora de educación primaria con muchos ánimos de superación, trabaja en una escuela de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde enseña a niños de 6 a 12 años, además de esto, se dedica a la venta de productos de medicina natural para aumentar su economía, ya que hoy en día el costo de vida va en aumento.Usualmente, enseña por las mañanas y vende productos de medicina natural de forma ambulatoria por las tardes, así se mantiene todo el día ocupada en el trabajo, el cual le resulta alentador y dignificante. Yenny trabaja incansablemente para forjarse un mejor porvenir. El dinero del préstamo será invertido en la compra de más productos de medicina natural, en el futuro, ella desea tener otro tipo de negocio, tal como una tienda de abarrotes o una librería.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of natural medicine products that she sells.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 32 years old, divorced, and lives with her children: Dennis-8 and Rocio-3. She is a strong and hard working woman. She is dedicated to elaborate handcraft knits at home where she has a knitting machine. Since she separated from her husband, work has been tougher for her because she doesn't count with her partner's support anymore. That is why today she is busy all day knitting clothing pieces like: gloves, caps, bags, crochet purses, and sweaters which in turn she sells at the capital city of Lima. The business is good but very sacrificed. To provide her customers, she has to knit all day. She only rests on Sundays, the only day of the week that she can share with her family full time. Norma wants to see her children live with all the comforts and growing with a good education. With the loan money, she will buy more material to make more clothing pieces so in the future, she can export her goods abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Norma tiene 32 años, es divorciada, vive con sus hijos, Dennis de 8 y Rocio de 3. Es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora, se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos artesanales en su casa, donde cuenta con una máquina de tejer.Desde que se separó de su esposo el trabajo se le ha hecho más duro, ya que ya no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja.Es así, que ahora se ocupa durante todo el día en tejer prendas como guantes, gorros, bolsas, carteras a crochet y chompas, las que vende en la ciudad capital Lima.El negocio es bueno, pero sacrificado, para abastecer a sus clientes debe tejer todo el día, solo descansa los días domingos, día en el cual puede compartir a tiempo completo con su familia. Norma quiere ver a sus pequeños viviendo con todas las comodidades y crecer con una buena educación. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor material para confeccionar más prendas de vestir, para que en el futuro pueda exportar al extranjero.

loans.use: Buying material for making clothing pieces.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina is 36 years old. She is originally from the Santa Lucia district, Lampa Province, Puno. She is a single mother of 3 children: Albina-19, Yeni-17 and Edgar-14. For seven years, she has been dedicated to sell sweets in the tourist area of the district. Every day she brings her merchandise to this location to sell it among the people that visit this attractive place. Albina has three children to sustain and pay for their education, that's why she works all day to earn more and provide her kids everything that they need. What she likes most about her work are the day by day experiences that she has by looking at the people who pass by and talk with her. What she dislikes is that she has to deal with robbers that are in the nearby surroundings and want to take what she has earned. She wants to continue providing fro her kids so they can move ahead and fulfill their dreams. With the money that she is asking, Albina will buy more sweets to sell, be able to rent a small place to offer her products and with time have a small grocery store that will guarantee and income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Albina tiene 36 años, es natural del distrito de Santa Lucía, Provincia de Lampa, Puno, es madre soltera de tres hijos Albina de 19, Yeni de 17 y Edgar de 14. Se dedica desde hace siete años, a vender golosinas en el mirador turístico del distrito, todos los días lleva su mercadería hasta este punto para comercializarla entre las personas que pasean por este atractivo lugar.Albina tiene tres hijos que mantener y pagar sus estudios, por eso que trabaja durante todo el día para ganar más y poder darles a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitan.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las experiencias que vive día a día, viendo a la gente pasar y conversar con ella, lo desagradable es tener que lidiar con delincuentes que rondan por el lugar y que a veces quieren quitarle lo ganado. Albina quiere sacar a sus hijos adelante para que puedan cumplir todos sus sueños. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar más golosinas, poder alquilar un pequeño local donde ofrecer sus productos, y con el tiempo tener una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, para garantizar la economía de su familia.

loans.use: Renting a place to sell her sweets and increasing the merchandise offered.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Justiniana

texts.es:
Justiniana is 44 years old, divorced, and lives with her two sons. José is 15 and Nilton is 10, and both are students. This mother was only able to finish elementary school, since the low economic level of her family forced her to work in order to help with household expenses. Thus, from childhood, Justiniana has learned to take care of herself. After separating from her husband 12 years ago, Justiniana found it a good idea to use her life savings to open a small store in her home. That same business has enabled her to provide for her two children throughout the years. Justiniana likes to man the store, although being there all day every Monday through Saturday makes her tired. She wants to see her sons become professionals, and that’s why she puts so much effort into her work. With the loan that she will receive, Justiniana will be able to purchase more merchandise in order to supply her store and thereby help her business grow, making it larger and more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Justiniana tiene 44 años, es divorciada, vive con sus dos hijos; José de 15 y Nilton de 10, los cuales son estudiantes. Esta madre solo estudio hasta terminar la primaria, ya que los bajos recursos económicos de su familia la obligaron a trabajar para apoyar en los gastos de la casa, es así que desde muy pequeña ha aprendido a valerse por sí misma.Al separarse de su esposo, hace doce años atrás, le pareció buena idea utilizar sus ahorros de toda la vida para abrir una pequeña tienda en su casa, negocio con el cual ha estado manteniendo todos estos años a sus dos hijos.A doña Justiniana le gusta atender su tiendita, aunque permanecer todo el día de lunes a sábado se le hace cansado. Ella quiere ver a sus dos hijos hechos profesionales, por eso que le pone tanto empeño a su trabajo. Con el dinero que obtenga podrá comprar más mercadería para implementar su tienda y así poder crecer en su negocio, haciéndolo más grande y rentable.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa is 43 years old, divorced, and lives with her four children, Nélida, Mariluz, Alex and Manuel. 16 years ago she opened a small food store in her native town, Santa Lucía, with the aim of meeting her family’s economic needs. At that time she still counted on the support of her husband, but due to differences and problems the two separated and Santusa was left alone to care for her children. With her business, Santusa was able to get ahead, but with so much work running the store she does not have a lot of time for other activities. Even so, she likes her job and she plans to continue doing it as long as she has the strength. Santusa wants to give her children the opportunities that she never had. That is the motivation for her efforts.

With her loan, Santusa plans to purchase more products for her store and in time to open another branch.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Santusa tiene 43 años, es divorciada y vive con sus cuatro hijos Nélida, Mariluz, Alex y Manuel. Hace 16 años puso una tiendita de comestibles en su pueblo natal, Santa Lucía, con el fin de solventar los gastos de su familia, en ese entonces todavía contaba con el apoyo de su esposo, pero por diferencias y problemas se separaron y se quedó sola para mantener a sus hijos. Con su negocio, Santusa logró salir adelante sola, pero con mucho trabajo ya la atención de su tienda no le deja tiempo para otro tipo de actividades, pero aún así, le gusta su trabajo y piensa seguir haciéndolo hasta que las fuerzas le acompañen. Santusa quiere darles a sus hijos las oportunidades que ella nunca tuvo, ese es el motivo de su esfuerzo. Con el dinero piensa comprar más productos para su tiendita y con el tiempo hacer que esta tenga una sucursal.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata is 59 years old and lives with her 59 year-old husband Hernando, who is a driver, and also with her daughter Mariela, who is 20 years old and studies at the college level in the city of Juliaca. For the past three years, Fortunata has run a grocery store that she opened in her home. She has put a lot of affection and effort into the business in order to make it bear fruit and generate good income. Fortunata’s family has always supported her, and when her husband is not working he stays and helps her with the store, as does her daughter when she returns from her studies in the city. Fortunata likes her business since she has put so much effort into it.

Fortunata hopes that her daughter will get ahead and be a successful professional, so that she can work and survive in the city and not have to stay in the country like Fortunata. With the money from her loan, Fortunata will purchase supplies in order to grow her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Fortunata tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo Hernando D. 59 años, el cual es chofer y con su hija Mariela D. 20, quien cursa sus estudios superiores en la ciudad D. Juliaca. Hace tres años atrás, se dedica a atender su tienda D. comestibles que abrió en su casa, en ella, ha puesto mucho cariño y empeño para hacer que D. frutos y pueda ser generadora D. ingresos. Su familia siempre la ha apoyado y cuando su esposo no está trabajando pueD. quedarse a ayudarla en la tienda, al igual que su hija, cuando llega D. estudiar D. la ciudad, le ayuda. A Fortunata le gusta su negocio ya que le ha puesto mucho esfuerzo en ella. Su deseo es que su hija la supere, que sea una profesional D. éxito, para que pueda trabajar y superarse en la ciudad y no se queD. solamente en el campo, como ella. Con el dinero del préstamo comprara mercadería para hacer crecer su pequeña tienda.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in her small grocery store

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina is 35 years old and a widow. She lives with her three children; Anais, 17, Yesesiño, 15 and Faviola 7. She is dedicated to seasonal sales. During these months, she sells beer at her town during their festivities. She also constantly travels to the small towns of Imata and Pinaya where she offers this beverage with the goal of providing to her children because she is the main breadwinner of the family since her husband's death. Marcelina travels a lot and usually works all day where there are festivities or parties where she can sell the liquor at the town. There are also days where no events take place and the sales are not good at all. What she likes about her work is how it makes her feel: independent and useful. But the difficulties are present too. The transportation of the beer cases is dangerous due to the fragility of the cases and also when some people consume in excess and are drunk, they don't want to pay.

Marcelina works ardously to make her children contributing citizens, happy, professional and with some money to fulfill their goals. With the money from the loan, Marcelina will be able to buy more cases of beer to sell. With time, she expects to establish a small grocery store so she doesn't have to travel that much and spend more time with her children

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Marcelina tiene 35 años, es viuda, vive con sus tres hijos; Anais de 17, Yesesiño de 15 y Faviola de 7. Se dedica al comercio según la temporada, en estos meses vende cerveza en su localidad durante los días de fiesta, también viaja constantemente a los pueblitos de Imata y Pinaya, donde ofrece esta bebida, con el único fin de mantener a sus hijos, ya que se quedó sola con la muerte de su esposo. Marcelina viaja mucho, usualmente se dedica todo el día a trabajar los días donde hay alguna fiesta, donde ella pueda vender este licor, pero también existen días en los cuales no las hay y la venta no es buena.Lo que le gusta a Marcelina de su trabajo es como la hace sentir, independiente y útil, pero las dificultades también se hacen presentes, por un lado el traslado de las cajas de cerveza es peligroso, por la fragilidad de estas y por otro cuando algunas personas que consumen en exceso y ebrias no quieren pagar, Marcelina trabaja arduamente para hacer de sus hijos gente de provecho, feliz, profesional y con dinero para cumplir todas sus metas. Con el dinero que adquiera podrá comprar más cajas de cerveza, para venderlas, con el tiempo, espera poner una pequeña tienda de comestibles, para no tener que viajar tanto y poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of the product (beer) that she sells during her town festivities.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Melinda

texts.es:
Melinda is 33 years old. She is the single mother of one daughter named Melinda like her. She is 7 years old. She is dedicate to run her beauty shop. She performs this activity at her home where she spends most of her day. The business is profitable. The only negative side to it is that she has to work most of the day and can't share as much time with her daughter as she wants. But her 15 years of experience in this business makes her enjoy it and it doesn't bring any difficulties to her. Melinda works and will work ardously for her daughter so she can be happy and have a promising future. With the money she is asking, Melinda will buy more hairdressing equipment and accesories. Melinda wants to grow and consolidate her business so it can be bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Melinda tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de una hija de 7 años llamada Melinda, como ella. Se dedica a atender su peluquería, esta actividad la realiza en su casa dedicándole la mayor parte del día, el negocio es rentable, lo único malo es que al trabajar durante casi todo el día y no pueda compartir el tiempo que ella quisiera con su hija, por lo demás los 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, hace que éste no le traiga dificultad y que más bien le agrade hacerlo. Melinda trabaja y trabajará arduamente por su hija, para que ella sea feliz y tenga un futuro promisorio. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más accesorios de peluquería, Melinda quiere crecer y consolidar su negocio, para que sea cada vez más grande.

loans.use: Implementing her beauty salon and adding more hairdressing accesories.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria is 48 years old, separated with 7 children whom 4 are still living with her: Yeny-20 yrs. old, Cynthia-19 yrs.old, Magnolia-15 yrs.old and Isumi-11 yrs.old. The eldest children are working and studying outside of their city. She is dedicated to sell beer, a business that allows her to sustain her four daughters who need food, education, and shelter. From her godmother's house, which is where she lives with her daughters, she sells the beer by cases. If the neighbors have some commitment, party, or celebration, she provides them with the beer. Like any job, it has its difficult side, in this case the danger lays when some of the buyers are intoxicated and don't want to pay or they make trouble because they don't have money and want to consume more. But Flor de Maria 16 years of experience on this business had prepared her to confront any type of problem with patience and serenity.

She wants that all her children become men and women of integrity and that they can face life armed with a good education. With the loan money, she will buy more cases of beer to increase her sales and in the future establish another kind of business which she hopes one of her daughters be able to administer

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Flor de María tiene 48 años, es separada, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales vive con cuatro; Yeny de 20, Cynthia de 19, Magnolia de 15 y Isumi de 11, los mayores están trabajando y estudiando fuera de su ciudad. Se dedica a la venta de cerveza, negocio que le permite mantener a sus cuatro hijas, a quienes debe brindarles alimentación, educación y abrigo.Desde la casa de su madrina, que es donde vive con sus hijas, vende la cerveza por cajas, si los vecinos tienen algún compromiso, fiesta o celebración, los provee de este licor.Como todo trabajo, tiene su lado difícil, en este caso el peligro está cuando algunos compradores pasados de copas no quieren pagarle o le hacen problemas al no tener dinero y querer consumir más, pero los 16 años que tiene Flor de María en el negocio, han hecho que ella sepa afrontar cualquier tipo de problema con paciencia y serenidad. Ella quiere que todos sus hijos sean hombres y mujeres de provecho y que puedan afrontar la vida con una buena educación. Con el dinero del préstamo comprara más cajas de cerveza para aumentar su venta, y en el futuro poner otro tipo de negocio el cual administre alguna de sus hijas.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of beer cases that she sells.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean S. is a 57-year-old widow and porridge seller. She has been selling porridge from her house since 1998, typically earning about US$1.66 per day. Sean has five children, all of whom can help their mother's business. Her oldest daughter, Mrs. Nen Chreap, 29 years old, is a farmer and raises pigs as well. They all live in Kean Sangkei Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To increase the family's income, Sean seeks a loan of US$350 for her daughter's business -- to buy pigs for breeding and to purchase fertilizers for growing rice. She hopes that the loan will increase their income, which supports her family's daily living expenses. Mrs. Sean is selling porridge in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pigs to breed and purchase fertilizers for growing rice

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoy M. is a 33-year-old vegetable seller who is also growing rice. She grows vegetables and sells them at the Dom Dek Market which is her local market. She earns approximately US$ 2.50 per day, while in the case of her husband, Mr. Och Vunn, 40 years old, his business is transporting chopped wood from the forest to sell, earning around US$ 6.00 per day. Mrs. Chhoy has four children, all of whom are students. They all live in Kean Sangkei Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To expand their farming business, Mr. Vunn has decided to seek a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a plowing-machine. The loan will increase their income to support their family's daily expenses adequately.

loans.use: To purchase a plowing-machine

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly M. is 44 years old and lives with her father. She makes bricks to sell from her house. She works hard at her business and earns approximately US$5.96 per day. She is single and started her business in 2000. Her father is a rice farmer. She lives in Kean Sangkei Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Ly thought about her lack of capital to use for her business. She decided to request a loan of US$800 to stock clay for making bricks and to buy gas and wood to operate her business. The loan will increase her income, which will help her support her family and sufficiently cover their living expenses.

loans.use: To stock clay to make bricks and to buy gas and wood to operate her business

loans.name: Gulzaran's Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran baji is the wife of M. A. A., and she lives in the city of Pakpattan in Pakistan. She notes that Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She owns a two-room brick house, which she has lived in for the last 14 years. Moreover, she is the mother of two daughters, both of whom are in kindergarten. Her husband works in "WAPDA". Meanwhile, Gulzaran baji is a housewife because she prefers to do household work on a daily basis. She is applying for a loan in order to buy groceries for her brother's grocery store.

She is joined in her loan group by the following members: (1) Bushra baji, who seeks a loan to buy milk to resell; (2) Taj baji, who would like a loan to buy more wheat and corn to resell; (3) Shamim baji, who requests a loan to buy leather to sell at a wholesale market; (4) Sakina baji, who is in need of a loan to buy a sewing machine; and (5) Bilquis baji, who desires a loan to buy a fruit cart (to sell fruit).

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. At the same time, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; accordingly, if one member does not repay her loan, then the other group members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve their respective businesses (e.g., to buy groceries for a grocery shop, to purchase a sewing machine, etc.)

loans.name: Fruit Sales Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She is the mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. Her daughter is in the 8th standard (grade). Her elder son is a daily wage laborer. The younger son works in a factory. Suraiya Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her brother, who lives with her and has a business of fruit selling. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell. Shabiran baji wants a loan to buy wires for her electric wire shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Fruit Sales Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of S. M. A. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a clerk. The next to him is in the 7th standard (grade). Her daughter recently memorized the Quran-e-Pak (Holy Book of Muslims). Her husband belongs to a journalism profession. Kosar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her nephew to expand his fruit business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy computer parts to resell. Khadija baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil and washing powder (detergent) to resell. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy cattle (goat, cows) to resell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy material (a chair, a mirror) for her beauty parlor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Wood Sales Group

texts.en:
Maqsood Yasmin baji is the wife of Syed A. H. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She owes a four-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Both of her kids are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband sells wood. He buys wood from different areas of Pakpattan and sells them to the wholesaler and earns profit. He has been in this profession for the last 7 years. Maqsood baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local type of three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kosar baji wants a loan to buy Islamic books for her book shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more wood to resell

loans.name: Custom Embroidered Clothes Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is the wife of M. Sharif and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She has been living in this city since her childhood. She is the mother of four sons. Her elder son is a driver and drives a local bus. The next eldest to him works in a factory. The younger to him is in 10th standard (grade). Her younger son is in the 9th standard. Naziran baji's husband is a worker in a school. Naziran baji is a housewife but she also makes embroidered clothes and sells them in market. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (clothes, colored thread, and patterns) to make more embroidered clothes to earn good profit. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Khairan baji wants a loan to buy motorbike spare parts. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy more video games for her video game shop. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy more cigarettes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material to make embroidered clothes

loans.name: Amiran's Group

texts.en:
Amiran baji is the wife of S. A. and lives in a small city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical places.

Amiran baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 13 years. She is the mother of six children: one son and five daughters. Her son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her first three daughters are just doing household work. The other two are getting education, one is in 5th standard and the other is in kindergarten.

Amiran baji's husband is a security guard by profession. Amiran baji makes handmade things, specifically ladies' ornaments, e.g., embroidered parandas (decorative tassels) and sells them at the market. She has successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son who presently driving a rented auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her land. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy agriculture tools to work the land and make it fertile. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy milk to re-sell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Firdous baji wants a loan to buy fruit to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Auto-Rickshaw (Taxi Driver) Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji is the wife of M. and lives in a small city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical places. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 12 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband is a shoe polisher. Rubina baji makes handmade things and sells them in the market. In particular, she makes ladies' ornaments (embroided parandas). From the shoe polishing work, her husband couldn't provide enough for his family. Therefore he decided to start another business which is driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Rubina baji is fully convinced with that with her husband's new work and with buying an auto-rickshaw a loan is necessary.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bashiran baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to resell. Kosar baji wants a loan to take a land on contract to grow seasonal fruit. Khursheeda baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea C., 23, and her husband, Mr. Mab C., 28, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have one daughter.

Mrs. Sophea has been a silk weaver for five years, using a skill she learned from her neighbor. Mr. Mab has been a silk weaver for seven years. He learned his skill from his sister. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sophea is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her and her husband's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Auto-Rickshaw (Motorbike Taxi) Group

texts.en:
Swallehah baji is the wife of N. A. and lives in a small city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical places. She owes a two-room mud house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of two sons and both are drivers by profession. Her husband is a security guard and also drives a an auto-rickshaw, a local three-wheeled vehicle, when he gets free from the job. Swallehah baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zulaikhan baji wants a loan to buy milk and curd for her milk shop. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy leather for shoemaking. Azra baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy sugarcane to sell sugarcane syrup.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima baji is the wife of P. B. and lives in a small city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical places. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She has one son. Her son runs a grocery shop. Her husband is a driver by profession. Fatima baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her son's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy fruit to re-sell. Begam baji wants a loan to buy goats to re-sell. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. Yean C., 60, and her husband, Mr. Tha Khat, 70, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1964 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Two of their sons are married and living in separate houses, and the other son is a tailor. Their four daughters are silk weavers.

Mrs. Yean has been a weaver since 1964, employing a skill she learned from her sister-in-law. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Tha is a farmer. He grows rice and sesame in the farm near the house.

Yean is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase silk materials for her three daughters' weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen baji is the wife of M. and lives in a small city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical places. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of six children: three daughters and three sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband is a tailor with experience of 8 years. Shaheen baji makes handmade things, specifically ladies' ornaments (embroided parandas) and sells them in market. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Miss Chamroen T., 21, is single and lives with her parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has one brother and one sister.

Miss Chamroen has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Chamroen is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials for weaving and repair part of her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and repair part of her house.

loans.name: Sareun

texts.en:
Mr. Sareun S. is 58 years old and a food seller. He sells roasted pork and chicken. He purchases small pigs and chicken from villagers to roast and sell in the Tunle Bet Market. His wife, Mrs. Soun Yeun, is 54 years old and sells fish and fruit in the market, earning about US$2.00 per day. She has five children, three of whom are married. Another one is a board factory worker. They all live in Tunle Bet Commune, Kampong Cham Province.

For the growth of his business, Sareun needs capital to improve his business and increase his family's income. He decided to request a loan of US$500 to purchase pigs and chicken to roast and sell and, for his wife's business, to buy fish stocks to sell. The loan will improve their businesses and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and chicken to roast and sell and, for his wife's business, to buy fish stocks to sell.

loans.name: Almas

texts.en: Almas (his son is pictured) was born in 1961. He lives in Khachmaz town. Almas has been in this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the pesticides and fertilizer necessary for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Mrs. Savin P., 31, and her husband, Mr. Yoin Meas, 34, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1997 and have three children: one daughter and two sons. One of her sons is in school.

Mrs. Savin has been a silk weaver for nine years, a skill she learned from her sister-in-law. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while her husband drives a horse cart to haul dirt for leveling house foundations. Now, Savin is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase cows for raising.

loans.use: To purchase cows for raising.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambo S., 41, is a widow with four children: two sons and two daughters. Her oldest daughter sells beauty products in Phnom Penh, and the other three children study in a local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Sambo has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old, using a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoeun N., 33, and her husband, Mr. Sophy Kroeun, 29, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1997 and have three children: two daughters and one son. Two of their children are in school.

Mrs. Sophoeun has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, using a skill that she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sophy raises cows. Sophoeun is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Minabadji

texts.en: Minabadji was born in 1954. She lives in Khachmaz region. She has been in this business for 5 years. She is the mother of 5 children. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mr. Thach H., 51, and his wife, Mrs. Orn Chan, 41, live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1992 and have six children; one son and five daughters. Five of their children are in school.

Mr. Thach has been a motor taxi driver since 1991. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Orn sells fruit at the market. Mr. Thach is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to build a kitchen for his family.

loans.use: To build a kitchen for his family.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Mr. Voeun B., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Srey-aun Soeung, 26, live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have two children: one son and one daughter. 

Mr. Voeun has been a mason since 2003. He does his work in Phnom Penh and a nearby province. His wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. Currently, Voeun needs a motorcycle for driving to work and running a motor taxi when he is free from his construction work. Thus, he is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle to drive to work and serve as a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work and run as a motor taxi.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tural

texts.en: Tural was born in 1983. He lives in Khachmaz town. This young man is single. He has been in the auto repair business for 2 years. Now this young man needs a loan of  US$ 1200 to buy the necessary spare parts and tools  for improving his business. He has a lot of clients and he wants to improve his business so as to provide his clients with the best service.

loans.use: to buy the necessary spare parts and tools  for improving his business

loans.name: Hap

texts.en:
Mrs. Hap S., 56 years old, raises pigs as well as distilling and selling khmer wine. Her husband, Mr. Vann Di, 56 years old, is a fisherman. He fishes around Tunle Sap Lake. Hap has eight children, five of whom are married. Their two single sons are construction workers, living in Dan Ronn Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

Hap requests a loan of US$300 to purchase pig food and spend on farmland plowing and to purchase a fishing boat for her husband's fishing business. The loan will help increase their businesses' income, which support the family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and spend on farmland plowing

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is the widow of M. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. Hanifan baji has been living in this city for the last 20 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a daily wage laborer. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She and her family live with her brother who is a driver by profession. Hanifan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy livestock (goats, cows) to resell. Sharifan baji and Rashida baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Grocery Store Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is the wife of M. Ramzan and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Both of her kids are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband has been running a grocery shop for the last 20 years. Khursheed baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband's grocery shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Tasmeena baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Zulaikhan baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Hotel And Cafe Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is a wife of G. F. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She has been living in this city for the last 8 years. She is the mother of one son named Imran. Imran is 20 years old and runs his hotel, where he sells different types of Punjabi foods (Samosas, Pakoras). He started this business when he was just 15. Her husband is a daily wage labor. Khursheed baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, utensils) to expand her son's food business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. G. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy goats to resell. Kanizan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Sultana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Ghafooran baji and Rubina baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goods for making and selling food

loans.name: Grocery Store Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. Sharif and lives a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. Nasreen baji has been living in this city for the last 15 years. She is the mother of six children: one son and five daughters. Her son is a daily wage labor. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasreen baji's husband runs a grocery shop, with experience of 10 years. Nasreen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her husband's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sabra baji wants a loan to buy more chickens to resell. Sakina baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine. Ansar baji wants a loan to buy goats to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for the grocery shop

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en:
Sabit was born in 1977. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli region in Azerbaijan, settled in Baku city, in a dormitory of Baku State University. This young man is single.

Sabit has been in the taxi business for eight years. Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy spare parts for improving his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hotel And Cafe Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is the wife of M. Imran and lives a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. Rukhsana baji has been living in this city for the last 3 years. She is the mother of one son who is just 2 years old. Her husband has a food business. He runs his own hotel in the community. He has been in this profession for the last 3 years. Rukhsna baji is a housewife but she helps her husband by preparing food for his hotel. M. Imran has a good reputation in the community and everybody calls him "the great man." Rukhsana baji is applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, lentils, and utensils) to expand her husband's food business and to maintain the business's reputation as well.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy more fruits to resell. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy goats to resell. Waziran baji wants a loan to buy more vegetables to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy food for selling at the hotel

loans.name: Radhiaya

texts.en:
Radhiya, who is 25 years old and married, has been a charcoal and bites (chapati) seller since 2007. She works everyday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Radhiya is requesting a loan to buy more items to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Tabia

texts.en:
Tabia, 36 and married with two children aged 16 and 8, has been a chicken, eggs and food seller since 2003. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, she can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Tabia now hopes for a loan to buy more chicken and food items to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and food items to expand her business.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
Abdusattor A. is 22 years old. He is married with an 11-month-old baby. Six years ago, Abdusattor decided to start his own business selling carpets. He began his own business with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur.

Abdusattor is familiar with the ins and outs of this business and provides good customer service. He has many customers, and his business keeps growing. In order to satisfy the high demand, he now needs a loan in the amount of 1000 USD which he will use to purchase more inventory. He commits to repay this amount within 12 months.

Be a part of this business and of Abdusattor's family by supporting his growing enterprise. They greatly appreciate it!

loans.use: Increasing the range of goods to expand sales

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is single, and he was born in 1986. He is an "internally displaced person" (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Agdam region in Azerbaijan, and he has settled in Baku city. He started this business five years ago. Now, he seeks a loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy additional foodstuffs to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor B. is 46 years old. She’s married with 4 children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 10 years she has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, fattening and then selling them.

Gulbahor is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home. Gulbahor wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved mother.

Thanks to this activity she is supporting her children and providing them with education. Gulbahor wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) with a term of 12 months to buy calves in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of determination and strength to live. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Fatma's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Fatma H. is 26 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 9 and 6 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Fatma H. is now requesting a loan to buy more firewood and charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Shumbana, Tatu, Miza, and Fatma S..

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Olmagul

texts.en:
Olmagul S. is 34 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 2 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now Olmagul is dedicating herself to raising and selling cattle and with the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. She is asking for a 2000 Somoni (600 USD) loan with a term of 12 months in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Salha's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Salha, 26 and single, has been a shopkeeper since 2005. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Salha is requesting a loan to buy more goods in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ghaniya.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: En

texts.en:
En T., age 51, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 1979, she and her husband, Sudh Sorn, have been working on their rice field to earn a living and they are able to make around US$ 3 to support their family each day. This couple together has four children and all of them are employed with different jobs.

Mrs. En T. would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, to create another business selling grocery products to the people in her village. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will increase her daily income. (She pictured in her rice field.) CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To create another business selling grocery products

loans.name: Mohiya

texts.en:
Mohiya S. is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She is a very active woman. Fifteen years ago, she started her business of raising cattle. Her family has 2 sheep and a cow. She usually sells them to local restaurants. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are playing the main role in her life.

Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Mohiya would like to request a loan to expand her business and increase family income. She will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. With this purpose in mind, Mohiya is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for a term of 12 months in order to buy more young cattle to sell when they are fully grown. The well-being of her family and her business are in your hands. Mohiya and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, 49 and married with three children between the ages of 28 and 15, has been a juice and bites (snacks) seller since 1993. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maryam now hopes for a loan to buy more items for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Tavhida

texts.en:
Tavhida A.  is 24 years old. She is married with two adorable children. Eight years ago, Tavhida opened a small shoe store in the central market of Isfara, Tajikistan. With the assistance of microfinance loans through IMON, Tavhida successfully expanded her business.

 A skilled businesswoman, Tavhida is known throughout the market for her reasonable prices, reliable home delivery, and individualized customer service. Tavhida is responsible also for raising her two children. She says that it's not an easy job; you have to keep watch over the kids' education and check up on their homework in high school.

 Today Tavhida has requested a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) with a term of 12 months to purchase additional inventory for the upcoming season. With the additional profits, she plans to continue developing her business and supporting her children's schooling. Tavhida and her children sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing new shoes for women and children for re-sale

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
Mahliyo G. is 27 years old, and is married with two children. Difficulty meeting the family's living expenses forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn more income. Mahliyo and her husband have to work a lot to provide their children with a good education.

A dedicated entrepreneur, Mahliyo runs her business day after day with a cheerful smile and a desire to meet the clothing needs of her customers. Currently she has a well-established clientele, which continues to grow. She is requesting a loan of 2750 Somoni (825 USD) to purchase more clothes to sell during the autumn season. The well-being of her family and her business are in your hands. Mahliyo and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchasing new women's and girls' clothing to sell

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir (his son is pictured ) was born in 1958. This man has been in the farming business for 8 years. He lives in Khachmaz town. Zakir is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the fertilizer and pesticides necessary for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Hoshimboy

texts.en:
Hoshimboy R. is 49 years old. He is married with four children. Hoshimboy is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults, thanks to his example.

Hoshimboy sells cattle. As a rule, he purchases young cattle in the central market, feeds them, and then re-sells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 20 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to raise them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate stable and considerable income for his large family.

Hoshimboy has a large and friendly family who are trying to help each other. In the photo you can see his wife, since on the day of our visit he was gone to buy fodder. Today, knowing that the prices for animals are not so high just now but will increase for sure, Hoshimboy is planning to enlarge his herd and purchase cows and calves.

With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 3500 Somoni (1025 US Dollars) for a term of 6 months. You could become an important part in Hoshimboy's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing cows and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is a married man, and he has 2 children. Moreover, he is an "internally displaced person" (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan, but he has settled in the town of Khirdalan. Elshan was born in 1968, and he has been in this business for 8 years. Now, he requests a loan in the amount of $625 to buy additional foodstuffs to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru:
Рахманов Исмоилжон,  1960 года рождения. Он женат и у них 5 детей. Он выбрал для себя особое направление в бизнесе. Приготовление и продажа самбусы вот уже пять лет. У него много клиентов, потому что приготовленные самбусы из говядины и баранины притягают прохожих приятно манящим ароматом. Также можно вкусно пообедать, выпить зеленого чая, прохладительными напитками и утолить жажду. Исмоилжону часто делают большие заказы для мероприятий и торжеств. С наступлением осени он хочет отремонтировать свой место деятельности, для удобности клиентов.  
  Недавно он услышал о программе Кива и с ее помощью хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismoiljon R. was born in 1960. He is married and has 5 children. He chose a specific direction for his business. He has been making and selling sambusa (Tajik savory pastries) for 5 years now. He has many customers, because the preparation of sambusa with beef and lamb attracts passersby with a pleasant and attracting aroma. In addition, it is possible to eat tasty food, drink green tea and cold beverages and to satisfy thirst at his location. Ismoiljon often gets large orders for events and celebrations.

With the start of autumn Ismoiljon would like to repair his place of business to increase the comfort of customers. He recently learned about Kiva and with its help would like to take out a loan for 3000 somoni ($900) for a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ремонт место деятельности

loans.name: Muyasar

texts.ru:
Аминова Муяссар 1960 года рождения, она разведена и у нее один ребенок. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она  начала в 2001 году, с продажи женской одежды.  Она торгует на рынке «Пенчшер» города Душанбе. Так как она сама женщина и разбирается очень хорошо в тканях ей легко. У нее много клиентов, как обычные покупатели, так и швейные цеха. В его ассортименте имеются сейчас  такие ткани как  шифон, шелк, штапель  и т.д.
Свой товар Муяссар закупает в оптовых рынках. В момент свадебных сезонов ей необходимы дополнительные средства для увеличения ассортимента и количество продаваемого товара. Для этого она хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони и погасить его в течении года.
texts.en:
Muyasar A. was born in 1960, she is divorced and has one child. She became an entrepreneur in 2001, when she started selling women’s clothing. She works at the “Pandzhsher” market in Dushanbe. Since she is a woman and knows a lot about fabrics, the business is easy for her. She has many customers, both regular customers and sewing shops. Her product assortment includes fabrics such as chiffon, silk, etc.

Muyasar purchases her products at wholesale markets. During wedding season she needs additional resources in order to increase her product assortment and quantity of products. She would like to take out a 4100 somoni ($1200) loan and will pay it back over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Path S., age 26, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has been working as a garment factory worker to earn a living and is able to make a profit of $3.50 a day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. On average, he makes around $2 profit each day. This couple together has only one child. Mrs. Path would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a trailer for her husband. The trailer will be attached to the motorbike. People, especially foreigners, prefer a motor-taxi with a trailer to a simple motor-taxi because it is safer and more enjoyable. She also told a loan officer that recently the motor business is more difficult than in past years because of inflation and the skyrocketing costs of food and gas.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.
.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for her husband

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en: Djamila (her sister is pictured) was born in 1957. She is the mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region. Djamila and her sister have been in the farming business for 8 years. Now they need  a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the fertilizer and pesticides necessary for improving their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa G. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée te mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient à Danyi, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise, un bar restaurant. Elle désire par ce crédit aménager son bar pour offrir un cadre plus accueillant à ses clients et aussi s’abonner à une société de livraison de boissons pour bénéficier des livraisons en gros.
texts.en:
Yawa G. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three. She has a bar-restaurant in Danyi, a village located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She would like to use this loan to fix up her bar in order to offer a more welcoming atmosphere to her customers and also to join a beverages delivery company to benefit from wholesale deliveries.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her bar and also to supply it with beverages

loans.name: Olima

texts.en:
Olima Z. is 43 years old. She is a widow with five children. When her husband passed away, she was left without any steady income. Supporting this large family on her own was very difficult. Struggling against the difficult life, Olima learned to process dried fruits and clingstone apricots 9 years ago. The business went along successfully after it started.

Thanks to this activity she has been able to open a grocery store near her house where her daughter sells foodstuffs. Her elder son left for Russia two years ago to try to earn some money. Every month he sends his mother on average US$ 200.
