Today Olima is requesting a loan of 2900 Somoni (850 USD) with a term of 8 months. She hopes to use the loan to purchase more dried fruits due to great demand from her customers. Olima and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruits for processing and sale

loans.name: Mahmadsaid

texts.ru: Раджабов Махмадсаид житель города Душанбе. Возраст 27 лет , женат и имеет одного ребенка. Уже три года работает таксистом внутри города. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы установить газовое оборудование. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Если он установит газовое оборудование его доходы возрастут , кроме того он сможет снизить стоимость проезда , тем самым помогать населению
texts.en:
Mahmadsaid R. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 27 years old, married and has one child. He has been working as a taxi driver for the last three years. He plans to receive a loan and use it to upgrade his vehicle to run on gas. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months. If he installs the new equipment, it will help increase his profits as well as decrease the cost of fare which will also help the residents.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install new equipment in car

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida, who is 27 and married with three children aged seven, three, and one, has been selling clothes and other commodities since 2007. Working daily, she can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Wahida is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and other commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and other commodities to expand her business.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon Y., age 52, is the mother of three children and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2002, she has been selling pork at an open air market in the village. On average, she makes around $3.00 profit per day. Her daughter is employed as a garment factory worker while her two other children are construction workers building houses. Mrs. Phon would like a loan from Kiva to create another business in order to double her family's income. She wants to sell a variety of groceries. She told a loan officer that in the morning she sells pork so that in the evening she can run a grocery store. She sees this investment as an opportunity to increase her daily income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: Set up a store to sell groceries

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma, 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 12 and 1, has been selling coconuts, juice and khanga since 2005. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mwajuma is now requesting a loan to buy more coconuts and khanga to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and khanga for expansion of her business.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla E. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il est coordonnier à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire par ce crédit acheter des outils de travail et aussi aménager son atelier. Monsieur Komla compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Komla E. is 32 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is a shoemaker in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He would like to use this loan to buy work tools and also to fix up his workshop. Mr. Komla has the intention of improving his living conditions through this opportunity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and also to fix up his workshop

loans.name: Durahshon

texts.ru: Муродалиев Дурахшон житель города Яван. Возраст 24 года . Женат , детей не имеет. Живет с родителями. Является единственным кормильцем семьи. Занимается животноводством. То есть купле продажей молодых бычков. Для развития бизнеса планирует получить кредит и купить еще одного молодого бычка. Откормив его , он может продать его  по выгодной цене. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Durahshon M. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 24 years old, married without children. He lives with his parents and is the sole provider for the family. He is in the animal husbandry business buying and selling calves. To expand his business he plans to receive a loan and use it to buy another calf. He will feed it until it has grown and then he can sell it at a more profitable price. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Chanbopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanbopha D., 45, is a food seller. She sells Khmer noodles and desserts in her village, earning US$ 3.00 per day, while her husband, Mr. Choun Kheang, is a village doctor, earning about US$ 5.00 per day. Chanbopha has five children, all of whom are students. They are living in Snam Pras Commune, Pursat Province.

To reduce the family's expenses for traveling and transportation, Chanbopha had a discussion with her husband and decided to request a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorcycle to use to reduce the family's expenses related to traveling to work and school. The loan will help them keep more profit to support their family's living expenses adequately.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for the family

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle demeure à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est revendeuse des médicaments génériques. Adzo espère par ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant beaucoup plus de produits afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et par là gagner plus pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adzo A. is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three. She is staying in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is a retailer of generic medicines. Adzo hopes to use this loan to increase the size of her business by buying a lot of goods in order to meet the demands of her customers. Thus, she also hopes to earn more to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals to sell

loans.name: Dosti

texts.ru: Гиесов Дости проживает в городе Яван . Вдовец ,имеет шестерых детей. Занимается животноводством.  Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже всю жизнь. Планирует получить кредит  для того , чтобы закупить корм. Это поможет откармливать бычков , быстрее. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12  месяцев
texts.en:
Dosti G. lives in the town of Yavan. He is a widower and has six children. He is in the animal husbandry and has been in this business all his life. He plans to use the received loan to buy fodder to feed the calves which will help them grow faster. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Fatma Bakari Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 38 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 22 and 8 years old. She became a food items seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Safia, Mwanagani, Asha, and Tabia.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Qizlarsara

texts.ru: Имомурзаева Кизларсара жительница города Яван. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается торговлей  различных мелочей. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Ее торговая точка находится рядом со школой , поэтому продаваемая продукция быстро расходится. Кредит хочет получить сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ей заработать побольше денег и использовать для своих детей.
texts.en:
Qizlarsara I. lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has six children. Her business is the sale of various small items. She wants to increase sales with the help of a loan. Her sales stand is near a school, so the items sell quickly. The loan she is requesting will be paid back over 12 months. It will help her earn more money to use for her children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab (her father is pictured) is the mother of 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan, settled in the Fuzuli region, in Kayidish village, an area which was built specifically for IDPs. She was born in 1966.

Together with her father, Zeynab has been in the refrigerator sales business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of US$ 1200 to buy refrigerators to expand their business.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, married with four children aged 20, 16, 12 and 7, has been a clothes seller since 2006. She works daily from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maryam is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is married with 4 children aged 12, 10, and 8 years old and one child is only 2 months old. She is a firewood seller. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 175 from her sales.

Ashura is now requesting a loan to buy more firewood for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Non

texts.en: Mrs. Non N., 31 years old, is a vegetable grower; she earns around US $3.2 per day. Her husband, who is 37 years old, is a construction worker. Non grows vegetable crops such as beans, cabbages, and cucumbers and she sells to the market. Non lives with her husband and two children. All of their children are young and in school. To increase their family's income, she needs a loan to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak H., age 43, is married and resides in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 1993, she and her husband have been working as miners to earn a living, and they are able to make around US$5.00 profit per day. Previously, they were workers, but now they are self-employed taking stone from the mountain. This couple has two children, one of whom is a garment worker and one a student. Mrs. Prak would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a trill machine to increase her productivity. She told a loan officer that she wants her child to take a higher class. She sees this investment as an opportunity to increase her daily income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a trill machine to increase productivity

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mwajuma's Twaomba Salama Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, 38, is married with three children between the ages of six and three. A food seller since 2005, she works daily from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $60.

Mwajuma is requesting a loan to buy more food items including rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members: Salha, Maryam, Asha and Salama.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou C., age 22, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. In the village, she is one of the vendors selling various kinds of vegetables and groceries at an open-air stall to earn a living. She is able to make around US$ 2 in profit per day. Her husband has been a motor-taxi driver since 2000 and can make US$ 3 in profit per day.

Mrs Bou would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, to expand her grocery inventory in order to meet her customers' demands. Most poor entrepreneurs especially live in the provinces and they normally earn a living by working as farmers, raising animals, or running a motor-taxi. That is why most of the loans from Credit are agricultural loans.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory for her little stall

loans.name: Mwanachuo's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Mwanachuo, married with three children ranging in age from nine months to seven years, has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2000. Working daily, she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mwanachuo is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members: Ibaki, Khadija and Riziki.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Loa

texts.en:
Loa M., age 45, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been planting many kinds of vegetables, such as cabbage and long beans. She sells her crop at the market and earns about $7 per day. Her husband is a fisherman. Normally, he sells his catch to the market and makes $4 of profit per day. 

Loa is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to make two investments. She would like to invest $300 USD in her husband's business and invest $700 USD in her farm by purchasing more fertilizer, insecticide, seeds, and gas. She sees these investments as opportunities to increase her daily income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools for her husband and fertilizer, insecticide, seed and gas for her farm.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian O. K. lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and married with four children. Vivian sells office stationery supplies and has been doing so for a long time. She is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client, and she is requesting a loan of $425 USD to buy more office stationery supplies to sell. This loan will help her satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more office stationery supplies to sell.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 48 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 15, 18, and 8 years old. She has been a juice and bread seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Fatma is now seeking a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
Mrs. Bo P., 43, grows vegetables to sell and typically earns around US$ 3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Noeurm Ny, 44, is a construction worker. Bo has five children, two of whom are also construction workers whose income helps to support the family. They live in Ampil Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Because of increasing family expenses due to transportation and traveling, Bo P. wants to purchase a motorcycle to use to reduce the family's expenses. Hence, she is now requesting a loan of US$ 700 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to transport her vegetables to sell and reduce the cost of her husband's and children's traveling to work.

Bo's husband is pictured because Bo was unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Aina

texts.en:
Aina R. is 35 years old and married with four children. She lives in Sabo Oniba in Lagos state, Nigeria.

Aina works from her home selling foodstuffs, like garri, beans, palm oil, and rice. She has been in this business for a long time and is also a LAPO client. She needs the loan for $425 to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu, married with two children aged 19 and 15, has been selling clothes and shoes since 2006. Working daily from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Zuwena's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Zuwena, 43 and married with six children ranging in age from 24 to 8, has been a food and juice seller since 2005. Working daily from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Zuwena is requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Jemilatu

texts.en:
Jemilatu B. lives in Sabo Oniba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 45 years old and married with six children. Since 2000, Jemilatu has been selling vegetable oil as well as producing nylon in her house.

Jemilatu is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. She is requesting a loan of $700 USD to buy a deep freezer so that she can start selling sachet water. She will also use the money to buy a generator so that she can have a constant supply of electricity. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and a generator

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en:
Abiodun A. lives in Igbede in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She sells baby wears. She's been in this business since 2007.

Abiodun is a LAPO client. She needs a loan for $425 to buy more baby wears to sell. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To buy more baby wears to sell.

loans.name: Amina's Twaomba Salama Group

texts.en:
Amina is 36 years old. She is married with three children, aged 17, 6, and 2 years old. She has been a juice, cake, and beans seller since 2005. Everyday, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

Amina now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Maitham, Rahila, Halima, and Mtumwa.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke O. lives in Ilogbo, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 46 years old and married with six children. For a long time, Romoke has been in the business of selling drinks and tissue paper in her shop. Romooke is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client, and she is requesting a loan of $425 USD to buy more tissue paper and drinks to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and tissue paper to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok C. is 24 years old and sells groceries and vegetables from her home. Her business has been around for about 6 years, and she makes US$7.50 profit per day. Selling groceries and vegetables has been a difficult business, as there are many competitors and inflation. She told a loan officer that she has a few customers who take groceries and pay a week later. She has one child who is still too young to attend school. She is asking for a loan of US$1200 to add to her grocery's inventory.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: She is asking for a loan to add to her grocery's inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
Shola Y. is 30 years old and married with a child. She lives in Sabo-Oniba, Lagos State, Nigeria. For the past two years, Shola has been selling tailoring materials. She is also a fashion designer, making lovely Nigerian designs for her customers.

Shola is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. She is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy more tailoring materials to sell. She extends her thanks the lenders that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat (his son is pictured) lives in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1962. He is married and has 2 children. Ten years ago, he started his farming business.  Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy seedlings for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam C., who is 43 years old, grows vegetable crops for sale and typically earns around US $2.4 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chhour Phalla, who is 38 years old, is a construction worker. Sam has three children, all of whom are students, living in Ampil Commune, Siem Reap Province. Because of increasing family expenses due to her husband traveling to work, she wants to purchase a motorcycle. This will both decrease family expenses and help her transport her vegetables to the market. Hence, she now requests a loan of US $300 to add her savings in order to purchase a second hand motorcycle.

loans.use: Purchasing a second hand motorcycle

loans.name: Thi Loan's Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị Loan năm nay 28 tuổi Ms 11040037 là một phụ nữ trẻ nhưng đầy nghị lực. Chị đã từng lấy chồng và có 1 con trai, nhưng vì sống không hạnh phúc nên anh chị đã ly hôn. Hiện nay chị đang sống cùng con trai, hàng ngày chị vừa làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, nhận hàng về nhà làm thuê, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình khá ổn định từ 300.000 VND đến 350.000 VND/ tuần. Chị rất thích hình thức trả dần nên chị đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000 VND để sửa chuồng lợn, mua phân đạm để bón lúa. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Hằng Ms 11040038 vay mức 1.534.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hạt Ms 11040039 vay mức 1.534.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Mỵ Ms 11040040 vay mức 1.062.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • chị Ngô thị Phan Ms 11040041 vay mức 1.062.000 VND mua cám lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Trai Ms 11040021 vay mức 590.000 VND để mua phân bón lúa
  • chị Nguyễn thị Quang Ms 11040042 vay mức 354.000 VND để mua thức ăn gia súc
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn thị Loan is 28 years old. Despite her young age, she is full of energy and has a strong will. She was married and has 1 son but things did not work out with her husband so they divorced. She is living with her son. Everyday she works in her rice field, raises pigs, works as a contractor at home. Her income is stable, 300.000 - 350.000 VND a week. She likes SEDA program a lot. She is applying for a loan of 3.186.000 VND to repair the pig pen, buy fertilizer. Other members in her group are:
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Hằng, she needs 1.534.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Hạt, she needs 1.534.000 VND to raise pigs
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Mỵ, she needs 1.062.000 VND to buy breeding pigs
  • Mrs Ngô thị Phan Ms, she needs 1.062.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Trai, she needs 590.000 VND to buy fertilizer
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Quang, she needs 354.000 VND to buy feed for her livestock

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to raise pigs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita O. lives in the satellite town of Badagry, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 38 years old and married with four children. For a long time Rita has been in the business of selling clothing, shoes, and jewelry. The demand for her products is high.

Rita is a leader of a lending group under LAPO Microfinance (Lift Above Poverty Organization), and she is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy more clothing to sell. She remains grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Iwedike

texts.en:
Iwedike I. sells all kinds of women's and men's clothes ranging from suits to shirts, trousers, etc. The demand for her clothes is high. She has been in this business for the past 2 years. She is 23 years old and single.

Iwedike is a LAPO client. Iwedike lives in Ilaje, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more men's and women's clothes for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more and clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria O. sells drinks and cooked food in her shop. Maria is a LAPO client. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 43 years old and she is married with 5 children. Maria lives in Satellite town, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sale. This she says will expand her business and increase her business productivity. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy drinks and food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica O. lives in Satellite town, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a widow with 4 children and she sells drinks and food items in a canteen. Veronica has been in this business since the year 2002. She is a leader in a lending group under LAPO MICROFINANCE. Veronica is 59 years old and married with 4 children. She is very determined to pull her family out of poverty. This is shown in her struggle to provide shelter, feeding and accommodation for her children. Veronica is requesting a loan for the  amount of $425 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs so that she can increase the productivity of her business. She says thank you to all.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food stuffs

loans.name: Ea

texts.en:
Mrs. Ea O., 52 years old and a widow, is a grocery seller. She sells a variety of kinds of food such as oil, eggs, vegetables, and other ingredients for cooking food. She has been selling since 2006 and typically earns around US$ 3 per day.

Mrs. Ea O. has five children, one is married and others are younger and stay home. Two of them are construction workers. To increase the inventory of her grocery and make more profit, she would like to request a loan of US$ 100 to purchase grocery items.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria N. lives in Tedi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions such as toothpaste, detergents, etc. and drinks. She has been in this business since the year 2003. Gloria is a LAPO client. Gloria is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Буриевой Фотиме 52 года, замужем. Она занимается оптовой продажей конфет. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 2003 году с небольшого количества кондитерских изделий. Данный момент она торгует на оптовом рынке «Солор» города Душанбе. Каждый день с ближайших районов приезжают клиенты, чтоб закупит у нее товар. Фотима закупает товар с поставщиков из Турции и Ирана, иногда с фирм. У нее много клиентов.  В ее ассортименте разновидность конфет производства России и Ирана и Турции. Также в продаже имеются конфеты местного производства. 
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть закупа разновидностей конфет хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fotima B. is 52 years and is married. She is a wholesaler of candy. She started her business in 2003 with a small quantity of confectionary products. Today, she sells her products at the wholesale market “Solor” in Dushanbe. Everyday customers come from nearby areas in order to purchase her products. Fotima purchases her products from suppliers from Turkey and Iran and sometimes from firms. She has a lot of customers. Fotima’s product assortment includes candy made in Russia, Iran and Turkey, as well as candy made locally.

In order to increase her product assortment (purchase different types of candy), Fotima would like to take out a loan for 4100 somoni which she will pay back over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assortment of candy

loans.name: Thi Thao's Group

texts.vi:
chị Ngô thị Thảo Ms 09020015 năm nay 29 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị có rất nhiều hoạt động tạo thu nhập như : Làm ruộng, bán thịt lợn, gà, vịt, chim....còn chồng chị thì làm nghề mộc, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị thu nhập từ 150.000 VND đến 200.000 VND / ngày. Chị đã tham gia vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt, chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ và mua máy để cho chồng làm mộc. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên :

  • chị Đỗ thị Thu Ms 09020019 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua thức ăn gia súc
  • chị Lê thi Hương Ms 09020017 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để sửa quán bán hàng và chăn nuôi gà đẻ
  • chị Lê thị Mơ Ms 09020036 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để chồng phát triển nghề mộc
  • chị Nguyễn thị Ngân Ms 09020020 vay mức 590.000 VND mua vải may quần áo bán.
  • chị Vũ thị Thuý Ms 09020014 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mở rộng cửa hàng thuốc
  • chị Nguyễn thị Loan Ms 09020018 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Ngô thị Hiến Ms 09020016 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để phát triển nghề mộc
texts.en:
Mrs Ngô thị Thảo is 29 years old. She is married and has 2 young children. She and her husband do all kind of things to generate income: farming, sell pork, chicken, ducks ...her husband is a carpenter. Her family income is 150.000 - 200.000 VND a day. She has already paid back successfully her first loan. This time she is requesting 4.256.000 VND to buy goods and tools for her husband. Other members in her group are:
  • Mrs Đỗ thị Thu Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND to buy feed for her livestock
  • Mrs Lê thi Hương, she is eeking 4.256.000 VND to repair her store and to raise chickens
  • Mrs Lê thị Mơ Ms, she is seeking 3.186.000 VND for her husband to expand his wood shop
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Ngân, she is seeking 590.000 VND to buy fabric to make clothes
  • Mrs Vũ thị Thuý, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND to expand her store
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Loan, she is seeking 3.808.000 VND. She sells basic goods
  • Mrs Ngô thị Hiến, she is seeking 3.808.000 VND. She is a carpenter

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vay vốn kinh doanh buôn bán

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea C., 23 years old, is a grocery seller, while her husband is a photographer for wedding ceremonies. She has been married since 2006 and has one child. They live in Kantreang Commune in Siem Reap Province.

Due to the increasing number of customers for her husband's business, she would like to request a loan to purchase a new camera instead of their existing old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new camera for her husband's business

loans.name: Nkiruka

texts.en: Nkiruka E. owns a supermarket. She sells drinks, provisions, wines and  drugs. She opens her supermarket daily from 8:am-6pm.  Nkiruka is a LAPO client. She is 33 years old and married with a child. She lives in Ojo Alaba, Lagos State, Nigeria. Nkiruka needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more drinks, provisions and cosmetics for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, cosmetics and provisions for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine O. sells foodstuffs like vegetable, palm oil, garri, plantain, etc. Josephine has been in this business for a long time. She is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She is a client of LAPO. She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She says this will increase her sales and she will be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim C., 29 years old, grows vegetables, as well as being a construction worker. She earns around US$4 per day. Her husband, Mr. Hun Han, 40 years old, is also a construction worker. Kim has one child and they live in Ampil Commune, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

Because of increasing expenses for transportation and traveling to work, she is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase a used motorcycle for her family. She can use it to transport her vegetables to sell, and to reduce her family's traveling expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en: Sabuhi is a married man, and he has one child. He was born in 1980, and he lives in Baku city. Though he is a young man, he has already been in this particular business for 4 years. Now, he is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy additional foodstuffs to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Greetings from Evariste & his wife in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Evariste is 44 years old, married with 6 children.

Evariste buys bananas in markets and sells them to a brewery company that makes banana beer, a favorite local drink. His wife operates a bar and a small shop in Gisenyi town. He earns about US$ 37 every month from his business.

Evariste is requesting a loan worth 203 620 frws (US$ 375) to buy more bananas to be sold at the brewery. The loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: buying more bananas to be sold to the local brewery

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena U.  sells clothes, perfumes, jewelry and wrappers. She cooks foods like amala, a yam dish, and fufu, a vegetable porridge, rice, and beans. Philomena is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Iba, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more clothes, perfumes, wrappers (sarongs) and jewelry for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, perfumes, jewelry and sarongs for sale.

loans.name: Ajibola

texts.en:
Ajibola O. is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Egan, Lagos State, Nigeria. Ajibola sells foodstuffs like garri, plantains, yams, and coco yams, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO client.

Ajibola needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible. She says that this will increase her sales and her profit.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale
